story:
Caitlyn, What are you doing??

I am subletting my Oakland flat for four months and taking off on a bicycle with a pack of friends, a notebook, and a pencil. I have no idea what this journey will "produce." I will go and see what I shall see. I hope to find myself on unexpected adventures with new friends; I imagine that I will discover new ways of seeing the world and the people I share it with; I know that I will come back with notebooks full of writings, wacky tan lines, and crazy strong quads. 

We will depart Oakland in mid-June and head east toward the foothills of the Sierras, then climb northward, landing in Ashland, Oregon, the first week of July. From there we'll continue north, make a right turn at Portland, Oregon, and head east across Idaho and into Montana. From there: Missoula (and the Adventure Cycling Association's Headquarters!) Glacier National Park, the Northern Plains and Great Lakes. Then northward to Canada to explore the Quetico Wilderness in southern Ontario and Quebec; then to Montreal...and finally...south, to end in Bar Harbor, Maine. Then the Amtrak back home! A more comprehensive list of cities we'll pass though can be viewed on my website: 

http://caitlynperrylouchard.com/bike-odyssey/

 

Why $5,000?

First of all, I need a new bike!

I also need touring gear, maps, and provisions for four months on the road. 

If I exceed my goal of $5,000, I will donate to Biketopia, a volunteer-run bicycle cooperative in South Berkeley, CA.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Re-post this link to facebook and other internet places.

You can also...come with me!

You can hop on the Odyssey at any point! Depart with us in Oakland and go the whole way, or hop on in Ashland or Portland Oregon or Missoula Montana or Ontario or Quebec! Ride for a day, a week a month...it will be a grand adventure. Check out the route!

http://caitlynperrylouchard.com/bike-odyssey/

story:
Send us to CUPSI!

We are Jalem, kat, Cassandra, Henri and Bex, five spoken word poets who believe in challenging our audience and each other to work toward change. Spoken word is a type of performance poetry, and a poetry slam is a competition for spoken word. 

We are all students at Harvard College, and are part of an awesome organization called 'Speak Out Loud' (SOL). We are hoping to represent Harvard SOL at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) in 2014. In March 2014, CUPSI is in Boulder, CO and we are traveling there from Boston, MA. We need your help getting there!

While money and Harvard are usually closely associated, SOL (and spoken word in general) is new to the school so opportunities for funding are very limited.  The awesome thing is that they have covered our registration fee, but now we're on our own in getting there. That's why we have created this campaign. We're not only relying on this to send us to CUPSI, we also hope that it will demonstrate how important spoken word is to us and our community so that Harvard will more enthusiastically fund future spoken word student endeavors. 

What We Need 

We are trying to raise $4000! Here's where it's going to:

  • Roundtrip airfare per person (5 of us plus our coach!): $400x6=$2400
  • Accommodation at CUPSI: $900
  • Food at CUPSI: $350
  • Travel within Boulder: $350
If you give $10 or more, we have some fun perks lined up for you to show our appreciation. Having said that, every dollar you give matters! We appreciate and are grateful for contributions of all sizes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we love you anyway!

  • Help us by sharing this with your friends
  • If you are in Boston on February 28th, come support us at our showcase

story:
Short Summary

 

My son Cole was born 3 months early after only 27 weeks in the womb.  He had stopped growing at 24 weeks.  When he was taken by emergency C-section he weighed only 1 pound 0.08 ounces and was 11 inches long.  He went straight to the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU).  Cole spent 98 days in the NICU.  For the first two weeks of Cole’s life we could only give him hand hugs on his head and body while he lay inside of an isolette.  We learned that the skin of such a small baby is very thin and touching it could hurt him.  

Cole was released from the hospital and had been home for only ten days when we had to take him back for surgery to correct a digestive problem.  After a few days home again, Cole stopped breathing shortly after a feeding; my wife had to perform CPR to revive him.  The paramedics arrived and Cole was rushed back to the hospital.  We continue on this roller coaster ride that is “normal” in the life of a very premature baby. Every day seems to come with new challenges and obstacles.

I wrote “Coley, The Mightiest Penguin of All” while spending time in the hospital when my son was having a good week.  Working on this book has been a good way for me to help deal with the stress of my son’s health and my family's situation.  I illustrated the book, but I am in no way a professional artist.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I want to give back to the charities that have helped my family so that they may continue to help other families.  I set the goal at $500 and will donate a minimum of $250 to these worthy causes.  

Where the money goes:

For every $2 dollars donated, $1 dollar goes to one of three charities; the March of Dimes (who were very prominent in the NICU and absolutely amazing with their help to the families), Graham's Foundation, and Spare Key.  All three do great works and need to continue helping families who are on the same type of roller coaster ride we are on.  The other $1 will be used to help with expenses that have arisen for the care of our son.  We were comfortable financially before Cole’s birth, but now with the medical bills and the needs of a premature child, that comfortable is a thing of the past.  Due to Cole’s needs, my wife has had to quit her job in order to stay home to take care of him. Although it was difficult for us to accept, we applied for social assistance, but were rejected for the major programs like Medical Assistance and state health care. In an effort to try and meet the added expenses, I have been forced to look for new ways of adding to our family income.  So many people who read my daily entries in Cole’s Caring Bridge Journal provided encouragement for me to write more.  I am already planning a sequel to “Coley, The Mightiest Penguin of All”. Donating $2 or more will get you a copy of the book in whatever desired electronic format you choose (epub, pdf, kindle, etc.) and your name written on the thank you card I will present to the charities.  After the end of this campaign on August 30, 2013, I will post a picture to demonstrate that I did in fact donate the money and cards with a complete list of all donors.

There are so many families that are going through what my family is going through, many have it muchworse than we do.  One family we got to know in the NICU lost one of their twin girls and the other was constantly in surgery.  Its families like this that these charities help. I want to help them continue their mission.  If you can't donate, it helps if you like the charities such as the March of Dimes and Graham's Foundation on Facebook.  Learn more about premature babies, they are born a lot more frequently than you think.  When I have told people about my son, I was amazed at how many people told me about a relative or friend who had a preemie. 


How and when you will receive your book:

Once you donate, please message me on facebook at www.facebook.com/garrett.rimnac with your email address and your preferred file type for the book (pdf, kindle mobi, ibook/nook epub, etc) and I will send it to you within 24 hours.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, welcome to ATK Magazine's first Indiegogo campaign. I'm Cindy, the founder, editor, main writer and chief bottle washer here. If you've never visited our website - ATKmagazine.com - you really should! We have all kinds of fun articles about Korean culture, food, films, and of course, music. We've always been a free magazine but to continue growing and providing our lovely readers with great content, we need YOUR help!

What We Need & What You Get

We've been given press accreditation for this year's South by Southwest (so excited, the big leagues) to cover the 15 fabulous Korean bands and singers who will be performing. 

Once the excitement had died down, reality set in. We don't have a travel budget, ATK Magazine is fueled by passion, love and enthusiasm. So we're turning to our friends, family, lovely readers, music lovers, and anyone willing to help - we're turning to YOU!

You see, we're in Toronto, Canada and SXSW is in Austin, Texas. This means I need to book a flight ($500-600), a hotel room ($550), get some US data ($50), and other travel expenses like food and ground transportation ($200). 

Help us fund our trip to SXSW 2014 so we can bring you more articles about Korean music, more interviews, and more in-depth coverage of how Korean music is being received in North America.

But of course, if you help us out, we've got you covered with some cool perks - even some that you can't find anywhere else!

The Impact

You wouldn't just be funding our trip to SXSW, you'll be helping us jump start our inaugural digital issue of ATK Magazine. You see, one of the topics that ATK Magazine writes about is Korean music. We not only love it ourselves but we want to help promote it and encourage Korean bands to not only come to North America more, but to come to Toronto more. But in order to do that, we need to see more concerts and bands. This is why we're so excited about going to SXSW - there are 15 Korean musicians this year!

We won't just be bringing you concert reviews and interviews of the 15 bands. We'll use that as the backbone for our first ever digital issue of ATK Magazine, which is of course, music focused. We're starting 2014 with four digital issues (quarterly), each with it's own focus - music, film, food and culture. This will be something tangible that you can download and read on your smartphone, tablet or computer. And if you donate at the $100 level, you'll get a limited edition version with extra features, articles and pictures.

And this project and trip isn't just for us - or for our Toronto readers. The content we'll publish - whether in regular articles or our digital edition - will be available to readers everywhere. 

Plus while we're never run a fundraising campaign before - all expenses up to now have come from Cindy's pocket - we've been writing and publishing articles on Korean culture since 2011 so we know what we're doing. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Share our campaign on Tumblr, post it on Twitter or Facebook. Help us get the word out!

Thanks so much!!

Anandrutu (season of joy) is group of creative people who involved in lots of creative activities such as online book publication, audio story creation, short film making, movies, plays  and various creative cultural event management. Anandrutu E-Magazine is leading E-Magazine in Marathi internet world.

     Anandrutu is known for its transparency and quality delivery. We have a quest for innovative and likeminded people who can involve in innovative activities.

     Innovation, Creativity & Quality, these words are apt for any Anandrutu project.

     Now a day, life has become quite hectic and busy. It’s really difficult to get time to read good books. Even if we have books there is not enough time to read it, or if we have time we are struggling to find what to read. Those who are book lovers will surely understand this pain. To meet this challenge Anandrutu has incredible idea! What if story comes in your hand on every Sunday to add up your holiday mood!! To make your weekend more meaningful!

     Aanandrutu’s next project is recording beautiful and meaningful stories of well-known writers from Hindi and English literature world like Premchand, Saadaat Hasan Manto, Khagendra Thakore, Swayam Prakash, Liladhar Mandloi, Kamaleshwar, Amrita Pritam, Ashfak Ahmad, Alpana Mishr, Aachrya Chatursen Shastri, Ismat Chugtai, Chitra Mudgal, Dwijendra nath Mishr’Nirgun”, Neelam Shankar, Pratibha Roy, Phanishwarnath Renu, Bhagwaticharan Varma, Bhishma Sahani, Manohar Shyam Joshi, Mahadevi Varma, Mrunal Pande, Mrudula Garg, Yashpal,Ravindranath Tagore, R.K.Narayan, Zumpa Lahiri, Mahashwta devi, Shivram karanth, O.V Vijayan, Shashi Deshpande, S.T Vasudevan Nayar, Anand, Earnest Hemingway, Maxim Gorki, U.R Anantmurthy, Edgar Alen Poe, Gabrial Garcia Marquez ,Anton Chekhov, Oscar Wild, Moritsa Jigmond, Chinua Achebe, Fernando Sorrentino etc stories which shows every aspect of life, and make readers to go beyond his tiny world.

Prime Features and motive behind Aanandrutu Audio Stories

  1. Absolutely free!! You can listen, store and share these stories with anyone & anywhere.
  2. Appropriate and attractive background music to every story. Voiced by professional artists to make character alive.   
  3. 15 minutes duration.
  4. MP3 Format - Easily open in any audio player at mobile, browser or off line player
  5. Continues and timely broadcast of story on every Sunday morning at 7:00 AM on whatsApp, Facebook, Tweeter, YouTube.
  6. You can receive story on your registered email.
  7. Stories on various aspect of life and selected from all languages in India
  8. Stories will be recorded in Marathi and Hindi.
  9. It will encourage reading habit in children.
  10. Acquaintance of famous writers belongs to varied culture and language across globe.
  11. It will enrich experience level as a human being.

 Please visit to following link to listen and download promo stories.  http://aanandrutu.com/audio_details.php?title=Latest+Audio+Stories

25 audio stories will require: $2750.

Looking forward for sponsorship, Please feel free to call in case of any query : +919970128964.

story:
Hello and Welcome!

A Note From Core Keepers Publishing Founder, Scott Black: 

Thanks for stopping, my name is Scott Black and I am an author and a 25 year veteran in the wellness industry. Over the last two decades we have all seen the struggles of health related issues in our world and the rise of obesity and disease. Well, I want to do something about it! Will you join me in helping us to reach more people who are struggling with these issues?

The message of health needs to reach the masses and I believe the best and most efficient way to educate a larger audience is through written and visual content such as blogs, newsletters, videos and books. Over the years, I have come to realize that my main contribution in this movement is in launching Core Keepers Publishing. 

Through my own experiences in this industry, I have found that writing a self-help title, producing videos, creating newsletters or editing content can be a time consuming and sometimes daunting task. These little acts, as helpful as they may be to others, end up accumulating pretty quickly and are what I call "time suckers". They can become a distraction and divert our attention away from our main business and loyal clients. What a dilemma! It’s a good thing that we have the solution to your problem.

What Is Core Keepers Publishing?

We do the muck work, while you save the world.

Core Keepers Publishing is a publishing house that helps fitness experts to create books, ebooks, magazines, newsletters and videos. If you are a wellness educator who wants to write a life changing title, we have the resources to publish your book. If you want to send out a weekly newsletter to clients, we've got your back. If you want to create a cool and informative video for your website, don't break a sweat. Save that for your workouts! 

We specialize in making the prospect of creating content doable rather than debilitating. We have a team of professionals ready to help you to get your project going. We are here for you and we want you to succeed. What are you waiting for?


Please Help Us To Launch This Thing!

Your contributions will go towards achieving two things:

1.) Getting our publishing house going with a website and business center creation, as well as marketing materials and printer costs. 

2.) The publication of our next title Strong The New Fit. Releasing this title will help us to market Core Keepers Publishing on an even bigger level. We need funds to cover the cost of content editing, layout, cover design, submission to the printing press, and marketing of the initial book launch.


We Want To Give You Some Perks

We know that you work hard for your money and we want you to know how much we appreciate your contributions to our campaign. Check out our sweet perks on the right side of this page and choose which one fits you best. 

Everyone who contributes receives a free 30-day trial from fitness expert, Fadi Malouf. That's a great deal! You don't want to miss out on this one. 

Read testimonials about Fadis' program here and learn more about him by visiting his website. Check out the video below to learn more about the free 30-day trial. 




We Put Our Money Where Our Mouth Is

A lot of people are trying to raise money for something, but we want you to know that we already have the drive, the experience and the credibility in order to achieve what we want to achieve here. 

Check out our titles that are already published or are in the process of being published under Core Keepers Publishing. 

Titles We Have Already Released:

Living On High Speed by Scott Black

Titles That Are In The Works:

Strong The New Fit by Fadi Malouf

As Well As:

"Body By Fadi" co-written by Scott Black & Fadi Malouf

"The Body By Fadi Tales" by Scott Black

"The Veil" A Novel by Scott Black


Other Ways You Can Help

1.) Promote

If you want to support this project, but don't have the funds, please spread the word about our campaign by sharing this link: http://igg.me/at/corekeepers/x/5761616

2.) Write A Review

Hello and Welcome!A Note From Core Keepers Publishing Founder, Scott Black: 
Thanks for stopping, my name is Scott Black and I am an author and a 25 year veteran in the wellness industry. Over the last two decades we have all seen the struggles of health related issues in our world and the rise of obesity and disease. Well, I want to do something about it! Will you join me in helping us to reach more people who are struggling with these issues?The message of health needs to reach the masses and I believe the best and most efficient way to educate a larger audience is through written and visual content such as blogs, newsletters, videos and books. Over the years, I have come to realize that my main contribution in this movement is in launching Core Keepers Publishing. Through my own experiences in this industry, I have found that writing a self-help title, producing videos, creating newsletters or editing content can be a time consuming and sometimes daunting task. These little acts, as helpful as they may be to others, end up accumulating pretty quickly and are what I call "time suckers". They can become a distraction and divert our attention away from our main business and loyal clients. What a dilemma! It’s a good thing that we have the solution to your problem.What Is Core Keepers Publishing?We do the muck work, while you save the world.Core Keepers Publishing is a publishing house that helps fitness experts to create books, ebooks, magazines, newsletters and videos. If you are a wellness educator who wants to write a life changing title, we have the resources to publish your book. If you want to send out a weekly newsletter to clients, we've got your back. If you want to create a cool and informative video for your website, don't break a sweat. Save that for your workouts! We specialize in making the prospect of creating content doable rather than debilitating. We have a team of professionals ready to help you to get your project going. We are here for you and we want you to succeed. What are you waiting for?Please Help Us To Launch This Thing!Your contributions will go towards achieving two things:1.) Getting our publishing house going with a website and business center creation, as well as marketing materials and printer costs. 2.) The publication of our next title Strong The New Fit. Releasing this title will help us to market Core Keepers Publishing on an even bigger level. We need funds to cover the cost of content editing, layout, cover design, submission to the printing press, and marketing of the initial book launch.We Want To Give You Some PerksWe know that you work hard for your money and we want you to know how much we appreciate your contributions to our campaign. Check out our sweet perks on the right side of this page and choose which one fits you best. Everyone who contributes receives a free 30-day trial from fitness expert, Fadi Malouf. That's a great deal! You don't want to miss out on this one. Read testimonials about Fadis' program here and learn more about him by visiting his website. Check out the video below to learn more about the free 30-day trial. We Put Our Money Where Our Mouth IsA lot of people are trying to raise money for something, but we want you to know that we already have the drive, the experience and the credibility in order to achieve what we want to achieve here. Check out our titles that are already published or are in the process of being published under Core Keepers Publishing. Titles We Have Already Released:Living On High Speed by Scott BlackTitles That Are In The Works:Strong The New Fit by Fadi MaloufAs Well As:"Body By Fadi" co-written by Scott Black & Fadi Malouf"The Body By Fadi Tales" by Scott Black"The Veil" A Novel by Scott BlackOther Ways You Can Help

story:
Ever since I can remember, Whalemina stood on the corner of beach 95th Street, overlooking the ocean in Rockaway. Growing up, I would see the beautiful mosaic structure and admire it. Images of the sun and moon adorned the Whale, and her smiling face seemed to come to life. I thought she would be there forever. Unfortunately after Hurricane Sandy devastated Rockaway Beach, Whalemina was washed away, pieces of her body dispersed all throughout the streets of the peninsula.

My concern is this: Whalemina’s memory will disappear; the kids of Rockaway will never even know who she was.

In the months after the storm, along with so many things that were lost, I realized that Whalemina could not be one of them. And so, I want to bring her back to life.

                                                                  * * * * *

“Whalemina” is a fictional piece, pulling from real events, telling the whole life story of the Rockaway Whale. It begins with her journey from the sea, to the Central Park Children’s Zoo where she was known as Jonah, all the way to her days in Rockaway. It's a story about adventure, wandering, growing up, getting lost, but eventually finding your way back home.

I am lucky enough to collaborate with Artist and Whalemina Creator Geoff Rawling, who will be illustrating every image in the story.

                                                                  * * * * *

So this is where you come in.

Printing and self-publishing a book is not as simple as I thought. In order to print and publish 500 copies, it will cost over $2,000, and I would also like to be able to pay the artist for his hard work. And as much as I hate to ask people for money, I have to admit I could use a little help from my friends. That being said, absolutely anything helps! Whether it’s one dollar or one hundred dollars, I would be super grateful that you care.

This book is being created as a tool to keep a memory alive. Since I graduated, I have been writing both fiction and non-fiction work, but never thought to put anything out there until I had a real purpose, and now I do.

                                                                  * * * * *

As the final step, once this becomes a reality, I want to use the money raised from “Whalemina” to assist in the efforts of rebuilding a new Whale! This is already in the works by Rockaway Locals involved in Projects of Peace, Inc., as they have taken on the task of rebuilding a new and improved Whalemina.

So I’m asking for your help. Let me write a book for Rockaway, and let people know who Whalemina was and make them understand that there are lots of things we might have lost, but the magic of a memory isn’t one of them.

story:
Our Story


When my Dad was diagnosed with and then died from liver cancer within a week I had no intention of writing about it whatsoever. Then, I just woke up one morning, went into auto-pilot and started typing.

The result is ‘Seven Days to Say I Love You.’

‘Seven Days to Say I Love You’ documents the week in which my father died. It’s kind of a love story, and while it’s also an incredibly sad story, I hope people find it, in parts, uplifting and inspirational. It deals with things – death, loss, growing older – that most of us have to face at one time or another, and I hope these are subjects that I have written about in a way that people can relate to and understand.

I have self-published the book on Amazon Kindle where it has received some really great reviews. This is the one I like best…

 

‘I took the decision to read Seven Days to Say I Love You' for probably the wrong reasons - I have liked Ashley Hames for a while due to his previous works, I thought he was a no nonsense, straight talking cool dude. I figured anything that he had wrote and published would be to my liking.

I decided one Saturday night that I would buy it. That night I did not sleep. I was so compelled by the book that I could not put it down. Utter brilliance, heartfelt and meaningful, I was truly inside the writer’s mind from beginning to end. I'm not a crier, I never cry at films, books, or TV shows - that is until now. To say I shed a few tears is a massive understatement: I wept buckets. Each time I composed myself enough to continue reading I would get through a couple of pages and start crying again. I gained a whole new perspective of life.

This book will make you cry, laugh, and experience emotions that you may never knew existed.

Well done and thank you Ashley, I know that wherever Hamesy is and whatever he is doing he is one proud father, and so he should be.’


The Impact

I am using this site in the hope of funding a self-published paperback copy of my book and to launch an advertising campaign to get it noticed where people can see it and read it. Not everyone has a Kindle and not everyone likes reading off a computer. For those who prefer a traditional reading experience, it's essential for me to publish an affordable paperback version of the book.

What We Need & What You Get

I am aiming to raise $15000 - most of which will be used to pay for an independent publishing house to get a paperback version of the book out into bookshelves and made available on amazon and other book-selling websites. A large proportion of the money will be targeted towards an advertising campaign to ensure the book doesn't just become available but actually gets picked up, chosen and read. Any additional funding will be used to help write a film script based on the book.


Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to sample or download the book off amazon.com / amazon.co.uk or smashwords.com. Oh, and please tell your friends and Facebook Share if you think they might be interested. Thanks.

story:
Check out my Website under construction.

TSPENN.COM/GAZGUIDE

It is a small 1 page snapshot of what is under construction.

 

The Gaz Guide to Scrap Metal Profits

 

·        “The Definitive Soup to Nuts Guide to Cashing In on Scrap Metal Recycling”

·        “No More Excuses, Getting Paid to Save the Planet!”

                  “Environmentalist and Capitalists Embrace in a Perfect Storm”

 

NOTE!!! Check my Gallery of images for recycling tips to increase your profit and info on things you will learn in my book! Updated often!

My Story

“You cannot fine or guilt people into going green. All you create is a deeper aversion to governmental control over our personal lives. If the Green Movement really wants to get the average American onboard…pay him. Not with a new government program, but by educating people to the mutually beneficial opportunity in recycling.”  TS Penn, Introduction from “The Gaz Guide: No More Excuses, Getting paid to save the planet!”

 

I ran into friend who showed me a way to make enough money to get by and sometimes,… even better. I was already somewhat familiar with scrap metal recycling from back in the 1970’s. I grew up with a couple brothers whose family owned a Jersey junkyard… flash forward 25 years, now it is an Auto Salvage Facility. About 5-6 years ago, things took an unexpected turn. As we entered the economic recession, the prices paid for scrap metal began to rise to historic levels. Today that market is still booming. I am still amazed when I see an average person pull up with a late model car with a trunk load of copper pipe and walk away with $500 or more. The big trucks of scrap metal are now joined at the weigh in scales by Cadillacs, mini-vans, cars, and pickup trucks. In my book you learn it all. You will be amazed by the money you are throwing out, or worse yet, PAYING the local recycling company to take away literally hundreds and probably thousands of dollars worth of scrap metal. They of course WILL NOT be big fans of this book.

 

            I have done quite a bit of writing over the years, from freelance articles, political blogs, business plans, press releases, marketing materials, website content, screenplays and more. I started writing the Gaz Guide about 2 years ago when the scrap metal market was crazy and I needed to find a source of income as the economy crashed. The lines outside metal recycling facilities were long… and today I see the same thing once again: elderly people in Cadillacs with garbage bags of aluminum cans and recyclables; mini-vans with soccer moms with kids in tow bringing in aluminum cans, old aluminum patio furniture, old mowers etc.; teenagers in pickup trucks filled with metal.  The word is out there but still so few know how to optimize their profits.

 

            We are in bad economic times and the future does not look like it is going to get better anytime soon. I am now working to finish the first definitive book on everything you need to know about earning cash through scrap metal recycling. The book is a simple, humorous, and fun read.  Chock full of color photos and providing an eye-opening look at the cash that can be realized by recycling common items.  The book explains, step-by-step, how to make money by recycling. Geared for the nonprofessional and/or beginner, it will teach the reader how to identify the multitudes of metals with ease. You will learn everything you need to know from collecting, disassembling, various scrap items, to transporting, separating and cashing in.  Chapters include information on how a family can earn enough in a year to pay for a vacation, and tips on how to start a small, full or part-time recycling business. I also included a chapter on how scrap metal can be very effective as a vehicle to raise serious money for charities and non-profit organizations.


The Impact

One can argue the semantics and morals behind the motivation to recycle for profit; however, in the end, it is a win-win situation. The Environmentalist and the Capitalist, the far left and far right, in this case, have finally found a common ground. I challenge you to find another scenario where these two opposing social and political worlds will agree. A mutually beneficial idea that actually benefits everyone whether your involved or not.

 

·         The more people who get involved… the cleaner the planet becomes.

·         The more the concepts spreads, the less recyclable waste will end up in landfills. The earth will be cleaner, and new products will be made, not from virgin materials, but from the materials we have been paid to recycle!

·         The more people involved creates…spendable income. This is true private market economic stimulus.

·          The more people recycle; more jobs are created to handle the increased volume of materials being recycled. These jobs range from handling, transport, purchase and sales, and even new equipment manufacturing and purchases. Jobs ranging from labor to management level. Jobs that cannot be outsourced overseas.

·         More employed taxpayers…a new income source for families during tough times… a cleaner planet, and more private sector jobs created. Sounds to me like a pretty good for everyone!

           

            The concepts and information in this book will have an impact of the lives and income of the reader. Furthermore, it will have an impact on the planet and those of us who call earth home.


My End Goal

                       

 My goal is two parts.  The first part is to finish and self publish this book. Finding a publisher would be even better, but I want to get it out in the market as quickly as possible. The second part is to start a new company that will provide complete soup to nuts, recycling fund raising campaigns for charities and non-profit organizations such as the Adult work program for the disabled like the one my daughter is currently in. We would provide everything from the marketing to the trucks and bins, pick-up, separation, and transport to the recycling facility. We would work with major local corporations to encourage them, and their employees to donate recyclable materials for the charity or non-profit.

 

            I already have made contact with a school that also runs an “Adult Work Program” for the disabled as well as non-profit organization that assist our returning military veterans interested in arranging various outdoor activities and trips such as hunting and fishing, and camping. Both have expressed a sincere interest, excitement to get started as soon as I can get the company up and running.

 

            This book is the first step. Charities and Non-Profit organizations have suffered from a major drop in donations due to the economy. I have a personal connection to the mentally disabled and military veterans. I see and hear on a daily basis about the needs I could help provide. I guess I could have added this to my section on “impact”. But the company will be phase II and will require quite a bit more funding than I am asking for the book.

 

            I am asking for funds to complete and publish the book. Hopefully, it will help me get started on the fund raising business. Maybe I will do a campaign for that if there is an interest here. Wow. Making a living by helping others…how cool would that be.

About Me:

 

            My name is Tracy Penn. I am a 51-year-old man who has raised a now, 27-year-old mentally disabled daughter. Over 15 of those years as a single father. I have worked as an entrepreneur, a carpenter, a writer, a commer

story:
Short Summary

The Cultural Gutter was created in the early years of the new millennium to fulfill a dream--provide quality, clear-eyed writing about disreputable art. Since 2004, we have written about videogames, comics, science fiction, fantasy, genre film, romance and television. And throughout that time, we have maintained a commitment to paying writers for their work.

In summer 2012, like many other arts organizations, we lost our Canada Arts Council operations grant. The legions of mazer tanks surrounded the vulnerable Cultural Gutter. But that fall, friends of the Cultural Gutter rallied to our Gutter-A-Go-Go campaign to help us keep our commitment to paying writers for their work. While we fell short of our goal, we raised enough money to make and send out all our contributor perks and keep The Gutter going until this June.

Now we hope to rise from the ashes as Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids Again!

 

What We Need

If you contribute to Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids Again, not only will you get the sweet perks that Gutter collaborators have donated, you will also support paying writers for their work and help loose upon the world thought-provoking essays on gutter culture.


We're asking for $5,000, which is what we need to pay writers and publisher for one year at $80/article + banking and electronic transfer fees. If we don't make our goal, we will use your donations to keep The Gutter rampaging across the internet as long as possible.

 

Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids Again Perks

If you decide to get down with Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids again, you can choose from some sweet perks. (See video and pictures of the perks in our gallery):

A lovely Cultural Gutter membership card, your ticket into the exclusive party pictures in our banner, and decryption key, for decoding secret messages on our Sponsor's Page.


Your name immortalized on our Sponsor's Page.

A print copy of The Cultural Gutter book, published by Carnegie Mellon University's ETC Press and featuring articles by Carol Borden, Ian Driscoll, Jim Munroe, James Schellenberg and Chris Szego and featuring very cool infographics by illustrator EJ Lee.

A autographed copy of Evan Munday's young adult novel, The Dead Kid Detective Agency. "the adventures of a sort-of goth Nancy Drew whose friends are all dead, and all died at a different point in Canadian history."

A set of 5 monster ringtones designed by scientician of sound and Last In Space collaborator, Adam Axbey

A copy of Nightmare House, an anthology of short horror films by the Fewdio film collective. It's been praised by Wes Craven himself.

A set of 5 sexy supervillain postcards drawn by Evan Munday. As featured in The Smoking Jacket!

A poster version of our campaign banner, designed by Shelf Life Clothing Company's evil genius Brian Kirby.


The amazing Lea Hernandez has generously donated a 8.5 x 11" print of her painting, "Fishbat & Pandora" from book one of her graphic novel, The Garlicks, about Pandora, a vampire girl, and her famil. Check out TheGarlicks.net for more on The Garlicks and Lea Hernandez!

A small homunculus handmade by Comics Editor Carol (and possibly Screen Editor alex). It is not guaranteed to do your bidding, but it is guaranteed to try. It is, after all, small and clay. It will be chanted over during the dark of the moon in wrongful rites and sent to you wrapped in packaging material to reduce breakage in shipping. It is suitable for service as a shabti after the contributor's death.

A dark blue Moleskine 3.5 x 5.5" cahier notebook with a light blue Cthulhu handprinted on it by The Gutter's own Carol Borden. Perfect for recording the geographies of impossible cities or making lists of materials needed in your unspeakable rituals.

A digital copy of Fox Spirit Books' Weird Noir, an anthology of genrebending fiction including Godzilla detective fiction by The Gutter's own Carol Borden, as well as stories by K.A. Laity, Andrez Bergen, Paul D. Brazill and Christopher Irvin among many more.

A bagged and boarded copy of the Eisner-nominated comic, Shi: Kaidan, autographed by writer Peter Gutiérrez. This collection of weird tales feature the deadly assassin Ana Ishikawa (or, Shi) and includes art by Mike Kaluta, Stan Sakai, David Mack, Galen Showman, Val Mayerik, Jason Orfalas, Jamal Igle, and Jean-Claude St. Aubin. Atomic Avenue calls it a collection of "beautiful, entertaining stories."

The Super Gutter Package: A poster version of the campaign banner; a copy of The Cultural Gutter book; a pocket Cthulhu Moleskine cahier handprinted by Carol Borden; and a papier mache skull featuring facial hair, most likely a mustache, painted on by Carol. Plus, the decryption key, membership card and immortalization on the CG Sponsor's Page

A 5 x 8. 25" journal-sized Moleskine with a print of Cthulhu on the cover handprinted by Comics Editor and Evil Overlord, Carol Borden (SOLD OUT)

 

More perks will be unlocked as Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids Again!


All perks will be shipped to you after the campaign is completed.

 

The Impact

There are a lot of sites promoting geeky culture right now, but we think The Cultural Gutter has a special place as a site that publishes thoughtful writing about pop culture.

We have been around for almost 10 years now and have published work from writers in three countries and multiple cities. We're currently based in Toronto, ON, Canada and Ypsilanti, MI, USA. We have a five year history of successfully receiving and responsibly using grants to encourage thought-provoking writing on disreputable culture.

We have collaborated with and supported: The Buffalo Small Press Fair; the Horrible Imaginings Film Festival in San Diego; The 48 Hour LoFi SciFi Challenge in Toronto; and The Drive-In Mob, a weekly movie tweetalong we co-host with Shelf Life Clothing Company and The Grindhouse Movie Database.  The Gutter was also a founding contributor of the sadly defunct Phantascope, The Secret Sinema Society of Toronto. We've recently joined forces with The Mysterious Order of The Skeleton Suit, a "loose confederation of pop culture writers."

It's an exciting time for us and we'd like to do more! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that times are tough everyone. If you can't make a financial contribution, you can still help us out by spreading the word about Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids Again. Indiegogo provides share tools, so you don't have to go out of your way while still making a huge difference for us.

Every little bit really does help.

Thank you,
All the Critters at The Cultural Gutter.

Short Summary
The Cultural Gutter was created in the early years of the new millennium to fulfill a dream--provide quality, clear-eyed writing about disreputable art. Since 2004, we have written about videogames, comics, science fiction, fantasy, genre film, romance and television. And throughout that time, we have maintained a commitment to paying writers for their work.
In summer 2012, like many other arts organizations, we lost our Canada Arts Council operations grant. The legions of mazer tanks surrounded the vulnerable Cultural Gutter. But that fall, friends of the Cultural Gutter rallied to our Gutter-A-Go-Go campaign to help us keep our commitment to paying writers for their work. While we fell short of our goal, we raised enough money to make and send out all our contributor perks and keep The Gutter going until this June.
Now we hope to rise from the ashes as Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids Again!
 


What We Need
If you contribute to Gutter-A-Go-Go Raids Again, not only will you get the sweet perks that Gutter collaborators have donated, you will also support paying writers for their work and help loose upon the world thought-provoking essays on gutter culture.
We're asking for $5,000, which is what we need to pay writers and publisher for one year at $80/article + banking and electronic transfer fees. If we don't make our goal, we will use your donations to keep The Gutter rampaging across the internet as long as possible.

story:
Parties, dinners, coffee with friends and holidays with family. We all congregate in our kitchens. Those kitchens hold a big magnetic frame, and within that frame we place the things we hold dear. That frame is the refrigerator. And that refrigerator tells our story like a little piece of poetry. We arrange pictures, magnets, quotes, lists, and art on that smooth surface. A son in a basketball uniform, a daughter holding a sunflower. A quote that makes us remember what's important, a magnet from the Salt Mines in Hutchinson, Kansas. Whatever it is, it's important to us, and we are willing (and wanting) to share it with everyone who steps into our home.

There is a universality there, and I believe that the things we all find comforting, personal, and heart-driven live in those stories. I want to collect photographs of those fridges, and the vignettes that go with them, and put them in a book. A minimum of fifty full frontal refrigerators; one per page along with a detail photo, plus a paragraph or two  written by the person who placed the objects. 

I have found great wisdom on the cool, flat plane of a Frigidaire. I have found seriously good art, and cartoons that made me laugh out loud. I have found inspiration when I'm in the doldrums, and curiosity for the story behind the photo of a cat next to a milk truck. I want to grab these little poems from different cultures, classes and ethnicities. I want to compile a book filled with the differences that ultimately show how similar we all are in what we love and value. 

With your help I will be able to get professional design and editing assistance, a light kit for photographing in low-light kitchens, meager travel expenses, an ISBN number, postage, processing and color-correcting high resolution scans of the photos, and publishing a first run of 100 books.

The main challenge for me will be to decide on what refrigerators to photograph and how to collect the stories. I know that I can find folks who would be willing to have their refrigerator photographed, and I believe that the main point of my book is to show the plethora of items we slap on the fridge, and then, using words, show the similarities of what they mean to us. In other words, finding our commonalities through our differences. But another thing that I think is important is the story behind the items, and only the one who placed the pictures and quotes and coupons can tell that story. Before I even agree to photograph a refrigerator, I'll need to feel assured that the refrigerator's owner will write a short vignette to go with it. If the owner needs help with the writing, I'll be right there to help, question and interview. That's my job! My plan is to first create a list of about 100 people I'd like to ask. A few friends and relatives, a few strangers, and some celebrities. Then I'll write a query letter to see if they're interested. I'll need to set a time limit and let them know I have a deadline. I believe I have a solid plan, and I'll go with the responses I get and then send out some more queries if need be. Then on to the publishing, which I should be able to navigate as I have one book published, and I also know how to explore the self-publishing world. 

If I don't get fully funded, I will take the funds I do get and start the book. I believe in this project, and will keep working until it's on bookshelves around the world (and on YOUR coffee table)!!! By the way, If I do not get fully funded, Indiegogo takes 9%, whereas if I do reach my goal, they only take 4%. If I get over funded (yay!) I will use the extra funds to work on getting "Ice. Box. Vignettes." published better, faster and bigger!! The more funding I get, the more I'll be able to accomplish. If you choose the front and/or back cover perk, and you live outside of Arizona or Kansas, you will need to supply a quality grade photo of your fridge. 

On my own refrigerator I have a fortune cookie fortune. It's been there for awhile. It inspired me to take a chance. It says, Do you want to be a power in the world? Then be yourself.

If you are inspired by this campaign and feel the book and I can bring insight and fun into people's lives, then please do take a moment to share on your social media with some words as to why someone might like to support this. In addition I would be grateful if you take a moment to email anyone that comes to mind who you think might like to be part of this campaign.

Blessings & gratitude!

(If the little video I made goes too fast to read the cool stuff on the fridge, just click "pause" on the player and you'll have time!)

story:
Short Summary

Raspberry Colored Scars. This book is a collection of poems that works through a series of emotions and experiences surrounding sexual assault. It explores the idea of healing as a process that doesn’t end, but rather builds on itself over time. It also explores the cycle of love that we each experience.

My name is Elisabeth Foster and I am the author of Raspberry Colored Scars. I wrote this book because it is important to talk about healing and love. We are at a point in our culture where we are encouraging and learning from discussion about previously taboo issues, such as sexual assault and mental health.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be able to connect to my feelings and emotions surrounding this topic. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of exploration of emotion and feeling that I have. I hope that you can feel with me in a way that is unique to your own experiences, as well as in relation to mine. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you be more aware and have a conversation with others who have had a traumatic experience.

You will love this book if you enjoy raw, honest emotion. It is blunt, vulgar, superfluous and empowering. Raspberry Colored Scars is a real book that speaks to both victims, their friends/family and perpetrators who are looking at assault through this lense for the first time.

 

The Book - Raspberry Colored Scars

The book is broken into 6 sections...

I. Before: This section addresses the lack of understanding I had about sexual assault before I experienced it. It focuses on the difficulty associated with thinking back to a time before the assault happened.

II. Violation: Violation details the actual events of multiple assaults and the feelings that they create and leave behind. It outlines both a physical and emotional betrayal. 

III. Healing I: This section considers the initial “healing” process that is often synonymous with suppression or denial. It is the facade that you put up for others, but also for yourself.

IV. Passion: Passion outlines the cycle of love - from meeting someone new, falling in love, losing someone you love to starting all over again. 

V. Harm: Harm addresses the physical, emotional and mental harm that comes out of a traumatic experience such as assault. 

VI. Healing II: This section acknowledges healing as a continual process. It encourages the reader to recognize their role in the creation of their own narrative.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

 

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 250 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and a selection of poems from my manuscript, with the opportunity to review and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Elisabeth Foster has studied at the University of Texas at Austin, focusing on government and sociology. She is an Archer Fellow and will be working for Representative Sheila Jackson Lee at her Washington, D.C., office in the Fall. Elisabeth previously worked at Lone Star Justice Alliance where she corresponded with inmates and participated in mitigation interviews and research. She also spent time working at Alexander Dubose Jefferson & Townsend LLP as an Office Assistant and collaborated on a capital punishment case. Elisabeth founded a community organization called Lasting Empowerment for Teen Success in 2017, which sends teams of mentors to volunteer in a local juvenile detention facility in Austin. 

My friends and family have heard me say I was going to write a book since I was about ten years old, so this has been a long time coming. I want this book to spark an internal conversation within my readers, the same way writing it has for myself. 

For more information you can connect with Elisabeth at erfoster52@gmail.com and Instagram @elisabethfoster_.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #RaspberryColoredScars and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support! It truly means the world to me!

Thanks again,
Elisabeth Foster

story:
Story of My Book

Trigger Warning is a poetry book designed to show anyone out there who is going through a rough patch that there is always someone out there who understands and can help them.

 

My name is Harley Vaughn and I am the author of Trigger Warning. I wrote this book because I have battled depression and abuse in my past. I never had the courage to ask for the help I needed, so I am sharing my voice to push others to talk about what is going on in their lives and to seek recovery.

 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that though you feel alone or lost, there are others out there who have been through these battles as well. You will also find that it is possible to get help and get better. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for reaching out. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find your voice and reach out to those around you for the help you need.

 

In this book, you'll learn about personal battles and seeking recovery:

  • Love and Loss and how they can contribute in the downward spiral of our mental health
  • Depression, sexual and physical assault, along with other battles, and how it changes our outlooks on life
  • Finding the courage to say that you are not okay and how to go about recovering

You will love this book if you have dealt, are dealing, or know someone who has had these issues in their life. Trigger Warning is a poetry book that speaks to teens and young adults who are looking at depression and recovery for the first time.

 

The Book - Trigger Warning

The book is written in 4 Parts.

 

Part 1 contains the introduction and Poems 1-5. In the introduction, I share how I personally battled through depression and suicidal tendencies, and how I sought recovery multiple times. These chapters will also show you love and how it can be the start of your mental downfall. 

 

Part 2 contains Poems 6-15. These are based around heartbreak. The reader will learn how heartbreak and personal battles can go hand-in-hand as well as how relationships tend to fall apart when you are in a very bad mental state.

 

Part 3 contains Poems 16-51. This part of the book will look into personal battles such as depression, sexual and physical abuse, alcoholism, eating disorders, rape, and more. It will both educate readers on the dangers and struggles of these issues as well as show them that they are not alone in the things that they are going through or have gone through. 

 

Part 4 contains Poems 52-70 and a hotline page. The last section of the book is constructed of tips on how to get through the recovery process, as well as including reminders and positive notes on how recovery is always possible, even after a relapse.  It is designed to really push them to seek help among their peers. The back of the book also has a page full of hotlines, in case someone needs help, but feels that they cannot reach out to those around them.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Harley Vaughn is a young professional and (now) author who graduated from the University of West Georgia with a Bachelor of Science degree in Psychology and a minor in Sociology. 

 

In a time with an increasing number of people dealing with depression and suicidal tendencies, Vaughn believes it is crucial to raise awareness and get people talking about their struggles with mental and physical health.

 

Though Harley seems to lack the ability to create Serotonin for herself, she loves to make others around her feel happy and safe.

 

For more information you can connect with Harley at ﻿harleyhoo17@gmail.com﻿, on LinkedIn, Twitter, or Instagram @harleyhoo17.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TriggerBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

 

Thanks again,

Harley Vaughn

story:
From the book you will know how high-fiber food, beneficial microorganisms and hypothesis-driven scientific research taught by Tim's Dad allow for finding a magic “silver bullet”. The balanced proportions of "good team" players help them to win a Rap Battle versus very shady germs.

Once, after his short talk in the Pasteur institute in Paris, Dima Alexeev initiated a project on a global geographic mapping of gut microbiome antibiotic resistance. Dima had an honour to be present for breakfast with Professor Dame Sally Davies, an England’s Chief Medical Officer at the British Embassador Residence in Moscow and heard the same worries from her: childhood obesity, antibiotics, junk food. The book is a metaphor for Dima's life. In real life, he is taking the results of his experiences with self-treatment from variety of antibiotic interventions through multi-fiber diet, FMT, products of Most of Trustable probiotic companies, Keto-Genic lifestyle, 96 hour dry fasting and uses those to demonstrate the efficacy of treatment in food and clinical trials with medical, physio and nutrition experts. Dima works at atlasbiomed.com as a consultant. His life is travels from Polar Circle deer herders to South American shamans and communities to observe extinction of indibiome.

Masha Kosovskaya is a professional writer and a mother of two daughters who enjoys - and knows how to - tell kids stories about complex things in a simple way. She says, “When I was working on the book, I discovered may amazing facts about the microbes myself and was astonished by their universe. Surely, I shared the information with my kids - and ‘tested’ all chapters of the book on them - and their amusement was in no way smaller.” 

All illustrations in the book were created by Alla Tyakht - an artist keen on illustrating books with a meaning for kids - as well as for all ages. She collaborates with design studios and journals as an illustratorand takes part in collective exhibitions. Besides the microbial universe, she enjoys travelling and sketching scenic places and interesting people from Europe and Central Asia: allmi.tumblr.com/, www.instagram.com/alla.tyakht

 

Sasha Tyakht is a scientist in the field of microbiome and a chief technology officer of Knomics, a microbiome RnD company. After graduating from a university as a computer scientist, Sasha got inspired by the challenge to use Big Data analysis to help biologists and doctors find the way to control microbiome to make people healthier. Sasha is a scientific editor of the book.

More than 5000 pieces of the book in Russian have been already sold. When we present lectures about microbes at book fairs, schools and elsewhere - there is always high interest - and we would like to share this glow, interest and knowledge about microbes globally.

The money raised will be spent on translating the book and proof-reading, printing at least 2500 books (with prize 20 GBP and book delivery by September 1 for the school start). Thirty percent of book has been already translated and you can see the progress in the instagram of the project. During the course of the next less than 40 days before you see the full moon circle from one beginning to another, you will see remarkable individuals openly supporting the project - for the sole reason "Later is now, now is later".

The project is supported by an independent Russian illustrator Nastya Varlamova at NastyaVarlamova.com and her prints will be used for one of the prizes.

Working together with Dima on the art project, Nastya created images encompassing principles of "Gut-Brain axis" or smooth rich Mucus reminding of Tenerife winter waves. This is it - bacteria should be surfing.

 

Working together with Dima on the art project, Nastya created images encompassing principles of "Gut-Brain axis" or smooth rich Mucus reminding of Tenerife winter waves. This is it - bacteria should be surfing.

 

What will happent with the project in future?

We plan to use not less then 15% of money we earn ater selling first 10 000 copies in UK for the ADHD research using altasbiomed.com technologies and doing it with best doctors from UK. This is around 30 000 Euro and we will be able to get the results for not less than 100 kids.

Other income we plan to use for printing more books and making them cheaper to buy in UK. And finally we are going to translate books into Portugese and Hungarian afterwards. 

Here is us translating the book at Tim's place in London

 

 

Videos

TedXMoscow

Art Sci Nexus (Leipzig)

Scientific Papers

Google Scholar Dima

Google Scholar Sasha

Visual-Information FREE resources created by D&S to spread the awareness about:

Antibiotic resistance - resistomap.datalaboratory.ru

Published data on Disease and Microbiome - biota.knomics.ru

story:
Story of My Book

This is a book inspired by my mother’s immigration story. The book is also a self-reflection on my own life, and a lot of the character’s feelings and ideals are closely influenced by that.

My name is Dylan Luong and I am the author of Bring Your Heart. I wrote this book because I wanted to share these amazing real-life stories that have fascinated me all my life. I want readers to have a better understanding of the sacrifices and reasons that go into becoming an immigrant and how these same situations are still continually playing out in today’s world. On a personal note, I’ve also always wanted to write my own book as well as preserve my family’s story and legacy.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a new perspective on immigration. Rarely do we ever get to hear these types of stories that take us into the perspective of an immigrant. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for storytelling in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become even more aware and educated on the matter of immigration today.

In this book, you'll learn about the struggles of immigration and why immigrants choose to leave their home country:

  • April 30th, 1975 - Fall of Saigon
  • Life on the Boat
  • Surviving on the Island

You will love this book if you love an adventure. This story is very broad in terms of time, places, and experiences. A lot of the things that these characters go through may seem unimaginable — from living in a war-torn country for decades to being stranded on a boat in the middle of the ocean for two weeks while fending off pirates. It’s crazy to think that all of these things actually happened to real people. The journey from Vietnam to America is just the beginning, yet the events that lead up to this momentous feat are unbelievable.

Bring Your Heart is a fiction book that speaks to people from all different backgrounds who are curious about life as a Vietnamese immigrant or want to learn more about the infamous journey to get to America.
 

 

The Book - Bring Your Heart

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 is entitled “Vietnam.” The introduction is a look at the present time when Mei Le, the main character, is an adult living in rural Lancaster, Pa. She has a son who is curious about her upbringing, which transitions the story back in time to when the mom was a kid living in Vietnam during the war. In the following chapters, you will learn about her personality and the people that are closest to her. You get to see family dynamics and go deep inside her thought process. Following the Fall of Saigon, which signifies the end of the Vietnam War, there are time jumps that explain the reasoning for the family’s decision to leave Vietnam and their last few moments in their home country before leaving.

Part 2 is entitled “Boat People.” This is the second act of the story where the family leaves Vietnam in the pursuit of a new home. Things quickly turn south for the family on the boat; they experience food shortages, broken engines, and pirate attacks. All of these hardships are devastating blows to the family, and this section of the book truly depicts the gruesome reality that many immigrants unfortunately face. In the end they are saved, but not without much loss.

Part 3 is entitled “The Island.” After surviving the boat ride, the family now has to find a way to live on Kuku Island. Adjusting to this primal way of living is beyond normal for the family. Life and death suddenly become dependent on crucial decision-making. This section briefly touches on what life was like on the deserted island they lived on for approximately 2 years.

Part 4 is entitled “America.” This is the final act of the story. Throughout these different sections, we have seen the family live in and adapt to different environments. What makes this last part profoundly unlike any other is the fact that they are now the “black sheep.” Building up a new life is already in itself a challenge; add onto that having to learn the language and culture as well as having to interact with the people that already reside in this country. Minorities are always the odd man out, but this holds especially true in Lancaster, Pennsylvania (Amish Country). Vietnamese immigrants are also not regarded highly in America after the country’s controversial involvement in the Vietnam War. Now being fully grown and having lived in the United States for nearly all her life, Mei reflects on her journey to freedom. As a parent, Mei realizes that everything she’s been through was all for her son and that she should continue to share her stories with him to keep her family’s legacy alive.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Dylan Luong is a first-year student at Drexel University majoring in Sports Business and Marketing.

Dylan is passionate about storytelling and creative endeavors that allow him to express himself. Dylan has always wanted to write a book about his mother’s immigration story because he believes that it is an important story to tell.

Throughout middle and high school, Dylan submitted short stories to the National Scholastic Art and Writing Contest. This yearly contest, as well as the support of his many English teachers, are what ultimately sparked his passion for writing. Publishing a book has always been this almighty pinnacle in writing that Dylan hopes to achieve. He is super grateful to be able to have this chance to fulfill a life-long dream of his.

For more information you can connect with Dylan at luong.dylan@yahoo.com and on LinkedIn, Instagram, and Facebook.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #bringyourheart and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Dylan Luong
