story:
Story of My Book

Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a series of stories about my personal journey as a refugee, and about the experiences of many other refugees and immigrants around the world.

My name is Jenaro “Shufto” Olwak Aken and I am the author of Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA. I wrote this book because I wanted to shine a light on my experience as a refugee from Sudan, and on the refugee experiences of many others around the world. We may not have all gone through the same challenges, but we all have gone through difficult circumstances nonetheless. This is just one version of that refugee experience, and it is one you haven’t heard before now.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the world is smaller than most people think. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for life and the human experience. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the refugee experience.

In this book, you'll learn about life in Sudan, Egypt, the US, and perseverance. You'll hear stories such as...

  • My family and my upbringing in Khartoum, Sudan.
  • The difficult decision families make to seek refugee in foreign lands and the challenges they face.
  • The importance of education, opportunity, and community.

You will love this book if you like to learn about different cultures, travel, and believe in possibilities.

Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents and students who want to look at immigration and refugees in a new way.
 

The Book - Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. The first five chapters focus on my family and my childhood in Sudan. I write about my family dynamics and about my struggle dealing with the name “Shufto.” I was a curious child and often got into trouble for being so curious, but my love for education helped me through that difficult time and early stages in my life.

Part 2 contains chapters 6-12. These chapters deal with the early stages of my education, my relationship with my parents, and my family's decision to leave Sudan for Egypt, and life in Cairo. Living in Egypt was a difficult experience for all of us, but particularly for my mother especially after a serious accident. At only ten years old, I tried my very best to support her and the family.

Part 3 contains chapters 13-19. This last part of the book covers our transition from Africa to America. The culture shock, a new language, snow, and the four seasons of Western, New York. I write about the ups and downs of growing up in Buffalo, NY and about the community as well as about the opportunity my family and I were granted to start a new life and make the best of our second chance as a refugee family in the USA.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring 2021.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author


Jenaro Aken is a community activist, entrepreneur, storyteller, and author of the new book Shufto – My Unique Journey from Sudan, Egypt, to the U.S.A.

He wrote the book in order to shine a light on the refugee experience many Sudanese families have gone through over the past two decades. Jenaro is passionate about working within his community with youth and young adults in particular. His goal is to inspire the next generation to take full advantage of opportunities available to them, in hopes of making a positive impact in the world. Jenaro is curious about finding ways to use his life story and experience as a refugee to connect with people interested in helping those of us most in need.

Reading, writing, dancing, and music have been important pillars in Jenaro’s life from a young age. He credits the arts for helping shape the person he has become. Sports, soccer "Futball" in particular is a favorite hobby and has been for a long time. Most friends would describe Jenaro as talkative and a “know it” all, but a humble and gentle soul deep down.

For more information, you can connect with Jenaro Olwak Aken at Olwakjenaro@gmail.com and on Instagram @Olwak_Jenaro.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Shuftomyjourney and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jenaro Olwak Aken

story:
Story of My Book

 

The Catastrophic Mindset is a book about overcoming the ongoing disasters of our world. Through the story of entrepreneurs, you will learn how to survive and thrive through catastrophes that will inevitably occur in your personal and professional lives.

My name is Dimitri and I am the author of The Catastrophic Mindset. I wrote this book because I saw the struggles that people and businesses were faced with through 2020. From Covid-19 to social unrest, 2020 has been a catastrophic year, and moving forward, we will need to prepare our mindset to face the next inevitable disaster.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will develop the catastrophic mindset, and I want to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement for facing your fears that I have. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you be prepared to face the next major catastrophe of your life.

In this book, you'll learn about facing your fears and overcoming disasters. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Elon Musk, who had to make a major decision that could have caused the failure of both SpaceX and Tesla
  • Dr. Ali, who watched as rioters burned down his beloved dental clinic
  • Colonel Sanders, who, after a lifetime of disasters and failures, went on the start the world’s most beloved fried chicken chain at the age of 65, when most people retire
You will love this book if you have faced failures and don’t know how to move forward, if you are struggling amidst the disasters of 2020, or if you need some inspiration to proceed in life.

The Catastrophic Mindset is a nonfiction book that speaks to students and professionals who want to look at overcoming disasters and facing your fears in a new way.
 

The Book - The Catastrophic Mindset


Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-4. You will gain an appreciation of how prevalent disasters are and how much they can affect someone’s life. You will understand why it is so important to develop the catastrophic mindset.

Part 2 contains chapters 5-11. You will learn what the 7 parts of the catastrophic mindset are and read the stories of several high-profile and local entrepreneurs; how they overcame their own catastrophes by using the catastrophic mindset.

Part 3 contains chapters 12-15. You will learn how to develop your own catastrophic mindset at every stage in life from college to retirement.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Dimitri Yang studies neuroscience at McGill University. Due to the pandemic, he is currently struggling through a semester of online classes back in his hometown of Vancouver, Canada.

Dimitri lost his summer internship due to the Covid-19 outbreak. After seeing the same thing happen to many other people around the world, Dimitri was inspired to write about overcoming catastrophes. With such a weird turn of events, Dimitri ended up writing a book rather then spending the summer culturing neurons.

For more information, you can connect with Dimitri at:

  • dimitriyangu@gmail.com
  • https://www.linkedin.com/in/dimitri-yang-ab1013...,
  • https://www.instagram.com/captured_by_dimi/
  • https://www.facebook.com/dimitri.yang.1

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheCatstrophicMindset and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Dimitri Yang

story:
The Story of THE BEAST

THE BEAST is a story about a moody, lost college grad struggling to rediscover what matters to him in a lonely, adult world.

Jared Paulsen hangs everything on the girl of his dream. They’re perfect together, and he looks to the future with infinite dreams and possibilities. All he’s got to do is ask her out before he loses his nerve and his chance.

Devon Hill tries to support his friend, but Jared is keen on leaving him behind if it means getting what he wants. Intentional or not, it still hurts, especially with other things lurking in the background.

After graduation, the two embark on a summer road trip across the USA they’ll never forget.

My name is Scott Mathews and I am the author of THE BEAST.  As an artist and a people person, 2020 was a difficult year for me.  With all the theaters closed and all the people sequestered away indoors, it didn’t take long for me to feel my creativity stagnate and fester. I’ve always wanted to be an author, to be a story teller, and writing this book has given me the perfect outlet for all that pent-up creativity.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover- well, rediscover- what makes you feel whole. I have struggled with feeling empty, feeling incomplete for the majority of the last 15 or so months, trying to redefine who I am on my own terms without other people around. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside Jared and Devon about the importance of not only being about to trust one another, but also being able to trust themselves.

You will love this book if you love character-driven New Adult fiction; enjoy the open road and traveling; want to see two friends strive to be better, especially when it isn’t easy; or love a good bit of banter and some zesty one-liners. THE BEAST speaks to those who have leapt into adulthood and those who are more hesitant to do so, asking them to question what is important and what will be important looking forward.

Ultimately, I hope THE BEAST inspires self-reflection and exploration, pressing questions like: Is love worth losing your friends over? How do you cope with an issue when the whole world feels like it’s crumbling? or What does it take to truly trust another person?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.

What We Need & What You’ll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published.

Tier 2: Hit $7,000 and the book will get a hardcover release.

Tier 3: Hit $9,000 and we'll get an audiobook edition!

About the Author

Scott Mathews is an actor by trade and a grocery worker by night.  He's experimented with writing of all kinds for several years, from short plays to poetry, and is excited for the release of his first novel. He decided to work on this book after several months of isolation in the midst of the pandemic, not only as a means to travel outside the house without actually leaving, but also to explore how people find the strength to endure everything life can throw at them. His passions for character-driven stories and travel both combine to form an exceptional story about self-discovery and growth.

Outside of his work as an author, Scott enjoys bike rides around Boston, seeing all the strange and interesting people a thriving city has to offer, looks forward to traveling again both in and out of the USA. He has a passion for photography, but still has a lot to learn.

For more information, you can connect with Scott Mathews at scottmathewshere@gmail.com and Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/scott.mathews.7921/) or Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/amrealauthor/?hl=en).

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

The Story of THE BEASTTHE BEAST is a story about a moody, lost college grad struggling to rediscover what matters to him in a lonely, adult world.Jared Paulsen hangs everything on the girl of his dream. They’re perfect together, and he looks to the future with infinite dreams and possibilities. All he’s got to do is ask her out before he loses his nerve and his chance.Devon Hill tries to support his friend, but Jared is keen on leaving him behind if it means getting what he wants. Intentional or not, it still hurts, especially with other things lurking in the background.After graduation, the two embark on a summer road trip across the USA they’ll never forget.My name is Scott Mathews and I am the author of THE BEAST.  As an artist and a people person, 2020 was a difficult year for me.  With all the theaters closed and all the people sequestered away indoors, it didn’t take long for me to feel my creativity stagnate and fester. I’ve always wanted to be an author, to be a story teller, and writing this book has given me the perfect outlet for all that pent-up creativity.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover- well, rediscover- what makes you feel whole. I have struggled with feeling empty, feeling incomplete for the majority of the last 15 or so months, trying to redefine who I am on my own terms without other people around. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside Jared and Devon about the importance of not only being about to trust one another, but also being able to trust themselves.You will love this book if you love character-driven New Adult fiction; enjoy the open road and traveling; want to see two friends strive to be better, especially when it isn’t easy; or love a good bit of banter and some zesty one-liners. THE BEAST speaks to those who have leapt into adulthood and those who are more hesitant to do so, asking them to question what is important and what will be important looking forward.Ultimately, I hope THE BEAST inspires self-reflection and exploration, pressing questions like: Is love worth losing your friends over? How do you cope with an issue when the whole world feels like it’s crumbling? or What does it take to truly trust another person?I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.What We Need & What You’ll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

He decided to work on this book after several months of isolation in the midst of the pandemic, not only as a means to travel outside the house without actually leaving, but also to explore how people find the strength to endure everything life can throw at them. His passions for character-driven stories and travel both combine to form an exceptional story about self-discovery and growth.Outside of his work as an author, Scott enjoys bike rides around Boston, seeing all the strange and interesting people a thriving city has to offer, looks forward to traveling again both in and out of the USA. story:
YOU are invited to bring this book to the public by ordering your copy(s) of this book (in soft cover and/or Kindle version) during this fundraising campaign.  You can also support this project by sharing information about this anthology with your friends, family, and communities  through personal contacts and social media. All the material for this anthology is already written and being prepared for publication this Fall.

Together we will raise awareness to  help  the public understand the deeper issues involved in the gender identity political debate and its impact on us all.

Ruth Barrett, Anthology Editor and Project Weaver


ABOUT THE BOOK

This book bears witness and exposes the current trend of gender identity politics as a continuation of female erasure as old as patriarchy itself.  

This anthology brings together voices of forty-six contributors celebrating female embodiment while exploring deeper issues of misogyny, violence and sexism in gender identity politics today, demonstrating the intentional silencing and erasure of living female realities.

These perspectives come at a time when gender politics and profits from an emerging medical transgenderism industry for children, teens, and adults inhibits our ability to have meaningful discussions about sex, gender, changing laws that have provided sex-based protections for women and girls, and the re-framing of language that erases females as a distinct biological class.


ABOUT THE COVER

In my introduction to the anthology, I suggest that origins of female erasure in Western culture was propagated by the framing myth of Adam and Eve, and continues to affect a majority of people on our planet, regardless of whether an individual practices a religion based on this mythology.

The cover image is intentionally complex and multi-layered in its meanings. This classical image of Eve in the Garden of Eden is consistent with her portrayals in Renaissance art as a white European female. Our understanding of genetics today confirming human origins evolving out of Africa, the original “Eve” would surely have been a dark skinned female. Clearly the image does not represent all women in our glorious diversity of color and size. There is a double meaning intended in the cover image as the “white” Eve in the Renaissance portrayal has already been erased of her African origins, and continues to disappear even as she reaches for the fruit from the Tree of Knowledge.

In the Genesis 2 myth, a male God gives Adam, the first man, the power to name all the creatures of the earth, including Eve, the first woman. Adam is given the power by God to name her, and thus given power over the female sex, and given the power to define the very nature of woman. The male's empowerment by God to name the female is intentional and significant. The woman does not name, and thus define, herself. Her nature is literally man-made. The power of naming is a magical act with cultural significance. The power to name ourselves has been historically usurped from women, and over time we have forgotten that we ever had this power to begin with. Female erasure continues to be propagated through gender identity politics today and continuing efforts to define and enforce oppressive gender constructs on the female sex.

The cover for this anthology was created as a gift from my oldest and dearest friend, renown photographic artist Claudia Kunin.


WHAT'S IN THE BOOK?

Through researched articles, essays, first-hand experiences, story telling, and verse, these voices are needed to ignite the national conversation about the politics of gender-identity as a backlash to feminist goals of liberation from gender stereotypes, oppression and sexual violence.

This book is broken down into different topical sections including: 

Biological Erasure by Gender Ideology, Re-Framing Reality and the Language of Erasure, The "Violent" Female Body, A Room of Our Own, Personal Stories from the Belly of the Beast, and Resistance to Delusion. 

Here are some of the titles (not in a final order):

SECTION ONE: BIOLOGICAL ERASURE BY GENDER IDEOLOGY

  • In The Beginning We Were All Female - Monika Sjöö & Barbara Mor
  • The End Of Gender: Revolution, Not Reform - Rachael Ivey
  • The Difference Between Sex and Gender and Why It Matters - Kathy Scarbrough
  • Female Erasure, Reverse Sexism, and the Cis Theory Of Gender  - Elizabeth Hungerford
  • Transgender Rights: The Elimination of the Human Rights of Women - GallusMag
  •  “Transgender Equality Verses Women’s Equality: A Clash Of Rights? Written Evidence Submitted To The Transgender Equality Inquiry – Shiela Jeffreys
  • My Disservice To My Transgender Patients - Kathy Mandigo, M.D.
  • Exiles In Their Own Flesh: A Psychotherapist Speaks- Lane Anderson
  • An African-American Woman Reflects On The Transgender Movement -Nuriddeen Knight
  • Female Erasure: A Sampler - Ava Park 
  •  In The Absence Of The Sacred:  The Marketing of Medical Transgenderism and The Survival Of The Natural Child  - Mary Ceallaigh and Jennifer Bilek
SECTION TWO: RE-FRAMING REALITY AND THE LANGUAGE OF ERASURE
  • Eve Was Framed - Ruth Barrett
  • On Language & Erasure - Hypotaxis 
  • The Erasure of Lesbians - Alix Dobkin and  Sally Tatnall
  • Mothers’ Day: A Story – Joan F. Archive
  • Pseudoscience Supplants Female Athletes' Olympic Dreams - Kathy Crocco
  • Patriarchy In Drag: Sexual Imperialism In Africa, And Delusional Revisionism In The African-American Community - Luisah Teish
  • Transgenderism and the Male Power of Naming – Julia Long
SECTION THREE: THE “VIOLENT” FEMALE BODY
  • The Girls and the Grasses - Lierre Keith
  • The Period Poem – Dominique Christina
  • Mother – Patricia Monaghan
  •  Song For Menopause – Ila Suzanne Gray
  • The Universe Is Her Form - Vajra Ma
  • A Revolutionary Love Letter To Menarche - Monica Asencio
SECTION FOUR: A ROOM OF OUR OWN
  • The Attack On Female Sovereign Space In Pagan Community - Ruth Barrett
  • Why Women’s Spaces Are Critical To Feminist Autonomy - Patricia McFadden 
  • Females Need Our Spaces For Development Of Feminist Consciousness - Carol Downer
  • Transparent: Spitting On Michfest’s Grave – Phonaesthica
  • Ground Zero: The Clash Of Gender Identity Protections And Women's Space - Cathy Brennan
  •  The Undoing Of A Unique Sisterhood - Mara Lake
  • #ApologizeToMichigan - Sara St. Martin Lynne
SECTION FIVE: PERSONAL STORIES FROM THE BELLY OF THE BEAST
  • Reclaiming Female/Speaking Back – Crash
  • “Neighbor Boy” - Temple Ardinger
  •  I Am Not A Waste Of A Woman - Max Robinson
  • The Goddess of Autonomy – Devorah Zahav
  •  Destruction Of A Marriage: My Husband's Descent Into Transgenderism - Sharon Thrace
  • Gas Mark Six – Jackie Mearns
  • The Bathroom - Falcon River
  • Social Work Professor Speaks Out On Behalf Of Her FtM Autistic Daughter – Dr. Kathleen “Kelly” Levinstein

SECTION SIX: RESISTANCE TO DELUSION

  • Gender, Patriarchy, And All That Jazz - Mary Lou Singleton
  • The Surgical Suite: Modern-Day Closet For Today’s Teen Lesbian - Marie Verite
  • Yes All Women - Sara St. Martin Lynn
  • The WANTED Project - Nedra Johnson
  • Females Need Our Spaces For Development Of Feminist Consciousness -Carol Downer
  • Into the Mind of Kosilek: Grace’s Daughter – A Book Review – GallusMag
  •  Radical Embodiment And The Reproduction Of Resistance - Mary Ceallaigh
  • A Creed For Free Women - Elsa Gidlow


ABOUT THE CONTRIBUTORS 

This anthology encourages readers to consider how and why our female bodies matter, and how our bodies inform our everyday lives. Contributors shed light on how the language of gender-identity politics has been purposely used to reframe and replace specifically biology-based realities, reinforcing the destructive hierarchy that objectifies and harms women and children. 

Some contributors connect the momentum of female erasure to the ways we treat our Mother Earth. Others share their personal struggles with being gender nonconforming women, with some sharing their journeys from living as trans men and their choice to de-transition. Some discuss political struggles and triumphs arising from providing female-centered spiritual spaces, reclaiming their female bodies as a source of power and significance, and why it is so important for all of us to consider asking deeper questions about how misogyny, violence, and sexism are being enacted in this issue. 

Contributors come from a wide variety of backgrounds in terms of race, class, religion, sexual orientation, and age (ranging from twenty to eighty-three years old), and live in the United States, Zimbabwe, Australia, and the United Kingdom.  They are lesbian feminists, political and spiritual feminists, heterosexual-womanist women,mothers, scholars, attorneys, poets, medical and mental health providers, environmentalists, and women who chose to de-transition, all providing perspectives that are ignored, silenced, vilified, or underrepresented in the popular media and disregarded in discussions promoting legal protections for transgender persons at the expense of women and girls. Some contributors wrote under pseudonyms to keep their teaching jobs or to protect their children from harassment. 


ABOUT THE ANTHOLOGY EDITOR

Ruth Barrett is an ordained elder Priestess, seasoned ritualist, and teacher in the Dianic tradition where the Goddess and the female body is the central religious metaphor, and rituals exclusively celebrate the female life cycle and support healing and liberation from gender oppression. Ruth has provided rituals and classes in sacred female-sovereign spaces for women and girls for four decades.

Ruth Barrett received her B.A. in Folklore and graduated with honors from the University of California at Santa Cruz in 1976. In 1997 Ruth was honored as recipient of the L.A.C.E. award for outstanding contributions in the area of Spirituality from the Gay and Lesbian Center in Los Angeles. Ruth co-founded Temple of Diana, Inc, a national Dianic Temple, with life partner, Falcon River, where she co-facilitates a women’s mystery school.

She is author of Women’s Rites, Women’s Mysteries – Intuitive Ritual Creation (Llewellyn, 2007), and has contributed to several anthologies, including Stepping Into Ourselves – An Anthology of Writings on Priestesses (Goddess Ink, 2014), Foremothers Of The Women’s Spirituality Movement: Elders and Visionaries (Taneo Press, 2015), and contributed to Women in World Religions: Faith and Culture Across History (ABC-CLIO, Inc., forthcoming 2018)

Ruth is also an award winning pioneering goddess-centered folk musician, mountain dulcimer artist and singer whose numerous recordings beginning in 1981 have been among the pioneering works in the Goddess Spirituality Movement. In 2011, Ruth was honored as recipient of the Jane Schliessman Award for outstanding contributions to women’s music from Women in the Arts.

She was director of the Candlelight Concert at the Michigan Womyn’s Music Festival from 1993, until the festival’s close in 2015. Ruth was honored to be a presenter and performer at the Parliament of the World's Religions held in Salt Lake City, Utah, 2015.

Ruth started Tidal Time Publishing LLC to produce this anthology and future projects.

www.tidaltimepublishing.com

FUNDING 

How The Funds Will Be Used

  • Professional Copy Editing: $5000
  • Cover design: $1500 
  • Interior book design, layout,  printing, permissions: $10,000
  • Marketing and IndieGogo fees): $4,000
  • Technical Support for web development $1000
  • Legal Fees: $3,500

Our initial goal of $25,000 will cover the investment we have already made in bringing this book to the public and to its publication. We are looking forward to launching stretch goals for translated editions, and other exciting related projects. 

The book will be out in the world this Fall!

If you don't see your country in the shipping options, please contract us so we can expand it to the global community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution of any amount is deeply appreciated and will help us reach our goal. This is a grassroots campaign and  word-of-mouth support is also a vital element to our success. 

  • Please tell your friends about this book and campaign. 
  • Spread the word about the book on your social media sites, email and blog if you have one! 
  • Post a message on your Facebook page and post a link to the campaign video.

FUNDING 
How The Funds Will Be Used
  

Professional Copy Editing: $5000
Cover design: $1500 
Interior book design, layout,  printing, permissions: $10,000
Marketing and IndieGogo fees): $4,000
Technical Support for web development $1000
Legal Fees: $3,500

Our initial goal of $25,000 will cover the investment we have already made in bringing this book to the public and to its publication. We are looking forward to launching stretch goals for translated editions, and other exciting related projects. 
The book will be out in the world this Fall!
If you don't see your country in the shipping options, please contract us so we can expand it to the global community.   Other Ways You Can Help 
Every contribution of any amount is deeply appreciated and will help us reach our goal. This is a grassroots campaign and  word-of-mouth support is also a vital element to our success. 
Please tell your friends about this book and campaign. 
Spread the word about the book on your social media sites, email and blog if you have one! 
Post a message on your Facebook page and post a link to the campaign video.

story:
Three months ago, I was sitting in a coffee shop in Elgin with my friend Ransom, discussing the vision God has laid on my heart for the next season of life and ministry. This conversation was especially significant, because my relationship with Ransom started 5 years ago when he was still a sophomore in high school struggling with depression and addiction. He was the victim of abuse growing up, and had particular difficulty in social and emotional situations.

Several years ago when we began thinking about how to help hurting students in our community, the ideas in Luke 4:18-19 were close to our heart. This is the passage where Jesus describes his mission. He states that he came to “proclaim good news to the poor,” “to set the oppressed free,” and “to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.” Matthew 4:23 goes on to describe Jesus’ ministry as “preaching,” “teaching,” and “healing.” He focused on people’s minds, hearts, bodies, and relationships in his ministry, and we wanted to do the same. After seeing a need to address addiction, loss, grief, anxiety, self-harm and other forms of pain (and after much trial and error), Christ Community Church empowered me to launched a program called Regroup.

5 years later, sitting in front of me in the coffee shop, Ransom was now a mature young man, paying his own bills, healthily coping with depression and his past trauma. The difference is stark and the change that took place in his life was not by accident. He spent 2 years using the Regroup tools. He took responsibility for hurt he had caused, learned his identity in Jesus, and he learned how to forgive the people who had hurt him. He was set free, and he wasn’t the only one. 6 students came to our first meeting, but within two sessions, that number had grown to 36 each week. Over the course of 5 years, we ran a new session every 4 months, and even took the program to ministry partners in the Czech Republic. We saw hundreds of students impacted, and whole families transformed.

Now, we’re ready to take Regroup further. We want to empower pastors and leaders across the country to help people find strength together in community, and we need your help. This Christmas, we’re looking to raise $5500 to print 500 books and 50 leader resource guides in order to equip leaders to raise up small groups, train mentors, and encourage hurting people that hope is possible.

Will you consider joining us in spreading God’s hope by giving an additional gift to make this possible?

 

For more information about Regroup, please visit www.regroupmin.com

story:
Birth of a Book

Back in the early 90’s, a congenital hip defect caught up with me and I was forced to give up running sports, so I took up golf.  Working on my game whenever possible, I managed to lower my handicap from 20 to 2, and in 1998 won my first club championship.  Throughout that period, I became fascinated by the mental side of the sport, since virtually every bad shot I hit started with faulty thinking.

Also during that time I became an avid fan of mysteries, thrillers and police procedurals.  Then one night I was jolted awake by an inspiration to write a mental game instruction book woven into a suspense thriller.  I had a stack of instruction books laying around, all chock full of ideas, but none were fun to read.  Most of them read like textbooks with an overwhelming amount of information.  My idea was to offer a series of short, concise lessons through on-the-course interaction between entertaining characters, while at the same time building an exciting murder mystery—a fun read with mental game ideas that a golfer could take right to the golf course.  Those ideas became my “easy golf” strategy.  Virtually all of the golf action and instruction is based on my own personal experience.


The Plot

From the back cover

In the resort town of Bend, Oregon, Andy Harris is mired in a brutal slump. For over a month he’s been grinding away, studying his golf books and magazines, playing and practicing more, but nothing seems to help. Fueling his panic is the upcoming club championship, when he has to square off against a questionable friend who employs an array of gamesmanship to disrupt him when they play. If he can’t fix his game by then, he’s not sure what he’ll do. Maybe swap his clubs for a bowling ball.

Four hundred miles away, Reno Homicide Detective Warren Sutter isn’t doing so well himself. First, there was the phone call from a good friend, whose son has disappeared. Then there’s his new partner, Robert Tensley, a naive rookie detective who has just transferred from public relations. Against his fervent objections, Warren is ordered to mold Robert into a competent detective as they pursue the missing person case.

The detectives soon suspect a homicide when their investigation leads to a crooked casino owner, but without more evidence, they can’t make an arrest. When the victim’s father learns this, he threatens to bring in someone who can get the job done. A few days later, a nameless stranger begins tailing the casino owner, confirming the father’s threat.

  As the Reno detectives build a case for murder, the events there spill over to Bend, pulling Andy into a dangerous world of intrigue that might just hold the solution to his slump. 


What the Pros Say:


Years ago, I contacted a number of golf professionals to get their opinion of Skull Shot.  Here are some of the comments.

"Skull Shot is a surprisingly fast read that moves nicely from a 'mental golf' book to a crime story. I found myself using the term 'easy-golf' in my next few sessions." Jerry Mowlds, Director of Instruction, Pumpkin Ridge Golf Club. GolfMagazine "Top 100" teachers.

“Thank you for the opportunity to preview Skull Shot.  The book was a very enjoyable read with a nice balance of suspense, humor and golf psychology.  I know I will read it again.”  Gus Jones, Head Golf Professional, Martis Camp.

“A one-of-a-kind novel that incorporates golf teachings, both mental and fundamental, with a murder mystery.”  Zach Swoffer, Director of Golf, Brasada Ranch Resort.

“Golfers, a must read. ‘Easy Golf’, a mental golf lesson for all of us.  Mystery, murder, golf; all included in this great story.”  Mark Amberson, General Manager, Awbrey Glen Golf Club.

“Through the years I have seen every golfer struggle with overcoming their own mental obstacles on the course.  Gary’s ideas on ‘easy golf’ will help golfers of all abilities learn to enjoy this great game in a way that is entertaining and simple to understand.”  Wayne Clark, PGA Professional.


Project Status:

I've already published Skull Shot (print-on-demand) and made it available at Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and Books 1-2-3.  Unfortunately, I burned through my available cash to take it this far.  The biggest obstacle now is getting the word out.  No matter how good a book is, if no one knows about it, it will languish forever in obscurity.  I'm hoping to raise $3,500 to cover perks, purchase some targeted advertising and necessary marketing material, garner a professional review or two, enter writing contests and send out review copies to bloggers and other appropriate professionals who can spread the word.
Skull Shot: Gary Levine: 9781600479458: Amazon.com: Books

Risks

Since the book is published, I don't see any risk to contributors.  If a perk involves a copy of the book, you will get it, and fairly quickly.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Persönlich:

Ich bin Zahnarzt, Umwelt-Zahnarzt, Osteopath,  Akupunkteur,  Homöopath,  Manualtherapeut, Kinesiloge mit eigener Praxis und eigenem Dentallabor und besitze einen Onlinehandel für Naturprodukte, natürliche Nahrungsergänzungen. Seit über 20 Jahren bin ich internationaler Referent für diverse Themen der Medizin und Autor vieler Publikationen.

Kampagne:

Leicht zu lesende medizinische Spitzen-Informationen im Abonnement täglich per e-mail! Kurz und knackig.

Hintergrund/ Erfahrung:

Auf unseren beiden Homepages ( www.eymer.de  und www.dolalex.de ) 

bloggen wir (auch auf Facebook und Twitter) seit 3 Monaten schon 3-4 Mal in der Woche sauber und kurz aufgearbeitet neueste Top News aus der Welt der Medizin und angrenzender Gebiete. Dies ist schon international beachtet und wir haben Anfragen, ob man bei uns auch spenden kann. Dieses große Interesse und die Anfragen zu dem Blog, der auch unsere Herzenssache ist, mussten zu dieser Kampagne führen!  

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Wir haben kalkuliert, dass wir 500.000 Euro benötigen. Damit wird ein mehrsprachiges Team ( 8 Personen in Vollzeit, anfangs zum Teil in Teilzeit) mit medizinischer Ausbildung und Spirit für die Kampagne zusammen gestellt.

Es werden entsprechende Räume angemietet in periphere Lage von Hamburg, sowie die Ausstattung und Hard- und Software finanziert. Das  nationale und internationale Marketing soll an entsprechende Online-Marketing-Agenturen vergeben werden und der entsprechende Online Auftritt designed und programmiert werden. Das eingesetzte Geld soll die kompletten Kosten des Projekts für mindestens ein Jahr decken. Parallel wird mit den Informationen eine abrufbare, einfache Datenbank des medizinischen Wissens erstellt.

Ich persönlich muss dabei nichts daran verdienen.

Die News sind einzigartig vom Inhalt, da ich direkten Zugang zu allen wichtigen Datenbanken, Verlagen und Portalen habe. Tagfrische News, kurz und knackig aufgearbeitet und für jeden Laien sofort verständlich, das macht keiner im Moment.

Jeder kann umgehend seinen persönlichen Nutzen davon bekommen. Einfach und einzigartig.

Wenn wir das angestrebt Ziel von 500.000 Euro nicht erreichen sollten, wir nach Abzug der echten Kosten der Kampagne das übrige Geld an 'Hamburg Leuchtfeuer' gespendet. Dies ist eine gemeinnützige Organisation für bedürftige Menschen und Kinder in Not.


Mit der Unterstützung der Kampagne erreichen wir gemeinsam, dass alle Menschen endlich in die Situation kommen, an Spitzen-Informationen und Wissen zu kommen, die sie selbst in Ihrem Leben unabhängiger, selbstständiger macht. Wichtiges Wissen, was auch in unseren Datenbanken aufgebaut wird.

Schon vor und/oder nach jedem Gang zum Arzt  kann der Abonnent eine Diagnose kontrollieren, entsprechende Fragen stellen und sich sicher sein, das das Richtige gemacht wird.

Und jeder Abonnent versteht von Tag zu Tag mehr von seinem Körper, der Umwelt und dem Zusammenspiel im Körper.

 Auch externe Experten sollen dann zukünftig uns Informationen weitergeben können.

Unser bisheriger Blog hat soviel Anfragen bekommen, dass es sein muss, jetzt diese Kampagne zu starten und auf die Reise zu gehen.

Jeder Abonnent kann nur profitieren!

Schaut Euch den bisher kleinen Blog mit seinen wachsenden Inhalten an, Ihr werdet begeistert schon allein vom einfachen und knackigen Schreibstil sein!

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Es wird ein riesiger Berg an Arbeit sein, ein top kompetentes Team zu formen, aber das habe ich in Vergangenheit immer mit viel Spaß und der immensen Freude an Veränderung, Entwicklung, Pioniergeist und stetem inneren Feuer, was Neues zu entwickeln, immer geschafft. Unser jetziges kleines Team von drei Leuten hat derartige Motivation, das jetzige Baby richtig auf die Spur zu bringen: Endlich jedem wichtige Informationen zugänglich zu machen.

Die technische Realisierung ist nur Fleißarbeit.

Es gibt real ein echtes Risiko:

Wir schaffen es nicht,  genug Geld zusammen zu bekommen.

Seit Jahren arbeiten wir auf dieses Ziel hin: diese Kampagne!


    Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

    Wer keinen finanziellen Beitrag leisten kann, kann trotzdem beitragen:

    Unterstütze unsere Kampagne!

    Mach sie bekannt, poste, blogge, mail, sprich darüber! Unterstütze die Idee, sei Teil diese Kampagne!

    Ihr könnt auch hier bei Indiegogo darüber reden und helfen.

    Danke an Alle!

story:
¿Qué es el Festival Todas las palabras, Todas!?

Todas las palabras, Todas! es un festival internacional de narración oral en el Perú, el cual tiene vida todos los años en el mes de Setiembre desde el 2011, año de su primera edición.


Desde su primera edición, cada año, se ha realizado simultáneamente en más de 5 regiones congregando a artistas nacionales e internacionales: narradores, voces nuevas de la oralidad, cantautores e invitados especiales. Ellos tejen una red de presentaciones, talleres, encuentros y más en ciudades, comunidades, teatros, centros culturales, universidades escuelas, centros penitenciarios, etc.


Este es un proyecto de desarrollo cultural con un enfoque de descentralización e inclusión social que busca desarrollarse en cada región, a través de socios co-gestores que nos permitan tener una presencia permanente


El festival es una fiesta de la palabra que busca tejerse cada año de manera comunitaria, creciendo, y llegando poco a poco a más regiones que se unan al sueño de poder contar con un festival que se haga realmente en todo el Perú como un manto tejido a mano que abrigue a todos por igual.

¿Por qué organizamos el festival Todas las palabras, Todas!?

El PERÚ es un país de múltiples identidades, un abanico de sabores, colores, ritmos y tradiciones que en suma nos hacen un país de “todas las sangres”. Como país contamos con una diversidad en recursos culturales e históricos que asombran y educan, así como recursos ambientales que riqueza y belleza; en este marco único se viene realizando en el Perú el Festival Internacional de Narración Oral del Perú: TODAS LAS PALABRAS, TODAS!!!

Buscamos ser un proyecto artístico socio-cultural que sea un ejemplo de: real descentralización e inclusión social para unir, compartir, integrar, sumar y hacer de nuestras diferencias un vínculo; de nuestros idiomas puentes y de nuestros recursos, oportunidades sustentables.

Queremos promover la lectura, la identidad cultural, la diversidad, la integración, la valorización y cuidado de la memoria de los pueblos. De esta forma se trabaja el respeto a las diferencias, el enfoque de género, la educación y el desarrollo económico sostenible.

¿Cómo funciona el festival Todas las palabras, todas!?

Uno de nuestros objetivos es que el festival se co-gestione involucrando a diversos actores sociales donde el festival vaya teniendo presencia y así contribuir a reales procesos de descentralización e inclusión social.

Ya se ha logrado y se ha demostrado que este tipo de co-gestión es posible, donde diversos tipos de entidades (entidades gubernamentales, empresas, organismos de la sociedad civil), asumen responsabilidades, desarrollan capacidades de gestión cultural y de toma de decisión conjunta).Consideramos necesario que el festival contribuya a democratizar el acceso a las expresiones culturales. Dentro de cada región se ha logrado estar presente en diversos espacios para brindar a la población más opciones de acceso al festival. De esta forma se hacen presentaciones en teatros, universidades, escuelas y también en asentamientos humanos, albergues, cooperativas, cárceles (centros penitenciarios), etc.

Las actividades son programadas y difundidas por igual, así ninguna población es tratada como “objeto de una acción de ayuda social”, sino como parte de una programación integral. Se busca alcanzar los mismos criterios de calidad y visibilidad.

El festival desarrollará una estrategia de desarrollo económico sostenible a partir de involucrar activamente a gobiernos regionales, empresas, operadores turísticos, artistas, organismos de la sociedad civil y asociaciones culturales.Se comparten actividades y se logra descentralizar realmente el evento, fomentando que los representantes regionales se apropien del mismo y vean a este no como una “extensión” o una “versión” de un festival desde Lima (la capital), sino que incluso vean las oportunidades que su realización implica.

El festival sensibiliza en el cuidado y promoción de los recursos culturales y ambientales así como la mejor convivencia y el enfoque de género, a su vez genera oportunidades de intercambio, capacitación, desarrollo y crecimiento a los “jóvenes narradores orales” tanto a nivel nacional como internacional.

¿Como te vamos a agradecer?

Hay muchas maneras de agradecer por formar parte de Todas las palabras, Todas!

Queremos hacerte parte del proceso, enviarte actualizaciones que muestre cómo vamos avanzando con el desarrollo del festival, antes del estreno y durante el transcurso de este.

También queremos reconocer tu apoyo en nuestra comunidad en redes sociales y como colaborador en nuestra publicidad impresa.

Para aquellos que quieren recibir una muestra de nuestro agradecimiento y profundizar en el proceso del festival tenemos:

  1. Un susurrador, hecho a mano por pobladores de algunas regiones en donde se realiza el festival. Un susurrador es un tubo de material reciclable que sirven para transmitir poesías o coplas que se recitan al oído, son los  elementos necesarios para transportarse a lugares soñados, sin moverse del lugar. Esta muestra de agradecimientos es válida solo para 5 colaboradores.

  2. Una clase maestra de introducción a la narración  (presencial u online) con un narrador de cuentos profesional. La clase tiene un número límite de 8 alumnos.

  3. Visibilización de tu apoyo en nuestros canales de comunicación. (En caso de solicitarlo)

Por último esperamos que la principal forma de recompensa sea la de hacerse parte de un festival que busca seguir creciendo y expandirse en todas las regiones del Perú.

¿Quiénes somos?

El  festival Todas las palabras, Todas! es organizado por la asociación cultural Wasi, asociación orientada a la integración cultural y social, a través del arte en todas sus expresiones. Esta gran familia sigue creciendo gracias al apoyo de artistas escénicos, diseñadores y comunicadores. Somos una red de organizaciones sociales independientes coordinadas a través de Wasi

"Wayqui" César Villegas - Fundador de la asociación cultural Wasi. 
WAYQUI, que significa hermano en quechua, es un cuentero (o narrador oral escénico), gestor cultural, interesado particularmente en el desarrollo social y practica recientemente la arte-terapia a través de las historias y cuentos. Cuenta con estudios de doctorado en intervenciones sociales (España). Consultor en temas de desarrollo organizacional, aplica la narración oral herramienta de gestión en diversas organizaciones, empresas e instituciones educativas.Es frecuentemente invitado a contar historias y dictar talleres en diversos países, para Festivales Internacionales, Ferias del Libro, espacios de narración, etc. En total hasta ahora frecuenta 18 países de tres continentes: América, Europa y Asía (visitando algunos en más de una ocasión)


Andrea Zárate- Productora de Wasi. Es estudiante de la especialidad de Artes escénicas en la Pontificia universidad católica del Perú

Victoria Zárate- Coordinadora de campañas y recaudación de fondos. Es estudiante de la especialidad de Artes escénicas en la Pontificia universidad católica del Perú.

¿Qué es el Festival Todas las palabras, Todas!?
Todas las palabras, Todas! es un festival internacional de narración oral en el Perú, el cual tiene vida todos los años en el mes de Setiembre desde el 2011, año de su primera edición. 
Desde su primera edición, cada año, se ha realizado simultáneamente en más de 5 regiones congregando a artistas nacionales e internacionales: narradores, voces nuevas de la oralidad, cantautores e invitados especiales. Ellos tejen una red de presentaciones, talleres, encuentros y más en ciudades, comunidades, teatros, centros culturales, universidades escuelas, centros penitenciarios, etc. 
Este es un proyecto de desarrollo cultural con un enfoque de descentralización e inclusión social que busca desarrollarse en cada región, a través de socios co-gestores que nos permitan tener una presencia permanente
El festival es una fiesta de la palabra que busca tejerse cada año de manera comunitaria, creciendo, y llegando poco a poco a más regiones que se unan al sueño de poder contar con un festival que se haga realmente en todo el Perú como un manto tejido a mano que abrigue a todos por igual.

¿Por qué organizamos el festival Todas las palabras, Todas!?

El PERÚ es un país de múltiples identidades, un abanico de sabores, colores, ritmos y tradiciones que en suma nos hacen un país de “todas las sangres”. Como país contamos con una diversidad en recursos culturales e históricos que asombran y educan, así como recursos ambientales que riqueza y belleza; en este marco único se viene realizando en el Perú el Festival Internacional de Narración Oral del Perú: TODAS LAS PALABRAS, TODAS!!!
Buscamos ser un proyecto artístico socio-cultural que sea un ejemplo de: real descentralización e inclusión social para unir, compartir, integrar, sumar y hacer de nuestras diferencias un vínculo; de nuestros idiomas puentes y de nuestros recursos, oportunidades sustentables.
Queremos promover la lectura, la identidad cultural, la diversidad, la integración, la valorización y cuidado de la memoria de los pueblos. De esta forma se trabaja el respeto a las diferencias, el enfoque de género, la educación y el desarrollo económico sostenible.

¿Cómo funciona el festival Todas las palabras, todas!?

Uno de nuestros objetivos es que el festival se co-gestione involucrando a diversos actores sociales donde el festival vaya teniendo presencia y así contribuir a reales procesos de descentralización e inclusión social.Ya se ha logrado y se ha demostrado que este tipo de co-gestión es posible, donde diversos tipos de entidades (entidades gubernamentales, empresas, organismos de la sociedad civil), asumen responsabilidades, desarrollan capacidades de gestión cultural y de toma de decisión conjunta).Consideramos necesario que el festival contribuya a democratizar el acceso a las expresiones culturales. Dentro de cada región se ha logrado estar presente en diversos espacios para brindar a la población más opciones de acceso al festival. De esta forma se hacen presentaciones en teatros, universidades, escuelas y también en asentamientos humanos, albergues, cooperativas, cárceles (centros penitenciarios), etc. Las actividades son programadas y difundidas por igual, así ninguna población es tratada como “objeto de una acción de ayuda social”, sino como parte de una programación integral. Se busca alcanzar los mismos criterios de calidad y visibilidad.
El festival desarrollará una estrategia de desarrollo económico sostenible a partir de involucrar activamente a gobiernos regionales, empresas, operadores turísticos, artistas, organismos de la sociedad civil y asociaciones culturales.Se comparten actividades y se logra descentralizar realmente el evento, fomentando que los representantes regionales se apropien del mismo y vean a este no como una “extensión” o una “versión” de un festival desde Lima (la capital), sino que incluso vean las oportunidades que su realización implica.
El festival sensibiliza en el cuidado y promoción de los recursos culturales y ambientales así como la mejor convivencia y el enfoque de género, a su vez genera oportunidades de intercambio, capacitación, desarrollo y crecimiento a los “jóvenes narradores orales” tanto a nivel nacional como internacional.

Hay muchas maneras de agradecer por formar parte de Todas las palabras, Todas!

story:
Strike a blow for an independent media and support the Pro Scot magazine "they" want to ban.

IScot magazine is encouraging independent thinking people to stand up for free speech.  In the wake of an orchestrated attempt by social media trolls to silence the promotion of positive news about Scotland the monthly magazine is expanding efforts to provide a voice for freedom of expression and open-minded debate.

iScot magazine is not affiliated to any political party or organisation.  It was launched in December 2014 in response to demands for a new independent media in Scotland, free from the control of large corporations beholden to shareholders outside the country.

iScot brings together new writers and experienced media people.  Our core team includes professionals with a background working for some of the world’s most famous titles as reporters, investigative journalists, editors and photographers.

Each issue features stories promoting food & drink, celebrity interviews, health, lifestyle, business news, art, culture, science, music, film, and much more - all topped off with coverage of domestic and international current affairs from a Scottish perspective.

However, there are those who appear to believe anything that promotes Scotland as a vibrant, culturally energetic, socially aware and forward thinking country is wrong and needs to be silenced.

----------------------------------------------------------

In December 2015 iScot booked, and paid for, a promotional kiosk at the Intu Braehead shopping centre near Glasgow. The aim was to publicise the magazine and sell gift subscriptions in the run up to Christmas as well as reaching out to those people who generally don't access social media and rely on mainstream MSM for their news.


Within hours of iScot announcing their presence, a number of ‘anonymous’ twitter users attempted to put sustained pressure on Intu Braehead's management and London HQ to ban the sale of iScot.  Several of Intu's tenants including M&S were targetted also.  

These individuals began by tweeting and retweeting false and malicious allegations that iScot was a “political protest group”. They inferred the magazine preached hate messages and was connected to organisations involved in violent, racist and illegal activities.  

The trigger tweet


Some of the critics, from as far a field as London, Birmingham, Glasgow and Stirling, appeared most upset about the September cover of iScot magazine featuring a painting of a young girl holding up the Saltire - a clear sign, they suggested, that the publication was somehow subversive. 

However, if they had read the magazine it was clear the Les Miserable-style image went with an article on the formation of a new independent media and didn’t mention anything about nationalism.

These ‘anonymous’ tweeters, some of whom know each other well enough to plan a party to celebrate the anniversary of the No result in the independence referendum, succeeded in panicking Intu Braehead into banning iScot from the shopping centre. It was a move described by the National Union of Journalists as “censorship of the worst kind”. 

This was a malicious and deliberate attempt to intimidate and shut down a legitimate business activity by persons unknown.  Their actions would most likely have them punching the air in delight, and this is a situation we are keen to rectify by holding them accountable.

Whilst malicious intent is an actionable offence (http://www.theguardian.com/law/2012/aug/10/twit...), the likelihood of those individuals being in a position to fund our damages and fees is an ongoing consideration.  


In justifying their decision to cave in to anonymous trolls spreading false accusations the General Manager of Intu Breahead said the centre has a policy of not allowing sales of any publication featuring stories on politics - despite their tenant, Waterstones, having a whole section of books on politics and openly selling newspapers and magazines.

- - - - - -

Clearly, iScot’s promotion of Scotland’s booming tourist industry and other success stories, which seek to challenge any suggestion the country is an economically bankrupt basket-case, have hit a nerve.

- - - - - -

So, why we are making this appeal?

iScot magazine continues to attract new readers every month but if we are to compete against mainstream media, and overcome the prejudice of those who would silence independent debate, we need to reach more people and increase our editorial coverage.

Being prevented from promoting the magazine to thousands of shoppers by Intu Braehead, and losing a chance to sell subscriptions as Christmas gifts, caused iScot to miss out on a substantial revenue opportunity. 

Every penny raised is invested back into the magazine to make it bigger and better. There are no huge profits paid to shareholders outside the country who have no interest or affinity with Scotland.

Our aim is to produce a monthly, professional publication which appeals to a wide domestic and international audience, and to demonstrate that Scotland is a dynamic and forward thinking country with a rich heritage worth celebrating.

In the last year we have covered a range of topics. We have highlighted concerns over fracking, nuclear weapons and political intrigue. We have given a voice to families and campaigners fighting for justice. We have promoted Scottish businesses, championed inventiveness, celebrated culture and showcased Scotland to the world. All of this has been done alongside spectacular photo spreads, celebrity interviews, aspirational features and regular columns from new and established writers.


Here’s some of the comments we’ve had from readers so far:

“Each monthly edition runs to 100 glossy, full-colour pages covering all sorts of matters political and cultural…It’s the sort of thing that anyone who sees it sitting on your coffee table won’t be able to resist picking up.”

“superb publication, look forward to it dropping through the letterbox each month”.

“I LOVE this magazine. Getting my copy is the highlight of my month. The production values are absolutely superb, but more importantly the articles themselves are great reading.”

“Have every issue – absolutely a cracking quality read & product to be proud of.”

How can you help?

Support this appeal and buy the magazine!

You can get a copy of iScot magazine delivered direct to your door anywhere in the UK every month with an annual subscription of just £59.95 (inclusive of post & packing), or a monthly direct debit of £5.99

Alternatively, you can subscribe to the iScot digital edition for just £29.95 and download it to any computer, laptop, tablet, phone or other mobile devices.

iScot is the only independent, grassroots, pro-Scotland magazine available in the shops. Ask your local newsagent to reserve you a copy. At £3.99 for 100 pages it’s a cracking, good-value read.

Other ways to show your support


Donate:

If you are already a subscriber, and share our determination to create a new home-grown independent media, you can make a donation to help us improve and increase our editorial coverage.

Advertise:

Or, you can take out an advert to publicise your business, organisation or even just for a family announcement.

Become an iScot distributor:


 Throughout the country iScot is building up a network of individuals, clubs, organisations, cafes, music shops, social hubs and community centres that stock and sell the magazine on a commission basis.

To advertise, find out about becoming an iScot distributor or just to chat drop us a line at info@iscot.scot.


We've set our target low as we wish this fundraiser to be a rolling appeal beyond the 30 day period.

Thank you.

story:
What's this all about? 

I am Avery Lockland, and I am the author of a new dystopian novel called Hue & Cry. This book is about Alison Mason, a resident of the town of Tormid, which sits in the eye of a perpetual storm that covers all of the known world. Outside of Tormid's walls there is nothing but death. Inside the walls they are protected by the good will of the Storm King. Every 13 years, the residents of Tormid burn a holy child alive, and Alison's newborn baby is selected to be the next sacrifice. 

I wrote this book because that's what I do. I tell stories that I believe people will be able to connect with. Alison's struggles with motherhood, post-partum depression, abuse, and oppression might feel very real for a lot of women reading this. 

I hope this story can inspire people to think about the issues she goes through, both on a cultural and personal level. Perhaps if you can see yourself in Alison, her fears and loneliness might resonate with you.

Welcome to Tormid 

Across the 13 chapters of Hue & Cry, you will become familiar with Tormid and it's culture. The city's main landmark is the Cathedral of the Storm King, which sits at the heart of everything. There, the clergy (lead by the Archbishop) rules over the population. Caster Lynch, one of the wealthier members of the city, covets that position, and has made it his personal aspiration to rise through the church's ranks. And several blocks east of the Cathedral sits the Militia fort, a stone base built into the city's tall wall, featuring the only gate through to the wastelands outside. Jacob Flint, Alison's childhood friend, is a part of this Militia, and their mission is to map and explore the inhospitable lands scarred by the storm, in search of artifacts belonging to the Old-World.    
 

What We Need & What You Get

Hue & Cry is being published with New Degree Press. We set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise my manuscript over the next several months.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editor for my book to maek seur I spull evarytheng curractly.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order* my book now:
 
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You will receive access to a high-quality art album featuring concept art from the book and author commentary, as well as a high-quality print of one of the pieces from the album!

And much more!

*For preorders outside of Canada, please C L I C K   H E R E !

About the Author

Avery Lockland is a developmental editor, career author and father to a very crazy and fluffy puppy named Willow Lockland. 

Avery is a passionate creator - he is always working on stories, or helping other people with theirs. He started off working in a newsroom editing 1000-2000 word articles, and has since graduated to writing and editing books.   

Aside from writing, Avery is also an avid gamer and very occasional streamer via twitch (@averysaviary). He runs an Old-School Runescape guild called the Fire Witches of Kourend, where he and his guildies help new players and set lots of weird badly animated monsters on fire. 

You can find Avery on instagram and twitch @averysaviary and on discord here: https://discord.gg/WdKkbGnVFn

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #hueandcry and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with as many friends, family members, or co-workers as you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media. 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Avery Lockland, author of Hue & Cry

Hue & Cry is being published with New Degree Press. We set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise my manuscript over the next several months.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editor for my book to maek seur I spull evarytheng curractly.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order* my book now: 
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
You will receive access to a high-quality art album featuring concept art from the book and author commentary, as well as a high-quality print of one of the pieces from the album!

And much more!*For preorders outside of Canada, please C L I C K   H E R E !

About the Author
Avery Lockland is a developmental editor, career author and father to a very crazy and fluffy puppy named Willow Lockland. 
Avery is a passionate creator - he is always working on stories, or helping other people with theirs. He started off working in a newsroom editing 1000-2000 word articles, and has since graduated to writing and editing books.   Aside from writing, Avery is also an avid gamer and very occasional streamer via twitch (@averysaviary). He runs an Old-School Runescape guild called the Fire Witches of Kourend, where he and his guildies help new players and set lots of weird badly animated monsters on fire. You can find Avery on instagram and twitch @averysaviary and on discord here: https://discord.gg/WdKkbGnVFn

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #hueandcry and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with as many friends, family members, or co-workers as you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media. 
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Avery Lockland, author of Hue & Cry

story:
GOAL EXCEEDED - THANK YOU SO MUCH TO EVERYONE INVOLVED! NEW BOOK OUT 13TH OF DECEMBER 2010 ;D
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dear wonderful person deliberating whether or not to spend time reading this pitch,

It's nice to see you! My name is Katy Gilbert, and I'm an author who isn't anywhere rich enough to do this without your help.

I would desperately like to produce a new book. This DIY project is the written equivalent of a musician's EP; a collection of pieces that I think you'll enjoy, all put together. It's made up mostly of prose and a couple of poems; a couple of old favourites and many more exclusive pieces that you won't find anywhere else! Happy, sad, angry and glad; the spectrums of feeling, encouragement and linguistic techniques are packed in there!

Now, without resorting to hyperbole, this book is hopefully going to be the best thing you've ever read and so you might want to change your life by donating a little bit of money to help me make it happen.

Here's the thing: I can self-publish this little side-project for nothing, but torturously I can't print or ship it to you, or me in order to ship it to you (keeping the reader's cost down) without money. And I have a bit. Which I will use because this means more to me than anything, apart from you obviously. However, it's not quite enough.

Which is where wonderful you comes in! To the right you can see a list of perks ï¿½ call them emblems of my undying gratitude to you ï¿½ that you will receive according to the amount that you donate. And they're fun and lovely and great!

If you're interested in the perks that involve choosing a piece from the book, here are your options:
1.ï¿½Happily single? You, apparently, are a liar.ï¿½ (working title)
2.ï¿½How Sun Rises Deceitful Promiseï¿½ï¿½
3.ï¿½This Sicknessï¿½ (working title)
It's up to you!

Honestly, though, I wouldn't enjoy my work so much without the emotional support that followers, friends and family like you have shown me, so this seems like an appropriately creepy opportunity to thank you for that.

Let's make this happen!

Thank you for taking a look,

Katy :)

PS If it looks like I'm funding myself it's just the paying in of someone's cash donation, not me being weird ;) To check the actual total (including cash) see the updates tab!
