story:
Short Summary

A little over two years ago, I built a website and launched a facebook page for my book series, "Happiness in Your Life." I had planned on taking my 12 years of journals and notebooks and organizing them into 12 books, releasing them over time. I started writing and designing inspirational posters, and then a blog, and then another blog...and now I have written and posted over 900 posters and close to 500 articles on several blogs, the facebook page, and a newsletter. I would not have believed it had I not lived it. I am humbled and grateful daily to the 300,000+ friends on the facebook page who inspire me, motivate me, and who I look forward to seeing every day. 

What I Need & What You Get

Printing full color books is not really possible in small quantities. Well, it is, but they'd cost around $100 each. I'd like to have my book, "Poems" made, quantity 2500 (or more). It will be a full color 6"x6" book of approximately 50 poems. They are all poems I have written over the past two years. Some are about love, or about moving on, forgiving, and of course...dreams. 

In addition to printing costs, I will need to purchase more image licenses, UPC code, ISBN Number, and shipping envelopes and postage to mail them out. 

-If the goal is exceeded, I really would love to redo www.happinessinyourlife.com and add more free pdf posters, reorganize the whole site to show all the blogs, and make it look pretty. 

-I also have monthly expenses of image licenses (which supports independent photographers and artists), domain names, software, bandwidth, the newsletter service, and disc space. I never wanted to do a paid subscription site, as I wanted the articles to be free for anyone who needs them to read. Unfortunately, that means I get the whole bill every month. Fortunately, I've been able to do quite a lot. When I have more, I can do more. I would love that.

The blogs are:

www.thehiyl.com (main blog with posters and articles)

www.breakuplife.com (blog on how to get through a breakup)

www.doezantamataquotes.com (blog of poster quotes)

www.quotesaboutliving.com (blog with quotes from the Happiness in Your Life books)

www.lovetoyouvolumeone.com (free online version of one of my books)

http://www.idealisthandbook.com/ Another online book, "Idealist Handbook" Tips for idealists to stay well and positive in a world that doesn't always make it easy to do so.

 

-Above that, my computer is about to celebrate it's 5th birthday. Although I am very grateful for the immense workload it has taken on, I would love to give it a retirement party instead, and get a new computer. 

-Above all that, I would love to take a little time away from freelance work to compile and edit Book Two in the Happiness in Your Life Book Series, "Intuition." 

The Impact

In my own life, I have discovered a lot. I used to feel powerless, angry, sad, all sorts of self-defeating ideas and limitations that it seemed were "just reality." Then one day, I found myself in a hospital bed with meningitis and a "right to die" contract in front of me provided to me by the nurse which stated that if I get to the point where machines are the only thing keeping me alive, to unplug them.

I realized then that this could really be "it," "over and out."

I said a prayer that day that if I were given another shot, I promise to figure myself out and then share anything and everything with anyone and everyone. I promised to appreciate life and believe in all good things. An amazing recovery followed, and 15-odd years later, here we are.

I know that most of my unhappiness was really just faulty thinking. I know that happiness is possible for just about everyone, and I do my best to share everything I've learned since then with you. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with funding, that's OK. I know times can be tight and there are times when every dollar needs to go for something necessary.

 

If you can, please share this fundraiser with friends on facebook, twitter, via email, or some other social media avenue which I haven't seen just yet. 

Thank you so much for your support. 

Love to you, 

Doe

story:
Our Story

     My newest book, "Turds", just got published recently.  Now it's time for me to promote the mofo!  I've used all the free advertising avenues I could think of.  Being a former business owner, I know that sometimes paid advertising works the best.  Here's the lowdown on the book:


     From the author of "Teenage Vigilante", comes the new ebook, "Turds".  The plot deals with a military experiment involving fecal matter gone awry.  When four giant poop monsters are unleashed upon an unsuspecting small town, only one man can save the day.  Ernie Sputnik!  He's the goofball plumber who knows the sewers like the back of his hand.

     The book reads like a parody of the film, THE BLOB(1988).  This extremely hilarious romp plays as a tribute to horror films in general, with tongue-in-cheek references to TOXIC AVENGER, TREMORS, and SAW.

     As Ernie teams up with his pal Scotty, they must battle the turd creatures with machine guns, grenades, and even Lysol!  If you enjoy bathroom humor or giant monster movies, you'll love this.


     It's available for the Kindle, PC, Palm, Android, iphone, ipod touch, Nook, Sony Reader, etc.  Turds can be found on Amazon and Smashwords.


The Impact

     The goal is to get the word on "Turds" out there.  If this book sells well, I'll be publishing another this summer.


What We Need & What You Get

     So my plan is to raise at least $500 for things such as:

* Facebook advertising

* Printing up business cards to circulate

* Buying ad space on a few blogs


* Place an ad in Fangoria magazine


     I'm even sacrificing some of my personal items to make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

     The best way you can help is spreading the turd.....er, the word!  Post the link to this page on Facebook, Twitter, Myspace, Craigslist, Yahoo groups, on your email lists, on your blog, etc.

story:
Our Story

Welcome to my project: Randy's Snapshots & Thought Shots.
A collection Of Short Stories and Poems
This project features deep thoughts and skilful musings of a budding 10 year old literary giant. I discovered my son Randy's uniquely brilliant writing ability purely by a chance reading of doodling left on his cluttered chest of drawers in his room. (which by the looks of it, must have been there for more than a year.His writings are presented as he wrote them, no edits.

Below is a sample of one of his poems he wrote when he was 7.

             MY DAD IS A METAPHOR
He is the calming bass music that enlightens us all
He is the understanding of situations
He is who makes comrades everywhere he goes
He's magical dust that makes everyone around him content
He is tropical citrus fruit from the Caribbean
He is the funniest movie ever made
He is the extraordinary encouragement that helps plenty
He is who buys Twix for the happiness of others
He's a goal in soccer, using tricks to score
He is my Dad.....


The Impact

This project if funded, will provide a great inspiration to  both kids and adults. It will let other kids know that both reading and writing is cool and help them find new ways of expressing themselves. Adults can learn how to identify, nature and encourage these future leaders.


What We Need & What You Get

For this project, a minimum of $3,000 is needed. This money will be used for: Creating ebook versions for Kindle™, iPad™, iPhone™ and other electronic delivery devices; Paying for professional photo shoot for book covers and promotions; Fees for materials for hard copy versions including printing costs. Unfortunately there is no other source of funding at this time so if the funding goal is not met rewards to pledges will be honored by the end December 2011.

Reward incentives (Perks) will be offered at three (3) levels of pledges.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us to spread the word about this project. If fully funded, this project will be available to all pledges by October 31, 2011.

story:
Elle has been watching Jacob for 14 years, from the moment of their births, until they both reached their teens. Jacob has no idea that he has been targeted, chosen, by Elle's parents. The day has arrived for her to finally begin her part of her parents' mission: to seduce Jacob so he'll accompany her back to her parents' home planet.

 

About the Author:

The passing of my wife two years ago gave me the impetus to reinvent myself so I could stay home with my kids. I decided to pursue a passion, writing.  My children, now 13 and 15 years old, inspired me to write in a genre they love to read.  Socialite 1 is a four book science fiction series about an arranged marriage extraordinaire. 

WHAT IS SOCIALITE

Synopsis:

Ray and Grace Amis were chosen from 40 candidates for a mission that may save their people,the Zozians, from extinction: find a human willing to leave his home and family to serve as a fresh pool of genetic and social knowledge.  The success of the mission hinges on the Amis finding a mate for their daughter Elle.  Ray created the network, Socialite, so he can scour available knowledge about individual humans and find the most appropriate match for his daughter.  Socialite becomes a phenomenon, replacing search tools and social networks to become the main form of communication on Earth.  Ray and Grace chose Jacob Liebe, a one year old living in the small town called Mission located near Vancouver, British Columbia.  The Amis move into the house across the street from the Liebes, give birth to their daughter and live in seclusion for fourteen years, waiting for the right time to introduce their daughter to her chosen husband.

The full vision:

The book series combines a great story of suspense, action and romance with poetry, humour and importantly, music! While writing Socialite 1, I was continuously inspired to add songs within the text. The result is two songs integrated into the story of each book, creating a multimedia vision of the series.  As well, I was frequently inspired with ideas for both the future of the story and the backstory. The future will be realized in three book series that will follow Socialite 1.  Events from the distant past that eventually lead to the Amis’ adventures in Socialite 1 are being developed as the Zozian Diaries (anyone can begin reading it right now online at http://zozian-diaries.blogspot.ca/ !)

WHAT IS COMPLETE SO FAR 

All four books of Socialite 1 are complete and available as ebooks from Amazon kindle store, Apple iBookstore and Kobo books.  The print versions are also complete and available through Amazon’s CreateSpace by going to this page: https://sites.google.com/site/socialitebooks/ .

The music of Socialite 1 is composed, and the complete lyrics for most of the songs are included in the text of the four books of this series. The video above includes samples of four of the songs (the recordings are of me singing and playing guitar into my laptop, for now).

I have started writing Socialite 2 and have composed all of the music for this second series.  I have also begun writing the Zozian Diaries and readers can check out the first few chapters right now online for free!

WHAT NEEDS TO BE COMPLETED

I am independently publishing this series.  The initial print run needs to be ordered.  Also the songs need to be recorded in a studio with additional musicians and singers.  The CD needs to be designed and produced. 

Once these things are completed, I will need to market and “pound the pavement” to generate an interest for this exciting book series and for the accompanying music.

WHAT YOU GET

Lots of perks are available.  You decide if you want to read the series as an ebook or a traditional print book.  You can also get the music (once it is recorded) as a signed CD.  Perhaps you want a coffee cup with the logo of the DarkRoast coffee chain that features prominently in the series, or maybe you'd like me to use your name or the name of a loved one for a character in one of the books of the next series.  Check out all of the perks on the right side of this page.

OTHER WAYS TO PARTICIPATE

I am very grateful for all donations to this campaign. I am very passionate about this series and for that reason made the books accessible at the lowest perk level ($10 for all 4 ebooks!).

I realize that some people are not able contribute monetarily.

Everyone can help this project just by liking the Socialitebooks facebook page, telling a friend about the books and reading the free Zozian Diaries blog online and leaving comments.   

Thank you very much for helping to bring this project to life!

Lots of perks are available.  You decide if you want to read the series as an ebook or a traditional print book.  You can also get the music (once it is recorded) as a signed CD.  Perhaps you want a coffee cup with the logo of the DarkRoast coffee chain that features prominently in the series, or maybe you'd like me to use your name or the name of a loved one for a character in one of the books of the next series.  Check out all of the perks on the right side of this page.
OTHER WAYS TO PARTICIPATE
I am very grateful for all donations to this campaign. I am very passionate about this series and for that reason made the books accessible at the lowest perk level ($10 for all 4 ebooks!).
I realize that some people are not able contribute monetarily.
Everyone can help this project just by liking the Socialitebooks facebook page, telling a friend about the books and reading the free Zozian Diaries blog online and leaving comments.   
Thank you very much for helping to bring this project to life!

story:
Who I Am and Why I'm Doing This

My name is Warren Norgaard, and I am a fused glass Artist and Instructor.  My work has been shown and sold internationally.  I have been working in the arts for as long as I can remember, in one for or another, but glass has always been my true passion.  

Throughout the years, I have found a number of books for beginners.  Some were easy to understand, but didn't go very far in education.  Others contained a lot of the technical information, but lacked the ability to be easily understood.

This book will attempt to bridge that gap, and provide a true resource for those entering the world of fused glass in a concise, thorough, yet easy to understand manner.

What Will This Project Take?

This book will take time, first and foremost.  Writing takes time.  But an educational art book isn't complete with just words.  It also required help from others.

  • I will be collaborating with a photographer to get the best images possible for the book, providing step-by-step instruction.
  • I will hire a copy editor to make sure all the dots, commas, and spelling are correct and in the right place.
  • I will hire someone to create the cover art for the book.
But none if this can happen without funding!  That is where you (hopefully) come in!  I'm seeking $25,000 in funding to help with this project.  It won't cover ALL the costs, but matched with my own funds will get this project to completion!
As you can see from the "perks" list, there are some pretty great incentives to help you decide what level of funding is right for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can afford to financially support a project, and I understand that. Even if you can't help fund this project personally, please let others know about this great funding opportunity!  There are share tools right here on this page if you want to share with your social media friends and family!

story:
Hello!I'm Vidette Vanderweide. 

I am a writer and speaker.  I am the creator and founder of VidetteV.com, which was ranked in the Top 50 Mom-Run Businesses in 2012.  You can say I know a thing or two about manifesting great change in my own life.  I've done it.

Four years ago, I hesitantly told my husband I wanted to write a book.  I was afraid of that admission as I was just an ordinary girl with two small babies at home, working a hum-drum job, not realizing how unsettled I was with my life. 

Three months later, I'd soon forget that desire as my life crumbled down around me in one devastating night.  What followed that night was the awakening to the sad, heart-breaking realization that I didn't like the life I had and the journey I took to creating an epic revolution in my life.

The lessons I learned along the journey were nothing short of an awakening.  A new paradigm of living was created, and the greatest lesson of all, was what happened when I lived from the soul.

This book is for women of all ages.  Those with kids and those without.  For those who are hearing the silent whispers of there being something more for them in their lifetime.  Those not negating where their lives currently are, but those looking for more fulfillment, to live their purpose, or to enhance the life they currently have. 

Living as a Soul Mama is a lifestyle.  A way of life.  An experience of life rather than "settling" for life.  This book is a movement.  It's the beginning of an epic revolution for women.  It's my way to be the change I want to see in the world.

Sample Pages:

You can read an unedited version of the first couple of pages HERE to get a feel for how this book will read. 

Where Your Contributions Will Go:

Please know, that $25,000 is our minimum amount needed.  Anything over and above this project goal is greatly needed, which I explain below.

Your backing helps me in various ways.  This book has an extraordinary message to women of all ages.  It's important for me to get it to the marketplace with all the support it needs to get into the hands of the people who need to hear the message. 

I have chosen to self-publish this book myself in order to build a platform to continue to help women through their own S.O.U.L. Mama Experience.  In order to do so, the costs typically absorbed by big publishing houses is left to me to cover.  Although I marketed my own business to a Top 50 status this past year, I desire to have a team of experts assist me in getting the book to market.

More specifically, your funds will help me with the following:

  • Layout and cover design - $1,200
  • Channel distribution to 25,000 retailers worldwide - $2,500
  • Marketing materials and promotional items _ (included in $2,500 above)
  • Brand Development, Licensing and Trademarks, Obtaining ISBN Numbers, etc.- $1,000
  • Website Development -  $5,000
  • Hire a Marketing and Public Relations Team - $10,000 (for the minimum package.  A high-level PR campaign is $24,000 alone - this is where any contributions over our minimum goal will be allotted).
  • Cover 6 months of travel expenses for book tour -  $6,000

After your financial contribution, here's another way I can use your help!

Remember, this project is the minimum amount needed.  Having contributors and visitors share this project with others is critical to it's success.  

**835 people contributing $30 would help us hit our goal - the power of Social Media sharing is so important to this project SO I humbly ask for you to contribute, then share it, tweet it, email it, etc.**

Here's how:

  • Email your friends asking them to check out this Kickstarter page at: www.SoulMamaBook.com
  • Share this Kickstarter page by pasting the URL above or by cutting and pasting, http://SoulMamaBook.com onto your Facebook wall or Twitter feed.
  • I'd love for you to also “Like” us on Facebook at: http://Facebook.com/VidetteV so I can personally give our contributors shouts outs of gratitude and get to know you!

****************************************************************************************************************

I have been notified that some contributor funds are not being accepted by Indiegogo.  I have contacted them, however, until I have an answer, I am asking that should you experience any issues, your contributions can be made by Paypal as well.

Choose "send a payment" within Paypal to the email address:  savvy@AV2Concept.com and your contribution will go towards the S.O.U.L. Mama Book project.  

Thank you for your patience!

**********************************************************************

Any additional questions or comments, feel free to contact me at:

press@VidetteV.com

Follow me on Twitter @VidetteV

Thank you so much for your support!

*********************************************************************

story:
Who I am & What I do

Biography: my name is Augusto Chiarle, I was born in 1970 near Torino (Italy). I am an italian novelist and musician. Past jobs as translator and writer of role-playing games, editor for an italian fantasy/sci-fi/RPG magazine, illustrator (as shown by the arts of most of my books) and music: sax player, owner of a web-radio (TWM Relaxing Radio), and frontman of The Wimshurst’s Machine, italian-based steampunk-inspired ambient orchestra that got three nominations at the "Hollywood Music in Media Awards" (2010, 2011 e 2012). I wrote 5 novels so far (see below).

The project: "The Shadows of Mars" is a fortunate serie of Steampunk novels, published in Italy and selling pretty well (several novels did often hit the top of the amazon sci-fi charts, in Italy, for example). Synopsis: in a world once conquered by martians, now all dead, mankind starts a new era, made of weird machines, mistery and politics. In a Europe plagued by war, spies, secrets and even an evil cult who tries to bring back the alien invaders, the town of Nice, in southern France, is the center of weird events. Chapters of this saga are:

1-Clockwork (novel, the one I would like to translate as 1st), 
2-The Airship to Mars (novel), 
3-Mechanical Shadow (novel).

4-Artificial Life (novel, just published).

There is a free demo (a short novel, called "The Cold Hell") available for free as ebook on most retailers (see links below) if you want to get an idea of the general style.

What is Steampunk? Is a charming science fiction subgenre. In a single sentence may be difined as "the future of a past civilization". Practically a parallel world where History changed at a point (usually in XIX century). Precursors were Jules Verne and H.G. Wells, actual writers of this style may be well represented by Paul Di Filippo. In comics you may find good examples in "Legend of Extraordinary Gentlemen". In movies, from "Wild Wild West" (Western Steampunk), "Sherlock Holmes" recent serie (Victorian Steampunk), or (for Dieselpunk) "Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow".

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • A decent translation for a novel (from a mother-language professional) may easily reach 6000 US$, but a decent one may cost around 3500 US$, so I'm trying to reach this goal at least for the first of the books.
  • If you decide to back me up, I will include your name in the special thanks both in the ebook and printed version of the book, and will send you a signed copy of a hardcover special edition just for the backers. I am asking you just to buy your signed copy in advance, in a few words.
  • If you feel particularly generous, I will give a name of your choice and a description of your choice to a character of a bonus previously-unreleased short novel (limited number of VIP supporters, for this, as you may imagine)!
  • If the goal is reached and the amount is more than the needed, the other money will be used to translate the next novel. If it is not reached, will cover the rest of the expenses myself or I will try to find other funds: your "support rights" (see above) are still granted.
  • In the unlikely case we raise lot of money, the further money will be then used to translate the next book. If all the books are translated already and there is money left (just in case, even if is highly unlikely) the rest of the money will be given for charity (with a poll between all the ones who versed).

Why I need your help?

  • I hope to can start translating the first novel then to start to sell and work on the next one, until the entire saga is completely translated and published in english.
  • I had some very good feedback and I know many Steampunk fans would be interested to read this book, but I do not personally know any UK/USA publisher and often you cannot get their trust unless you know someone working for them. To have a decent translation may be of a great help.
  • I think that fund-raising the first book will help me to find a "foreign" (by my point of view) publisher to translate the others (or that the sales will raise these funds anyway so I can go on by myself).

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you may help me:

  • You may get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • You may help me directly with the translation (you have to know well both english and italian and you must have some experience in translating literature).
  • You may present my book to a publisher who may decide to translate it.
  • You may help me as Editor: I may even do the translation myself, but (as I am not an english mother-language) in such case I will need a good Editor to correct my english and help me to keep my novel enjoyable as it is in my native language and I would like to make a good job.
  • Any cost-reducer help will be the welcome. 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Randa Handler.  Working at the UN with people from many races and nationalities who welcomed each other's cultures influenced me.  People can get along despite their differences! After spending some years as an international journalist, publicist and publisher, I embarked on a journey writing and illustrating children's books with that message. I am convinced that when you teach kids that differences are just gems to be cherished and not problems, the world would really be a better place as you will be wiping away hate!

What We Need & What You Get

I am raising money to print 3,000 copies each of 2 of my books as I would like to send as many free copies to elementary school teachers as possible.

Both books will be printed as hardcovers. If we are unable to reach our whole campaign amount we will print smaller quantities. But for a national campaign 3k is a small quantity.

The Impact

My goal is to try and make a difference with a message of tolerance of difference conveyed in a fun way without being preachy. Elementary school teachers have indicated their approval by leaving messages at my FB page and even reviewing books.  I'm so glad that they agree with me that the earlier we can start helping kids understand and appreciate cultural differences the better our world will be.

*****Critical review recently published in examiner.com: http://www.examiner.com/article/randa-handler


Here is a summary of - If I were King:

One rainy day in the jungle, unlikely friends—Zebra, Lion, Leopard, Giraffe, Monkey, Elephant and Chameleon—gather to lament how boring their daily activities are. 
Zebra’s imagination and fun-loving nature convinces the other animals to escape their mundane lives by pretending they are kings. Playing this game teaches them about their many differences and, more importantly, their own likes and dislikes. 
Zebra, upon discovering this information, realizes that it’s okay not to always want to play with other zebras as long as she listens to her inner voice and yields when it warns her of dangers and cautions her to maintain clear boundaries. Immediately she learns that Lion can stop being her friend when he’s angry or hungry.
Along her quest, she learns about everyone’s likes and dislikes including her own and discovers the true meaning of friendship.

Reviews!

5 Stars,* Cute, entertaining, charming drawings, with a profound message!

By Israel Drazin TOP 1000 REVIEWERVINE VOICE

While quite whimsical and entertaining with a story and drawings that children will enjoy, this book also contains a profound lesson about life, a lesson that could also be applied to politics and religion, a lesson of how and when to get along with others. A wonderful story with an important message.

5 Stars,* By Susan Keefe

Within the story are important messages. The reader has a wonderful opportunity to interact with the child as it learns about not only the different characteristics and traits of some wild animals, but also important life lessons such as self-awareness, understanding others and character judgement, in an easily absorbable way. 

This very talented author and illustrator has produced a lovely, colorfully illustrated book which I believe will really appeal to children.

5 Stars,*  If I were King, By Bryna Stone -

I read 'If I Were King' to my nephews and they enjoyed it as well as I did. The bright and fun illustrations transported us to Africa. The book uses a clever way to convey an important message: 'It is okay to be adventurous while recognizing your friends and being extra careful when it comes to their "turf" or boundaries.' I don't think I've read them a book before as enjoyable as this one where differences between people are celebrated and one finds his/her comfort zone among people of different background. Great book!

4 Stars,* By Lauren Johnson (Santa Clara, CA USA) -  

This is a great little children's book that is fun loving and easy to read. This book delves into a world of make believe and fantasy with a wonderful storyline and important message. I love how the author writes in different traits and characteristics of animals that would be great and fun for children to learn.

5 Stars,* By Lynn Petronella - AZ

Randa Handler has made a story that transcends childhood and incorporates real life experiences in a fun and entertaining story for all ages, I highly recommend this book for any family looking for a "new kind of story" to reach and teach children today.

5 Stars,* by Hope – Elementary School Teacher/Portland, OR. This is an excellent book to read with your children. Having worked as a preschool teacher, I appreciate how it teaches valuable lessons about self-awareness and individuality in an easy-to-read animal tale. The illustrations are rich and captivating, and the story encourages pretend-play, which is an important part of childhood development. I definitely recommend this book to any parent or educator using an e-reader with young children.

5 Stars,*  Lovely fable, By Ryan -NY

The illustrations in this book are beautiful. I never know what to get my nephew for his birthday, and this was the perfect solution. It has lots of animals, which everybody loves, and the story is like a beautiful fable. Very artistic. I loved it

5 Stars,*  Great for teaching values,

By Jessica Warne (Elementary School teacher,Los Angeles, CA) -

As a teacher I work at helping children understand the importance of empathy. That valuable quality is beautifully developed in this book as all the characters learn to understand each other's differences and respect them. The illustrations sensitively convey the range of emotions involved in accepting differences.

5 Stars,*  Wonderful illustrations, wonderful lessons in a complex world,

By Karen Shepherd (Eugene, OR) -

I have had the privilege of reading this lovely children's book. The illustrations are wonderful and perfectly suited to children. I believe they will love them. The story is engrossing enough to hold my attention, so it seems like children will love the characters and the lessons they learn through their adventures. This book is about safety and seeking out the "right" company AND acceptance of others who are different. Both, at the same time. Wonderful handling of a tough situation for parents of young children. Wonderful morals! Well done!

5 Stars,*  Charming, By P. Keller –( OC, CA)

A delightful and whimsical tale, lovingly illustrated, for preschool children that teaches them valuable lessons for life's playground. I would recommend to parents and teachers alike.

5 Stars,*  A Wonderful Tale!, By Italia Gandolfo "Italia" (KY) -

A story to be beloved by children and adults alike, If I Were King will remain in the hearts of everyone who reads it for generations. And I love the warm and whimsical illustrations!

5 Stars,*  By Christiane Hitti –(CT) A delightful Children's book, a very imaginative story with a lesson on living with one another peacefully. If you want your children to grow up in a world that helps them excel, and learn how to make very important choices in life. I do recommend this book to all parents with young children.

5 Stars,*  Great, By GB- (IL) “Charming story with great illustrations, engaging with its many plot twists, full of whimsy but also plenty of common sense. My kids loved it!”



Here's a summary of - The Boy Who Spoke to God:

Unable to agree on their ideas about God and religious celebrations, four different ethnic tribes—Greeks, Chinese, Zulus, and Mayans—who live together harmoniously most of the year, combining aspects of each of their cultures to make their kingdom strong and prosperous, suddenly become divisive when religious holidays approach. During such times, they cannot agree on the timing or manner of religious traditions, and they each have their own god who looks and dresses as they do. When Niko, a young Greek boy, has several dreams of God, each tribe interprets the various details of his dreams according to its own view of God, further emphasizing the tribes’ differences in beliefs. Subsequently Niko is shunned for having created even more disharmony and for lying to the tribes, or so they think, as no one believes he dreamed of God. To clear up all the confusion and arrive at the truth, Niko begs God to manifest in one final dream. This time God shows him that the tribes’ beliefs are actually different expressions of the same god. Niko concludes that God is like colorless and formless iridescent light and the beliefs of all tribes about their gods are correct as these gods are like colors of the rainbow that derive from white light.

Reviews!

5 Stars*  By Israel Drazin TOP 1000 Amazon Reviewer- 

This is a really good book because it teaches that despite differences in religions, beliefs, ceremonies, and traditions among people, God is the God of everyone, and people should not let their differences separate them from others. The story is told in an excellent easy to understand fashion, with delightful colorful drawings, and children will understand this important lesson.

5 Stars* By Ronald R. Irwin (Burbank, CA) - Amazon/B&N

Through out the recorded history of man, people have launched wars all too often based upon some distortion of their understanding of God. Such strife continues to plague our world today making Randa Handler's book "The Boy Who Spoke to God" a true gem and a must read not only in children's literature but by everyone.

5 Stars* By Shawnda Blake (Missouri) - Amazon

What a charming illustrated children’s book with a great message of religious diversity! In a time when demonstrations are held to put down another’s beliefs and wars are fought over religion, Randa Handler provides a beautiful way to teach children that it doesn’t have to be that way.

5 Stars* By L. AllisonBurres - Amazon

I highly recommend this book for all children. They can also learn that just because one person’s skin is another color than their own, that doesn’t mean that they are really any different than we are. Skin is just that, and only that. This book is fully illustrated and very colorful.

5 Stars* By Ryan - Amazon

I was intrigued by the title. I wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised to find a kids book that deals with the basic question of religion and what God looks like. Handler uses a clever way to address that question that kids can relate to. I loved it! Such a way to teach kids tolerance of all differences!

5 Stars* A must-have in all school libraries., By IC Camilleri "IC" (UK) - 

The Boy who spoke to God is an essential must-have in today’s society. It is aimed at primary school children and through a wonderfully told fairytale it teaches racial tolerance as we see that different religions can happily co-exist in harmony. 

5 Stars* By Chas Allen - 

The message brings about religious and ethnic tolerance in a unique and engaging way that parents and kids can both enjoy. 

5 Stars* By Ramz Artso - 

Once again, this book is educative for children and carries the message of tolerance for race and religion. It promotes the notion that we, as a society, should concentrate on our similarities – not our differences.

5 Stars* By Roger Awn - 

Once again, Randa Handler writes a masterful story where the belief in god and religion is shown to enhance rather than destroy harmony among diverse cultures.

5 Stars* By Jessica Warne (Elementary School Teacher/ CA USA) - 

This story portrays God as loving and accessible, as well as willing and able to answer heartfelt questions about harmony, unity and diversity in human relations. All this is beautifully accomplished through a child's earnest effort to simply solve a difficult problem in his village. If or when different religious beliefs are causing conflict, this is the book to give to either children or adults.

5 Stars* By Steve - 

Ms. Handler's style is perfect to teach children these qualities as its tone is neither preachy nor heavy-handed. I recommend this book to all parents and teachers to use to teach children about religious tolerance.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to my campaign I would be most grateful if you could spread the word to your friends and family members and send out a link to my campaign to your social media circles.  Thank you so much.
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Randa Handler.  Working at the UN with people from many races and nationalities who welcomed each other's cultures influenced me.  People can get along despite their differences! After spending some years as an international journalist, publicist and publisher, I embarked on a journey writing and illustrating children's books with that message. I am convinced that when you teach kids that differences are just gems to be cherished and not problems, the world would really be a better place as you will be wiping away hate!

What We Need & What You Get
I am raising money to print 3,000 copies each of 2 of my books as I would like to send as many free copies to elementary school teachers as possible.
Both books will be printed as hardcovers. If we are unable to reach our whole campaign amount we will print smaller quantities. But for a national campaign 3k is a small quantity.

The Impact
My goal is to try and make a difference with a message of tolerance of difference conveyed in a fun way without being preachy. Elementary school teachers have indicated their approval by leaving messages at my FB page and even reviewing books.  I'm so glad that they agree with me that the earlier we can start helping kids understand and appreciate cultural differences the better our world will be.
*****Critical review recently published in examiner.com: http://www.examiner.com/article/randa-handler
Here is a summary of - If I were King:
One rainy day in the jungle, unlikely friends—Zebra, Lion, Leopard, Giraffe, Monkey, Elephant and Chameleon—gather to lament how boring their daily activities are. 
Zebra’s imagination and fun-loving nature convinces the other animals to escape their mundane lives by pretending they are kings. Playing this game teaches them about their many differences and, more importantly, their own likes and dislikes. 
Zebra, upon discovering this information, realizes that it’s okay not to always want to play with other zebras as long as she listens to her inner voice and yields when it warns her of dangers and cautions her to maintain clear boundaries. Immediately she learns that Lion can stop being her friend when he’s angry or hungry.
Along her quest, she learns about everyone’s likes and dislikes including her own and discovers the true meaning of friendship.

Reviews!
5 Stars,* Cute, entertaining, charming drawings, with a profound message!
By Israel Drazin TOP 1000 REVIEWERVINE VOICE
While quite whimsical and entertaining with a story and drawings that children will enjoy, this book also contains a profound lesson about life, a lesson that could also be applied to politics and religion, a lesson of how and when to get along with others. A wonderful story with an important message.

5 Stars,* By Susan Keefe

Within the story are important messages. The reader has a wonderful opportunity to interact with the child as it learns about not only the different characteristics and traits of some wild animals, but also important life lessons such as self-awareness, understanding others and character judgement, in an easily absorbable way. 
This very talented author and illustrator has produced a lovely, colorfully illustrated book which I believe will really appeal to children.

5 Stars,*  If I were King, By Bryna Stone -

I read 'If I Were King' to my nephews and they enjoyed it as well as I did. The bright and fun illustrations transported us to Africa. The book uses a clever way to convey an important message: 'It is okay to be adventurous while recognizing your friends and being extra careful when it comes to their "turf" or boundaries.' I don't think I've read them a book before as enjoyable as this one where differences between people are celebrated and one finds his/her comfort zone among people of different background. Great book!

4 Stars,* By Lauren Johnson (Santa Clara, CA USA) -  

This is a great little children's book that is fun loving and easy to read. This book delves into a world of make believe and fantasy with a wonderful storyline and important message. I love how the author writes in different traits and characteristics of animals that would be great and fun for children to learn.
5 Stars,* By Lynn Petronella - AZ

Randa Handler has made a story that transcends childhood and incorporates real life experiences in a fun and entertaining story for all ages, I highly recommend this book for any family looking for a "new kind of story" to reach and teach children today.

5 Stars,* by Hope – Elementary School Teacher/Portland, OR. This is an excellent book to read with your children. Having worked as a preschool teacher, I appreciate how it teaches valuable lessons about self-awareness and individuality in an easy-to-read animal tale. The illustrations are rich and captivating, and the story encourages pretend-play, which is an important part of childhood development. I definitely recommend this book to any parent or educator using an e-reader with young children.
5 Stars,*  Lovely fable, By Ryan -NY

The illustrations in this book are beautiful. I never know what to get my nephew for his birthday, and this was the perfect solution. It has lots of animals, which everybody loves, and the story is like a beautiful fable. Very artistic. I loved it
5 Stars,*  Great for teaching values,

By Jessica Warne (Elementary School teacher,Los Angeles, CA) -
As a teacher I work at helping children understand the importance of empathy. That valuable quality is beautifully developed in this book as all the characters learn to understand each other's differences and respect them. The illustrations sensitively convey the range of emotions involved in accepting differences.
5 Stars,*  Wonderful illustrations, wonderful lessons in a complex world,

By Karen Shepherd (Eugene, OR) -
I have had the privilege of reading this lovely children's book. The illustrations are wonderful and perfectly suited to children. I believe they will love them. The story is engrossing enough to hold my attention, so it seems like children will love the characters and the lessons they learn through their adventures. This book is about safety and seeking out the "right" company AND acceptance of others who are different. Both, at the same time. Wonderful handling of a tough situation for parents of young children. Wonderful morals! Well done!
5 Stars,*  Charming, By P. Keller –( OC, CA)

A delightful and whimsical tale, lovingly illustrated, for preschool children that teaches them valuable lessons for life's playground. I would recommend to parents and teachers alike.
5 Stars,*  A Wonderful Tale!, By Italia Gandolfo "Italia" (KY) -
A story to be beloved by children and adults alike, If I Were King will remain in the hearts of everyone who reads it for generations. And I love the warm and whimsical illustrations!
5 Stars,*  By Christiane Hitti –(CT) A delightful Children's book, a very imaginative story with a lesson on living with one another peacefully. If you want your children to grow up in a world that helps them excel, and learn how to make very important choices in life. I do recommend this book to all parents with young children.

5 Stars,*  Great, By GB- (IL) “Charming story with great illustrations, engaging with its many plot twists, full of whimsy but also plenty of common sense. My kids loved it!”


Here's a summary of - The Boy Who Spoke to God:
Unable to agree on their ideas about God and religious celebrations, four different ethnic tribes—Greeks, Chinese, Zulus, and Mayans—who live together harmoniously most of the year, combining aspects of each of their cultures to make their kingdom strong and prosperous, suddenly become divisive when religious holidays approach. During such times, they cannot agree on the timing or manner of religious traditions, and they each have their own god who looks and dresses as they do. When Niko, a young Greek boy, has several dreams of God, each tribe interprets the various details of his dreams according to its own view of God, further emphasizing the tribes’ differences in beliefs. Subsequently Niko is shunned for having created even more disharmony and for lying to the tribes, or so they think, as no one believes he dreamed of God. To clear up all the confusion and arrive at the truth, Niko begs God to manifest in one final dream. This time God shows him that the tribes’ beliefs are actually different expressions of the same god. Niko concludes that God is like colorless and formless iridescent light and the beliefs of all tribes about their gods are correct as these gods are like colors of the rainbow that derive from white light.

story:
Hi. I'm Khadija Anderson, host of Desert Addicts Writers' Camp. Desert Addicts Writers' Camp is an annual writers retreat dedicated to offering outstanding and affordable poetry and non-fiction writing workshops in the desert. Our first Writer's Camp was held in May 2013 at a public campground in Joshua Tree National Park. Our next project is a permanent home for the Desert Addicts Writer's Camp at a private desert property near Joshua Tree. But I need your help.

I need to raise $2500 to cover the cost of basic necessities at the base camp or we will once again have to use a good portion of participant fees to rent noisy, crowded campsites, while that money should be used to pay our workshop leaders what they deserve for all their hard work.  So I'm turning to you, our strongest supporters, to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering thank you gifts such as postcards, books, and private writing consultations. Your contribution will help us complete our base camp and beyond that, it will help future writers participate in affordable annual desert writing retreats.

What we need is $2500 to purchase a composting toilet, solar generator, materials to build a shade pergola, and the means with which to tow a donated Airstream trailer from Seattle to the property.

The thank you gifts we are offering are Desert Addicts Writers' Camp postcards, a hand bound chapbook of 3 woodcuts and poems about the desert, a gorgeous anthology of desert writings, a poetry book pack of wonderful local poets, and a private consultation with either one of our workshop leaders either during this year's camp or via skype.

If we don't meet our entire goal, we will use the money collected to get as many items on the list as possible.

Even if you can't donate monetarily, please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

Thanks so much!!!

story:
A Short History:

Hello, my name is Liz Evans. I herald from Bakersfield, California and I am an Inspirational & Motivational speaker. For over 25+ years, I worked in the management level at several large firms. During my tenure, I personally witnessed bullying, gossiping and harassment in school and the workplace. 

After much thought , prayer, and reflection, I decided to take my personal experiences, and share them with the public. I now go out and speak about the perils and pitfalls of these very toxic subject matters. During my travels, I have heard many stories from those willing to share their personal journey, who have experienced many of the same things I have. Out of this, I am writing my first book that contains collections of short stories of those experiences.

I will be using the funds for expenses including educational material, supplies, and promotional items.

I am also going to be shooting a television pilot that we hope to air later on this year that pertains to this subject matter. Ultimately, I hope to produce a documentary film based on bullying, gossiping, and harassment and share this to the world through film festivals.

Here's What We Need:

Simply put, I need $2,500 for the following:

  • Educational Materials
  • Media/Press Kits
  • Supplies
  • Promotional items
  • Production of television show pilot
  • Mailing of press kits to applicable events, companies, and media outlets

My Goal:

Is to reach out to people, giving them the opportunity to share their stories, create a dialogue that will help others have a better understanding of this subject matter. I also hope to reach out to businesses, corporate HR departments, school districts, churches, camps, events and create workplace seminars, addressing this topic.

story:
The Impact

When language flourishes, erotic tales swerve and soar in and out of our bodies, allowing emotions to circle back into the here and now, with physiological connections of pulses, heartbeats, and sensations.

In popular psychology magazines, it was stated that women who read romance and erotica novels have sex with their partners over seventy percent more often than women who don’t, and that women who fantasize frequently have sex more often, have more fun in bed, and engage in a wider variety of erotic activities. 

You Loved the Empowerment and Fantasies Presented in 
"Erotica for the Soul, Vol.1"                                         
Based on the $8,000 it cost to publish our first book “Erotica for the Soul Vol.1” which included 15 stories, we estimate our second volume costing $11,000 and to accommodate the overwhelming amount of requests for it to have even more stories. 


The RawrWoman Writing Team

Focusing on the sophisticated nature of the female psyche, and the desire for a multi-layered stimulating experience, RawrWoman creates content that will entice, fascinate, and above all provide pleasure to the woman who indulges in all we have to offer. Our goal is to appeal to the female audience’s senses. To create a place where you can find self-expression through the stories we devise, and let your inhibitions go.


Help Make a Vol.2!

We truly appreciate All the overwhelming reviews we received from the first book “Erotica for the Soul Vol.1” which included 15 stories, we now want to bring Vol.2 to you; it will have 20 stories for your reading pleasure!

Our first book "Erotica for the Soul Vol. 1" is a collection of twelve short stories and three letters that turn up the heat and stimulate passion. These short stories are definitely erotica, but they also serve a purpose of letting women express themselves in creative and uninhibited ways. As the book states on page one, “Statistics show that most women are not seeking explicit scenes of sexual activity but rather character driven stories of romantic relationships that involve sex".     Our stories are all about female empowerment and making women feel more comfortable with their fantasies.

We don’t need to deny the fact that woman are sexual. It’s just that women approach and engage in sex differently than men do, generally speaking.  We like to feel, to experience, to have a connection of our heart/mind/and body. We need to feel safe before we can really explore, openly and fully. We also like to have fun, be adventurous and role-play. There are some women who can compartmentalize between love and sex, but not many as we find that it is often intertwined.

Reading erotic literature can be somewhere in the middle of societal taboo and personal excitement as we find ourselves peeking into a world that’s seductive and tantalizing.                          

“Nothing beats a Reader’s Own Imagination”

Many of our stories come from the real-life experiences of our writers; others are fantasies they have created with their wicked imaginations. 

We cater to not only the single woman, but also to couples who are looking to add a touch of spice or romance to their amorous relationship.

Though RawrWoman is written mostly by and for a female audience, it was conceptualized and manifested by Peter Hansen, he is focusing on an arousing destination built with the woman in mind, a place for women to feel safe, while focusing on the desire for a multi-layered stimulating experience.

Budget

Based on the $8,000 it cost to publish our first book “Erotica for the Soul Vol.1” which included 15 stories, we estimate our second volume costing $11,000 to accommodate the overwhelming amount of requests for it to have even more stories. With this extra money, Our Volume 2 will have 20 stories for your reading pleasure!

All expenses are listed below.

Content: Authors Stories,

Copyrights, publishing and licensing fees.

EBook, iTunes, ePub, Mobi formatting for the different eBook-readers/kindle/Fire HD/Ipad..

Illustrations, Media, Book-Cover Art, embedded fonts, tables, images, etc.

Indiegogo payment processing fees: 4% -

Credit Card/PayPal fee’s 3-5%

Total cost =$11,000

Everything above $11.000 will be Used to Create More Content, Pay of Artwork, Voice-Overs, and Pay for a Audio Book Version of “Erotica for the Soul, Vol.2” 

Thank You!

story:
What is this?

This is the long-awaited sequel to Pride & Prostitutes, our very first Adventurotica novel from 2010.

In 1884, Dolores "Dolly" Pride was drawn into her twin sister Delilah's exciting life of adventure, action, and sex.  The proper wife of Sheriff Hawk Pride, she was forced to impersonate her sister when she went missing, and learned to be a madam, as well as the masked avenger known as The Black Lash.

Now, a year later, Dolly and Delilah happily share the position of Madam, and they both ride the night as the Black Lash - righting wrongs and defending the innocent in frontier Kansas.  But now an international convocation of madams is coming in San Francisco, and Delilah cannot go, as she has evil to root out at home.  So Dolly will go in her place, meet madams from all over the world, and face the evil of Professor Von Draco and his designs upon the West - and the World!

  • This is our 13th Adventurotica title produced by two award-winning authors.
  • We use the funding for these campaigns to live.
  • You will help keep us alive and fed, and also contribute to the creation of awesome sexy adventure fiction.

We are artists who live by what we do, and this is how we make our way.  It does not pay much, but it allows us to keep doing what we love.

What We Need:

Money. (No point in beating around the bush.)

Here is how we will spend it:

  • Materials for the incentives. All that fun stuff has to come from somewhere!
  • Living expenses. Food, bills, and a roof to turn away the life-leeching rays of the blazing hatestar – sorry, the sun. We have this annoying hierarchy of needs thing going on. Damn you, Maslow!
  • Medical care. Writing all these naughty words can be dangerous, you know. Paper cuts, repetitive stress injuries, tragic Hitachi accidents . . . it's a brutal line of work. (Have you ever tried to get lube out of a keyboard?) No, seriously, some of us need to be medicated for the public good.

And there you have it. Most of it is going towards keeping us alive. Is that exciting? No! But we have to stay alive to write smut. Contrary to what you might think, zombies don't write very interesting sex scenes. It's just a lot of moaning and cannibalism.

What Happens:

We post the book serially on our site. This will be our 13th novel, and we've never failed to post three serial updates a week. We are reliable. The story will be finished on time. It is projected to run between 45 and 50 chapters, and should be between 125,000 and 150,000 words.

  • Memberships to Adventurotica will be available for use immediately, meaning you can follow along there, three times a week, until the story ends.
  • If you've bought yourself any sort of walk-on role or bonus scene, that will obviously come out with the ebook.
  • The ebook won't come out until after the book has been published in serial form on Adventurotica.com. You'll be able to read it at Adventurotica the entire time.
  • Print books will be released as soon after the ebook as possible.
  • Production of material incentives will begin after the campaign ends.

If we don't make goal, we'll still be able to provide the perks for everyone who did donate, and we'll do the best we can on what we get.

The Impact:

This is the part where we're supposed to explain how our project is valuable to you and to the world. No pressure. I'd love to claim that our project will bring about world peace by making sure nobody has a hand free to pull a trigger, but that seems unlikely.

  • What we can do is make people happy. Have a good time. Bring something that is unreservedly fun into the world, just because it belongs here.
  • Erotica is an important genre, and we want to make it a better, more entertaining place. Bottom line, people often complain, with good reason, that good erotica is difficult to find. That most of it is poorly-written. That the characters are flat. That the sex is boring. That it doesn't tell an interesting story.
  • We want to give readers entertainment for adults, not just adult entertainment. There is a dire shortage of well-written, fast-paced, plot-heavy long-form erotica. We want to write a book that provides you, the reader, with a well-told adventure story that doesn't fade to black just when things are getting good.
  • We want to encourage independent erotica publishing by being part of it. By publishing independently, we are freeing ourselves from the restrictions placed on authors by publishers; restrictions on content, on length, on ratio of plot to sex. We aren't breaking rules. We're stepping outside of them. We're doing our own thing, our way. And you can help!

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

Boost the signal! If you can't contribute, that's fine.  You can still tell everyone about us.

There are share tools right here on Indiegogo!  Also, we are assuming you have some social network stuff going on, so spreading the word that way would be super-awesome of you.

We're sure you have friends who would appreciate some swashbuckling smuttery, so, really, you'll be doing them a service sending them our way.

We sincerely appreciate those who support us by helping to spread the word. Y'all do a lot of good, and we cannot thank you enough.

story:
Who is Young Langston?

The name Young Langston to me means creativity and legacy. It's a Cleveland brand of a legenday name and future representation. My real name is Brendan Whitt and I'm a journalist, blogger and author from Cleveland, Ohio.


What I Need...

I'm looking for $500 dollars to cover the printing costs of my books A Summer In Harlem & When the Crows Come Home. I also need to print bookmarks and laptop\bumper stickers as promotional materials and incentives for purchasing a book. I need 100 copies printed for local bookstore placement.

A Summer In Harlem

My novella A Summer In Harlem, follows Thad who is your run of the mill fourteen year old from Beloit, Alabama during 1948. Thad's grandmother sends him to Harlem for the first three weeks of his summer break to visit his aunt and three cousins. 
When Thad finally gets to Harlem it isn't anything like what he’s heard and read about. With the help of his cousin Willie Thad learns about the harsh realities of inner city life during the end of the Jazz Era.

When the Crows Come Home

When the Crows Come Home is an and experimental Hip-Hop influenced poetry collection that tells the story of a Crow finding himself while coming to the reality of the state of his species. 'Crows' is an unapologetic analysis of the issues that face black people and our culture through my eyes.

What You Get For Helpin' Young Langston

  • $10 donation - The Just A Bird perk contains a signed copy of When the Crows Come Home   

  • $20 donation - The #YoungLangston perk contains a signed copy of When the Crows Come Home  along with a Young Langston bumper sticker.

  • $30 donation - The Trip Up North perk contains a signed copy of A Summer In Harlem and a Young Langston bookmark. 

  • $100 donation - The New Renaissance perk gives you the full Young Langston experience with signed copies of both books as well as a bumper sticker and bookmark.
All donors will receive a thank you message to be posted to my blog and social media sites. If I fail to reach my goal all funds will still go towards my printing costs and all donors will still receive their perks.

The Impact

Fiction and poetry has helped shape and influence the cultures that give us our identities as people. Cleveland is a city that is rich in the arts. I'm just contributing in my own way. Helping me achieve my goal ensures that another passionate artist will be able to share his art, his stories and his characters with the world.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk and obstacle facing me is myself. I have grown a lot over the past year after graduating from college, as both a person and as a writer. The life of a creative is being able to take a "no" on the chin and keep on moving. There is no time for self pity or loathing. There is only time for doing!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support financially that's fine, Young Langston understands. Here are other ways you can help. Share the link to the campaign on Facebook with your friends, subscribe to my blog 'When Brendan Whitt Thinks...' or go to your local book store and request my books. 

Do whatever you can to make sure Young Langston's stories get heard!!

story:
We are on a mission to publish the first comprehensive gluten free guide book! “Goodbye Gluten, Hello Delicious: Your Guide To Going Completely Gluten Free”, written by Delicious Alchemy founder Emma Killilea, will change the lives of those on restricted diets by offering advice, recipe ideas and a 30-day meal planner. We are looking to raise the production and publishing costs of the book, and once published, all proceeds of the book will go to our brand new charity – the Delicious Alchemy Charitable Foundation.

My name is Emma Killilea, I have coeliac disease, and 10 years ago I founded a gluten free food company called Delicious Alchemy. In celebration of our 10 year anniversary, we are setting up a charity called the Delicious Alchemy Charitable Foundation. This is the first fundraiser we are doing for the foundation and it’s part of a very ambitious project that we hope you will become part of!

We want to raise over £16,000 to put towards the production costs of the book I am writing to help people who need to transition from a gluten filled diet, to a gluten free diet. These costs will cover things such as beautiful food photography to compliment the recipes which will appear in the book. The book will be one of a kind – it’s not only a recipe book, it’s a supportive helping hand to guide and assist people.

We are aiming to make this book a worldwide bestseller and all proceeds of the book will go to the Foundation. This is why we need you to come on board!

The aim of Delicious Alchemy is to improve the lives of people on a restricted diet and the foundation is one of the ways we are making that happen. The Foundation will donate money and food to other charities and worthy causes that share our aims. As an example, we are donating gluten free food to the foodbanks supported by the Trussell Trust in the UK and we will be supporting medical and scientific research programmes that aim to find cures for, or ease the symptoms of those with, gluten related problems. 


What We Need & What You Get

    • We need £16,000 for the production costs of the book. As well as funding the editing and typesetting of the book, it will also go towards really beautiful food photography and food styling to compliment the gorgeous recipes in the book. To create a worldwide best-seller, we need the book to be inspiring and for people to be proud to exhibit it on their kitchen shelf. 
    • We have a huge variety of exciting perks that are exclusively available to our Indiegogo supporters, and won’t be available to anyone else! These include joining us on a whistle stop tour of Paris – we’ll be going on a 24-hour trip via the Eurostar to eat at an exclusively gluten free bakery, patisserie and restaurant that we love there. If you don’t fancy that, you could become an exclusive Product Tester for one whole year – getting your hands on brand new Delicious Alchemy products before anyone else! You could also get a signed copy of the book, or a social shout out with our gratitude. So, if you are passionate about free from food being available to food banks throughout the UK, if you’re a self-confessed foodie, or you just want to get your hands on the book – we have something to suit you. 
    • If we don’t reach our goal, whatever we have raised will go towards the food photography and food styling. Ultimately everyone penny is going towards the charity. If we over fund, which hopefully we will, the extra money will go towards the publishing costs of the book, such as the editing, the typesetting, design, etc. 

    The Impact

    21% of households in the UK alone contain at least one person who is avoiding a minimum of one allergen for health reasons. The top three allergens avoided are gluten, dairy and peanuts. Gluten-related symptoms range from life-threatening, to life-limiting to varying levels of discomfort, and the only way for sufferers to avoid being ill is to go on a gluten free diet.

    It’s extremely difficult to move onto a gluten free diet and it’s even more difficult to maintain it – gluten is in everything! These people, like me, need this diet for health reasons, many of them serious, therefore helping people to achieve, and ultimately to enjoy, this life-long regime is very important.

    Raising awareness for the conditions that a gluten free diet is known to cure or improve is also important. Coeliac disease is a very serious condition and a gluten free diet cures it but did you know that people with arthritis, Crohn’s disease, autism and colitis can also benefit from a gluten free diet?

    Myself, and everyone at Delicious Alchemy, want people on restricted diets to know what they can and cannot eat and I want to see them out and about with their friends, enjoying life and all it has to offer! We don’t want them inadvertently eating gluten and being ill for days on end or being too scared to leave the house in case they get poisoned. Unfortunately, this is the reality for many people so let’s change it!

    Our Challenges & Other Ways You Can Help

    The main risk we face is that this crowdfund campaign does not reach the people who need the help. If you know anyone who would benefit from our book or charity, please send them this link so that we can fund and hopefully overfund our goal! Please post it on your Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and even My Space (if you still have it!) . You can also use the Indiegogo share buttons at the top of the page. 

    We know that gluten-related medical conditions are on the rise and more and more people need a book like this to help them.

    There are plenty of pretty recipe books out there but none that truly guide people through what can be a frightening and lonely journey.  Please help us to spread the word and make this project happen! 

    Thank you for viewing our Indiegogo page - if you like the idea of the book but donating on here isn't really your thing, you can sign up to our newsletter to be kept up to date with when the book will be available to purchase. Sign up here: http://confirmsubscription.com/h/d/FB2A27F3A912...

    We've received such wonderful comments and support in Week One of the #DACrowdfund. Rebecca Smith, best known as superstar gluten free blogger Glutarama, has supported the #DACrowdfund and shares her story here, explaining how our book, 'Goodbye Gluten, Hello Delicious' would have been valuable to her when she and her family had to switch to a gluten free diet. Read more here.

story:
Story of My Book

Yellow Boxes is a book that follows a half-Korean girl searching for her mother in a dream world that twists and coils her reality irreparably. At the same time, an auntie appears, urging beautifully wrapped yellow presents onto the girl and her nine sisters.

My name is Eun Hye Kim and I am the author of Yellow Boxes. I wrote this book because I've always been fascinated with dream and alternate worlds, particularly the strange ways in which the familiar manifests and lingers with us, even into our wakening.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will identify with what seeps in and takes shape for a tightly-enclosed family of ten girls in their mother's absence. Through this book, I want people to see their own family beyond their given roles of mother, father, sister, aunt... My immigrant parents work six days a week, which has accumulated into almost two decades now, in the consuming life of running a restaurant. It is bittersweet to compare the parents I know with the people they were in the faded photos of old albums, when they used to be called by their names – not only someone's mother or father. Ultimately I hope you can come out of this book seeking to understand the people closest to us more carefully, especially the parts of them that are still strange to you, before it is too late.

In this book, you'll learn about love, and the ways in which it sustains and destroys people:
  • Yeo-deol, the main character, who tries to trace back to the root of maternal love
  • Daddy, who chases a great, divine love
  • Mama, who is haunted by the ghostly strings of fated love

You will love this book if you have a taste for magical realism and stories that bring you back to familial relationships, and the different way we tug at and tie ourselves within them.

Yellow Boxes is a fiction book that speaks to young adults emerging into their own lives who are looking at their identity within and outside of their family.

 

The Book - Yellow Boxes

The book sets out on the day that Yeo-deol Henderson turns 29 years old – the same age as her Mama was the winter that she disappeared, leaving Yeo-deol's father and nine other sisters in a desolate house. Yeo-deol goes back to this winter 14 years ago, when she slept through most of the days and a woman claiming to be their auntie began to ring their doorbell, offering beautifully wrapped yellow presents.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December 2019
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Eun Hye Kim is graduating from the University of Washington in fall 2019 with a double degree in creative writing and business administration with a focus in marketing. She worked for her school newspaper, The Daily, and served as the prose editor of Bricolage, a literary and visual arts student journal.

Eun Hye wrote this book during her last year of college in an honest fear for the day she might not be writing anymore. Her stories thread the twisted and tender faces of familial love, and false nostalgia relating to immigration and the displacement of home.

Aside from typing on her red MacBook with red headphones, Eun Hye can be found reapplying her red lipstick before carefully sipping an iced coffee. She adores bunnies, listening to the Korean singer IU, Korean dramas, and eating pizzas choked with garlic.

For more information you can connect with Eun Hye at gracekim.731@gmail.com and @eunhuihui on Instagram or https://www.linkedin.com/in/eun-hye-kim-0031/ on LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #YellowBoxes and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Eun Hye Kim
