story:
Short Summary

  • My name is William Matson. I am the writer of the acclaimed book "Crazy Horse: The Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" which was written with Crazy Horse family members Floyd Clown, Doug War Eagle, and Don Red Thunder based on the family's oral history. I am also an award winning documentary film maker.

  • My journey has been an extraordinary one. My father had his basic training during World War II at Camp Stoneman in Pittsburg, California. It was run by the 7th Cavalry, the unit commanded by Lt Col George Armstrong Custer during the Battle of the Little Bighorn in 1876. During his training there his drill sergeant asked him who won the Battle of the Little Bighorn. When he said the Natives did he was punished. The punishment was so severe that he vowed to write a book someday from the Native side of the Battle. But life got in the way. At 71 years of age he was diagnosed with lymphoma. On his deathbed in 1998 he asked me to finish his mission. It was his dying wish. I couldn't say no. In 2001 while attempting to carry out his wish, he spoke to me from the other side at a place called Bear Butte. He told me to learn Lakota spiritual and cultural ways. So I read the books about their spirituality and culture. When I came back to Bear Butte in 2002, I met with the Head Ranger Jim Jandreau who gave me the phone number of a Crazy Horse family member named Doug War Eagle. The Crazy Horse family had taken a vow of silence for over a century not to tell anyone who they were. Thus the true story of Crazy Horse from his family was hidden all that time. This book is about the journey to meet and coming to a mutual trust with the Crazy Horse family members. This book is about a journey no one else in the world has ever been on and probably will never be another one like it. This story is one of a kind.

  • While with members of the Clown family on our “Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior’s Life and Legacy” book tour, we broke a lot of ground. We saw around 10,000 people during our tour. We saw their hunger to learn about the Lakota ways. To have a deeper understanding of their history. This book digs deeper into understanding the Lakota ways through the eyes of someone who was not raised a Lakota and knew very little about their ways until I met them. I spent eighteen years in close contact with the Clown family. Hopefully this will help those unfamiliar with Lakota spirituality learn it as I learned it. Through eyes that knew nothing and were suspicious at first until I learned the truth of their ways. I also write how their oral history was verified. My goal is to promote the understanding of their culture. For people to realize that the Lakota have more to contribute to the world, then the world previously knew about. I told it from my heart because that is where my journey was centered.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • To publish "In My Father's Footsteps" there are several steps. A Manuscript Edit is required to insure that everything I have written is easily readable, understood and the spelling is spot on. I will be working with Mary Neighbours on that and her fee is $700. The paperback book will have to be formatted. If it is just words it will be about $200, if it includes photos the price will jump depending on whether they are black and white or color. Most of the original photos are color but can be made to be black and white. With photos the formatting will be about $240 for black and white or color. Cover design runs $1000-$1500. Printing costs for 1000 books for black and white will cost about $4170. If we go with the color photos it is nearly double that at $8000.  So total cost for black and white is about $6500. If we are fortunate enough to raise more than color is $11250. Reward costs and fees to Indiegogo are estimated at around $1000.  So the minimum to get 1000 physical paperbacks is $7500. For color it is $13,500. 
  • It's a chance to get William Matson's follow up book to "Crazy Horse The Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" right off the press and also autographed by Matson at a reduced price from retail. If you haven't gotten a copy of "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" it is a chance to finally pick it up. Also the 4 part series "The Authorized Biography of Crazy Horse and His Family" and the DVD "Journey of the Heart" is available for those who want to see where the family's oral history happened. You can also talk to Matson by phone for 30 minutes on his experiences he wrote about in his book. There are three opportunities available within the first pages of the book for your name or the name of a loved one to be printed in every book that comes off the press. It will be under a heading reading: "The following are the People most responsible for publishing this book". A single person may donate to get all three slots or even two slots or just a single slot. There will be no slots added later.
  • We are hope and pray that we reach our goal to print our book. But if we fall short of our goal, we will still print to order. In the case of the DVDs and "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" rewards, they are already pressed and will be sent out. If we fail to reach our goal to get 1000 copies we will have to have them printed one at a time and impractical to plan any book tours or to get it on any book store shelves, It will also extend the waiting time if someone ordered a copy of the "In My Father's Footsteps"not to mention the retail price will have to increase substantially just to get it printed after the crowdfunding.

The Impact

  • Learning a culture you did not grow up with is not as easy. We have built in prejudices that most of us aren't even aware of. I was not a very spiritual person when I started this journey and so when my deceased father spoke to me three years after he died and when Crazy Horse's long dead father rose out of the rocks of a sweat lodge, I was both excited and confused,,,until I found the deeper meaning of why it happened, spiritually, culturally, and intellectually. I will now have a chance to tell a story that is old, yet very new to many. To tell what I learned in my 18 years of deep friendship with the Crazy Horse family and other Lakota elders that I was fortunate enough to go on this journey with. I believe if the many cultures of the world can understand each other rather than compete than we're on our way to a better and more peaceful world. A world richer in knowledge and life. A world with less misunderstandings.
  • This is the second book I have written. The first I wrote "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy", we met at least 10,000 people at 317 book talks in the US and Europe. We were very well received. The family communicated much about the Lakota culture and spirituality that most people did not know. They learned through the eyes of the Crazy Horse family what it was like to be part of that family for the past two centuries. I got to stand with them and tell what I saw.
  • I told "In My Father's Footsteps" from my heart. It is the only way I know how to write. Anyone who has read "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" is familiar with my style. I wrote t"In My Father's Footsteps" with the same painstaking and completely honest approach. I would be robbing the reader, the people I write about, and myself if I did it any other way.

Risks & Challenges

Although I have already one published book, the publishing was taken care of by a professional publisher. "In My Father's Footsteps" is written. This is the first time I have self-published. So each step in this process its a new adventure. 

  • I an employing Mary Neighbours, an experienced self publishing professional, to help me through the process. I will persevere until I get everything done professionally and right.
  • I will follow hers and any other hired professional's advice religiously. I plan on using Ingram Spark to print the books. Ingram Spark is owned by the Ingram book distribution network, the most recognized and largest book distribution network in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate, you can share this project with your friends. Energy has a value all its own. THANK YOU!

I am also an award winning documentary film maker.
My journey has been an extraordinary one. My father had his basic training during World War II at Camp Stoneman in Pittsburg, California. It was run by the 7th Cavalry, the unit commanded by Lt Col George Armstrong Custer during the Battle of the Little Bighorn in 1876. During his training there his drill sergeant asked him who won the Battle of the Little Bighorn. When he said the Natives did he was punished. The punishment was so severe that he vowed to write a book someday from the Native side of the Battle. But life got in the way. At 71 years of age he was diagnosed with lymphoma. On his deathbed in 1998 he asked me to finish his mission. It was his dying wish. I couldn't say no. In 2001 while attempting to carry out his wish, he spoke to me from the other side at a place called Bear Butte. He told me to learn Lakota spiritual and cultural ways. So I read the books about their spirituality and culture. When I came back to Bear Butte in 2002, I met with the Head Ranger Jim Jandreau who gave me the phone number of a Crazy Horse family member named Doug War Eagle. The Crazy Horse family had taken a vow of silence for over a century not to tell anyone who they were. Thus the true story of Crazy Horse from his family was hidden all that time. This book is about the journey to meet and coming to a mutual trust with the Crazy Horse family members. This book is about a journey no one else in the world has ever been on and probably will never be another one like it. This story is one of a kind.
While with members of the Clown family on our “Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior’s Life and Legacy” book tour, we broke a lot of ground. We saw around 10,000 people during our tour. We saw their hunger to learn about the Lakota ways. To have a deeper understanding of their history. This book digs deeper into understanding the Lakota ways through the eyes of someone who was not raised a Lakota and knew very little about their ways until I met them. I spent eighteen years in close contact with the Clown family. Hopefully this will help those unfamiliar with Lakota spirituality learn it as I learned it. Through eyes that knew nothing and were suspicious at first until I learned the truth of their ways. I also write how their oral history was verified. My goal is to promote the understanding of their culture. For people to realize that the Lakota have more to contribute to the world, then the world previously knew about. I told it from my heart because that is where my journey was centered.

 

What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

To publish "In My Father's Footsteps" there are several steps. A Manuscript Edit is required to insure that everything I have written is easily readable, understood and the spelling is spot on. I will be working with Mary Neighbours on that and her fee is $700. The paperback book will have to be formatted. If it is just words it will be about $200, if it includes photos the price will jump depending on whether they are black and white or color. Most of the original photos are color but can be made to be black and white. With photos the formatting will be about $240 for black and white or color. Cover design runs $1000-$1500. Printing costs for 1000 books for black and white will cost about $4170. If we go with the color photos it is nearly double that at $8000.  So total cost for black and white is about $6500. If we are fortunate enough to raise more than color is $11250. Reward costs and fees to Indiegogo are estimated at around $1000.  So the minimum to get 1000 physical paperbacks is $7500. For color it is $13,500. 
It's a chance to get William Matson's follow up book to "Crazy Horse The Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" right off the press and also autographed by Matson at a reduced price from retail. If you haven't gotten a copy of "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" it is a chance to finally pick it up. Also the 4 part series "The Authorized Biography of Crazy Horse and His Family" and the DVD "Journey of the Heart" is available for those who want to see where the family's oral history happened. You can also talk to Matson by phone for 30 minutes on his experiences he wrote about in his book. There are three opportunities available within the first pages of the book for your name or the name of a loved one to be printed in every book that comes off the press. It will be under a heading reading: "The following are the People most responsible for publishing this book". A single person may donate to get all three slots or even two slots or just a single slot. There will be no slots added later.
We are hope and pray that we reach our goal to print our book. But if we fall short of our goal, we will still print to order. In the case of the DVDs and "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" rewards, they are already pressed and will be sent out. If we fail to reach our goal to get 1000 copies we will have to have them printed one at a time and impractical to plan any book tours or to get it on any book store shelves, It will also extend the waiting time if someone ordered a copy of the "In My Father's Footsteps"not to mention the retail price will have to increase substantially just to get it printed after the crowdfunding.


The Impact

Learning a culture you did not grow up with is not as easy. We have built in prejudices that most of us aren't even aware of. I was not a very spiritual person when I started this journey and so when my deceased father spoke to me three years after he died and when Crazy Horse's long dead father rose out of the rocks of a sweat lodge, I was both excited and confused,,,until I found the deeper meaning of why it happened, spiritually, culturally, and intellectually. I will now have a chance to tell a story that is old, yet very new to many. To tell what I learned in my 18 years of deep friendship with the Crazy Horse family and other Lakota elders that I was fortunate enough to go on this journey with. I believe if the many cultures of the world can understand each other rather than compete than we're on our way to a better and more peaceful world. A world richer in knowledge and life. A world with less misunderstandings.
This is the second book I have written. The first I wrote "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy", we met at least 10,000 people at 317 book talks in the US and Europe. We were very well received. The family communicated much about the Lakota culture and spirituality that most people did not know. They learned through the eyes of the Crazy Horse family what it was like to be part of that family for the past two centuries. I got to stand with them and tell what I saw.
I told "In My Father's Footsteps" from my heart. It is the only way I know how to write. Anyone who has read "Crazy Horse the Lakota Warrior's Life and Legacy" is familiar with my style. I wrote t"In My Father's Footsteps" with the same painstaking and completely honest approach. I would be robbing the reader, the people I write about, and myself if I did it any other way.


Risks & Challenges
Although I have already one published book, the publishing was taken care of by a professional publisher. "In My Father's Footsteps" is written. This is the first time I have self-published. So each step in this process its a new adventure. 

I an employing Mary Neighbours, an experienced self publishing professional, to help me through the process. I will persevere until I get everything done professionally and right.
I will follow hers and any other hired professional's advice religiously. I plan on using Ingram Spark to print the books. Ingram Spark is owned by the Ingram book distribution network, the most recognized and largest book distribution network in the world.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't afford to donate, you can share this project with your friends. Energy has a value all its own. THANK YOU!

Short Summary

We are Hercules Editions, a small London-based press founded in 2012 with the vision of bringing together poetry and original visual responses.

Our latest project is an exciting new chapbook from poet, translator and critic Martyn Crucefix.

In Cargo of Limbs, a modern re-imagining of Book Six of Virgil's Aeneid, two Western journalists document – in their contrasting ways – the ordeal of Syrian migrants fleeing war and persecution, trying to cross the Mediterranean in search of safety in contemporary Europe.

The tone and narrative of this new work – as in the original – is dream-like and nightmarish. As their journey unfolds, the journalists and those they travel with approach a shoreline. But this is not the River Styx; it is the inhospitable edge of the Mediterranean and the ferryman’s boats – "the black dinghy squeals / the leaking boat groans" – seem to promise danger more than escape.

Dan O’Brien, US poet, playwright and author of War Reporter, writes: "Martyn Crucefix knows in his bones that “what / happens is what’s true” and his liquid, propulsive poem records, like the accompanying photographs by Syrian artist Amel Alzakout, the horrible adventure of survival. Cargo of Limbs sees or struggles to see; it is a lament and a rebuke, a concise saga of our savage time".

Amel Alzakout captured the photographs that accompany the book on a camera strapped to her wrist as she was fleeing Syria. During the crossing, the boat she was travelling on capsized; she was extremely fortunate to survive. Amel's images appeared in Richard Mosse's film Incoming, part of Forensic Architecture's Turner Prize-shortlisted investigation of the incident; they will also form the basis of the upcoming film Purple Sea. 

The book also includes an essay on the current migration crisis by the Kurdish poet Choman Hardi, and an essay on the process of writing the poem by the author.

story:
Story of My Book

Quality Time Left is an exploration of life’s third act. It explores the opportunities and pitfalls that drive a healthier, engaging, and connected retirement. 

My name is Curtis Bailey and I am the author of Quality Time Left. I wrote this book because I have seen the importance of planning for retirement beyond someone’s financials. It’s about taking control over your time remaining to pursue the things most important to you.

My hope is that this book will help you discover small changes that can have a huge impact on how you spend your time. It’ll help show you how retirement can be dynamic and joyful. It builds on the foundation of a great career. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool for ideas to consider for building a quality life with our time remaining. 

In this book, you’ll learn about rest ethic and healthspan. You’ll hear stories about how real retirees achieved, struggled, and became seemingly entirely new people. There is a couple that went from being corporate executives to running a farm. Instead of retiring quietly in the suburbs, they decided to cultivate a new self-image and foster memories for their grandkid; helping out with the livestock and in the fields. 

You’ll love this book if you want to learn from retirees and retirement experts about the key drivers for a more content retirement. 

Quality Time Left is a nonfiction book that speaks to retirees and people within five years of retirement who want to look at retirement in a new way. 

 

The Book - Quality Time Left

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 is about Healthspan. These chapters discuss food, movement, and recovery. It helps explain how to help fight off chronic disease, be independent longer, and feel generally happier. It all starts with these small daily decisions that allow us to live the life we want. 

Part 2 is about Relationships. Across these chapters, we explore family, friendship, and helping others. Loss and loneliness are challenges that retirees face if they don’t have and cultivate a strong support system. The vast majority of work connections fizzle away, yet with a more open schedule comes the opportunity to reconnect with old friends and develop better connections. 

Part 3 is about Engagement. There is a huge shift in identity around retirement. One of the first questions we’re often asked is “what do you do?” This part delves into continuous learning, staying engaged, and nurturing your tribe. For some, this means a new entrepreneurial venture. Others, finally find the time to dedicate their skillset to charities they love. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication. If you know me, this requires a real professional. 
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $7,500 and the book will get an audio edition.

 

About the Author

Curtis Bailey is a Financial Advisor and Founder of Quiet Wealth Management LLC, Cincinnati’s first flat-fee, fee-only wealth management firm. He holds multiple advanced designations as a Certified Financial Planner©, Enrolled Agent with the IRS©, Chartered Retirement Planning Counselor©, and Chartered Financial Analyst Charterholder©.

He is passionate about helping individuals and families build and sustain their wealth. This book explores his passion for helping people see money as a tool to fund a meaningful life. In particular, this book pulls on his experience of working with retirees and seeing successes, false starts, and where people have gotten stuck. 

Curtis is a father of two young children that challenge his desire for order and serenity. He is a weekend-warrior triathlete which provides a much needed outlet. 

For more information, you can connect with Curtis Bailey at curtistbailey@gmail.com and on LinkedIn. 
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

DM me for information, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!

I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #qualitytimeleft or #qtl and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!


Tag: 
Facebook - Curtis Bailey / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter - @quiet_wealth / @NewDegreePress
LinkedIn - Curtis Bailey / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Cheers!

Curtis Bailey

story:
Hi,

My name is Marco Bueninck and I worked for the last 36 years in the publishing business in Europe, US and Latin America. I am a Dutch national, living for 21 years in Mexico.

In 2010, I started a publishing company called Editorial PubliPromo Internacional, publishing in Mexico Life Style Magazines, Women titles, Sport Magazines and Health & Fitness publications in Spanish. Check us out in the Media Gallery.

We are passionate about using various platforms to bring high quality publications to our Mexican readers. That's why we decided to make a magazine that talks about Mexican design, creativity, culture and sophistication.

What better way of doing this than to associate ourselves with Martha Stewart. 

Why Martha Stewart? 

Because the Martha Stewart concept is considered the top brand in its publishing category, covering all aspects of life style, home decorating, out-door life and much more.  

Mexico is a dynamic and cosmopolitan country. We want to focus on what is happening in Mexico and connect our readers with people like Pedro Reyes, Emiliano Godoy, Ezequiel Farca, Monica Patiño among others, make them aware of stores like "Decoupage", "Puro Gusto" and others - everything that makes Mexico a 21st century country. 

The first issue of Martha Stewart Living Mexico in Spanish launches March 1st 2014, 104 pages printed in full color on high quality paper, with balanced editorial content of Mexican articles and international/US stories. Simultaneously, we are launching a digital version. We are offering our readers tips on how to bring colors into their home, decorate with flowers, create a superb dinner table and even how to organize closets.  A magazine for the Mexican woman to enhance her life through exciting ideas for the modern Mexican home

Martha Stewart Living Mexico (6 issues per year), targeted to the Mexican women between 30 and 50 years old, ABC, C+ income segment with higher education. This makes the magazine in print and digital a very powerful vehicle for advertisers to reach this segment of the market.

What We Need & What You Get.

We know that the Martha Stewart brand will have an impact in Mexico and to achieve this goal we need US$90,000 to fund the start-up of the first 4 issues (8 months). Thereafter, the project will be self-sustaining. All funds are used for the making of the magazine:

  • Printing/Editorial: US$45,000
  • Marketing/Promotion: US$10,000

We want to make YOU a part of the success of this project and reward you for your contribution. You will be our most valuable customer/reader, becoming "ears and eyes" in the market by giving us feed-back on the magazine. 

Every contribution of US$25 will be rewarded with the "Martha Stewart Living Mexico Early Bird"  subscription program and receive for FREE 1 year (6 issues, print and/or digital) delivered to your home BEFORE the magazine hits the newsstand. Regular subscription price US$43

Some other ways you can help us.....

  • Get the word out to your friends and making noise about our campaign.

Thank you for watching the video and reading about this project. We look forward to sending you your reward soon and we truly hope you will join this project!

And please send us your comments!


Versión española

Hola.

Mi nombre es Marco Bueninck y llevo 36 años trabajando en la industria editorial.  Soy holandés, con 21 años viviendo en México.

En 2010 formé una editorial, PubliPromo Internacional, publicando en español revistas sobre Estilo de Vida, Deportes y Salud & Bienestar para Mujeres, enfocados al mercado mexicano. Ver nuestros productos en la Galería Multimedia.Nos apasiona poder utilizar diversas plataformas para llevar a nuestros lectores mexicanos publicaciones de la más alta calidad.  Es con este afán que tomamos la decisión de crear una revista sobre el diseño, la creatividad y la cultura sofisticada de México.

Que mejor manera para lograr esto que habernos asociados con la reconocida Martha Stewart.

¿Porque Martha Stewart?

El concepto que define a Martha Stewart es considerado líder en su categoria, al cubrir una amplia gama de estilos de vida, decoración del hogar, jardín y patios, así como todo lo relacionado con el buen vivir. 

Reconociendo el México dinámico y cosmopolita de hoy, buscamos enfocarnos en la vida actual del país, conectando nuestros lectores con personajes como Pedro Reyes, Emiliano Godoy, Ezequiel Farca, y Mónica Patiño, entre otros, así como darles a conocer tiendas como “Decoupage”, “Puro Gusto” – todo aquello que hace de México un país del Siglo XXI. 

Lanzaremos la primera edición de Martha Stewart Living México en español el 1º de marzo del 2014, 104 páginas a todo color en papel de alta calidad; en el contenido editorial, buscamos un equilibrio entre artículos sobre México y estadounidenses e internacionales. De manera simultánea, saldrá la versión digital. A través de estos medios ofrecemos a nuestro lector consejos tales como el renovar sus hogares usando colores, la decoración con arreglos florales, mesas puestas para deslumbrar al invitado y hasta ideas novedosas en la organización de closets.  En resumen, una revista para la mujer mexicana contemporánea que busca realzar su vida por medio de ideas creativas y provocadoras para el hogar mexicano actual.

Martha Stewart Living México (6 ediciones por año) es por las mujeres mexicanas entre 30 y 50 años de edad, en segmentos ABC, C +, de clase media alta. Un vehículo muy poderoso para anunciantes que buscan llegar a este segmento del mercado.

¿Que necesitamos y que obtienes?

Para lograr nuestra meta, necesitamos $90,000.00 dólares para asegurar el financiamiento de los primeros 4 números (8 meses). A partir de esto, el proyecto será autosustentable. Todos los fondos serán utilizados para la producción de la revista:

• Impresión / Editorial primeros 4 números: $45,000 dólares

• Marketing / Promoción: $10,000 dólares

Queremos que TU formes parte del éxito de este proyecto y premiaremos tu contribución. Serás nuestro cliente/lector más valioso, convirtiéndote en nuestros “ojos y oídos” dentro del mercado con tu  retroalimentación sobre esta revista.

Cade contribución mínimo de $25 dólares formará parte del programa de subscriptores “Martha Stewart Living Mexico Early Bird” y recibirás, GRATIS, un año la revista (6 números impresos y/o digitales) entregada a tu casa ANTES de salir a la venta – esto tiene un valor regular de $43 dólares.

Otras formas en las que puedes apoyar es proyecto…..

• Corre la voz entre tus amigos y haciendo ruido sobre nuestra campaña.

Muchas gracias por ver el video y leer acerca de este proyecto. Esperamos
enviarle vuestra recompensa muy pronto y que realmente esperamos que se unan este proyecto!

Y, por favor, envienos sus comentarios de este proyecto!

Hi, 
My name is Marco Bueninck and I worked for the last 36
years in the publishing business in Europe, US and Latin America. I am a Dutch
national, living for 21 years in Mexico.

high quality publications to our Mexican readers. That's why we decided to
make a magazine that talks about Mexican design, creativity, culture and
sophistication.

Stewart. Why Martha Stewart?  Because
the Martha Stewart concept is considered the top brand in its publishing
category, covering all aspects of life style, home decorating, out-door life
and much more.   Mexico is a dynamic and cosmopolitan country. We want to focus on what is happening
in Mexico and connect our readers with people like Pedro Reyes, Emiliano Godoy,
Ezequiel Farca, Monica Patiño among others, make them aware of stores like
"Decoupage", "Puro Gusto" and others - everything that
makes Mexico a 21st century country. The first issue of Martha Stewart Living Mexico in
Spanish launches March 1st 2014, 104 pages printed in full color
on high quality paper, with balanced editorial content of Mexican articles
and international/US stories. Simultaneously, we are launching a digital
version. We are offering our readers tips on how to bring colors into their
home, decorate with flowers, create a superb dinner table and even
how to organize closets.  A magazine for the Mexican woman to enhance her
life through exciting ideas for the modern Mexican home
Martha Stewart Living Mexico (6 issues per year), targeted to the Mexican women
between 30 and 50 years old, ABC, C+ income segment with higher
education. This makes the magazine in print and digital
a very powerful vehicle for advertisers to reach this segment of the market. What We Need & What You Get. We
know that the Martha Stewart brand will have an impact in Mexico and to achieve
this goal we need US$90,000 to fund the start-up of the first 4 issues (8
months). Thereafter, the project will be self-sustaining. All funds are used

on the magazine.

story:
Discovering The Penokees


About the Project


For the last three years photographer Joel Austin has been taking pictures in the Penokee Hills of northern Wisconsin. We are now in the process of pulling together his images of this wild and beautiful place together into a book. Many people have not heard of the Penokees, but now they are in the spotlight as the site of a huge proposed open pit iron mine. If the mine were to be allowed to operate, it would be the one of the largest in the world at 22 miles long, about 1/2 mile wide and nearly 1000 feet deep -- all in the Bad River Watershed, with its wild rivers, valuable wetlands, and local communities including the Bad River Indian Reservation. It all eventually empties into Lake Superior; as Joel points out: “The quality of Lake Superior’s water is determined by activities in the watershed."


About the book

Discovering the Penokees will be mostly pictures but will also feature a fair amount of text on potential impacts of a mine: economic, environmental, and human health effects (which will be especially hard on the Bad River Indian Reservation). We are planning a 10x8 (horizontal) softcover book of 160 pages, and possibly also an e-book. The book will also include a map of the region and other references. Projected availability is December 2013.


Our Team and Goals  

Along with Joel and others contributing to this book, Sweetwater Visions is committed to this project. While the funds raised by Indiegogo will go directly towards producing and marketing this book, the profits from sale of the book will be used to work with others to fight this mine—to leave open other future possibilities for developing a sustainable economy, to preserve this landscape for future generations so they are able to stay, work and play here.


Stretch Goals

Our budget will change depending on funds raised with Indiegogo and we will allow for our project to evolve and change as it nears completion, depending on our available budget. Our goal of $3,000 is the very minimum that we need to get this project off the ground, but if we can raise $6,000 or more, we can do an offset press print run, which lowers the cost per book and thus increases the amount that can go to the cause.


Positive Message

Joel wants the book to be positive: “We will cover some negative impacts of mining, but what I want to focus on is what an incredibly beautiful area this is — an area that, although I was born in Wisconsin, and have lived 33 of my 34 years in the state, I hadn't even heard of until a few years ago. My guess is that not many people do know about the beauty of the Penokees. And that's a big reason why I want to do this: to let people know what an incredible resource we have in the Penokees, and maybe to even question the wisdom of mining it — steer them towards thinking that maybe the value of the Penokees isn't what we can get at by blasting them and hauling part of them away.”  Instead of just thinking in terms of fighting against something the book will give reasons why we should fight for things like sustainability, beauty, and health.

Reasons your contribution will make this happen:

  • The pictures are already taken. We're not starting from scratch. Austin is an award winning photographer and has been previously published in places like Lake Superior Magazine.
  • The book design and layout is nearly finished. 
  • Sweetwater Visions is an experienced small publisher, having published an award-winning photographic book on Lake Superior and several Great Lakes videos. 
  • Sweetwater Visions’ experienced editor is already working on the book.
  • All of the people working on this book are willing to work on the tight budget that a project like this requires because they believe in the cause.


But we now need your financial help to make this book a reality.


Please help spread the word by sharing this campaign. 
(Feel free to use Indiegogo share tools.)


For more information about Sweetwater Visions and Discovering the Penokees— www.sweetwatervisions.com


To view the video of Jenny Mahan's song —"Where Will You Stand?"

(In response to requests for the words to this song, we have posted them in our Updates section.)


Penokee Hills 2014 Calendar—

story:
There's the Bible, War and Peace, Catcher in the Rye, The Joy of Sex, Huckleberry Finn and soon... I Thought You Were Dead!

 

Let's try this again!

If you're anything like me—except you probably wear underwear and swear less—you live for a good story. And like me, once the ringing stops, you want to curl up with a good book and gobble up the sad but true life stories from the famous and the infamous.

Well my friends, famous I'm not. Infamous, well that's up for debate. However, that doesn't mean I don't have some stories to tell. I'm not a rock star, a spoiled playboy, a rich asshole, a mass murderer or a serial killer who lucked out with a book deal because they irreparably fucked up their life.

Hell no. I'm just a maladjusted, emotionally stunted, misfit that learned early to unfurl and fly my freak flag like I'm charging a fortified hill in the Civil war. For a couple of decades I was a Roadie (still am) and in between that I made some messes. What separates me from you, is that I've chosen to walk the left handed path, stumbling through life, destroying myself inside and out, going against the grain, and somehow after all was bled and done. I found myself accomplishing some astounding things along the way. Shit so compelling that others thought it entertaining enough to write about. Recently featured in:

The recent festival issue of Loaded in the UK good luck finding it June 2013

Complex Magazine

http://www.complex.com/pop-culture/2012/01/roadie-diaries-tour-professionals-reveal-their-craziest-tales-from-the-road

Red Bull Magazine

http://www.redbullusa.com/cs/Satellite/en_US/Article/Rock-Band-Roadie-Jef-Hickey-in-the-August-2012-Red-Bulletin-Magazine-021243224859997

LA Weekly

http://www.laweekly.com/2004-03-11/news/too-old-to-rock-too-young-to-die/

 

Truth be told, I didn't raise hell all over the world destroying myself on a daily basis, ripping wounds in me that'll never heal, decorating my body with yards of scars and tattoos only to keep all that dirt to myself. Fuck no, I've got something to say. A cautionary tale if you will...whatever the case, I did it on my own terms and that deserves a few thousand paragraphs if do say so myself. Don't listen to me, you decide.

So friends, enemies, and exes I invite you to dive into the twisted, chaotic and tragic life that I've led so far. With your support you can...

MARVEL- at my stories from the road with some killer bands like Megadeth, Queens of the Stone Age, Motorhead, Danzig, Type O Negative, Crashdiet, Buckcherry , GBH, Sepultura, Prong, The Accused, Celtic Frost... just to name few.

GET WARM AND FUZZY - As I recall growing up a long hair in the Boston/NYC hardcore, punk, metal scenes without getting my face smashed

HAVE MIXED FEELINGS- when I finally reveal my secret drug smuggling operation using some of the bands tour buses as my mule.

ADMIRE- at the true story of how bullshitted my way into the exclusive world of pornography and changed the face of it forever

WONDER-(right along with me) at what some of the nauseatingly beautiful girls that slept with me were thinking and why they didn't press charges.

GASP- as I tell torrid tales of bedding porn stars, groupies, rocker chicks, rock star wives, Penthouse Pets, a Suicide Girl, and a Hollywood actress or two.

FEEL MY PAIN- as I write about my time behind bars.

BECOME A JUDGMENTAL CUNT- when I brag about my drug use and offer no remorse for my lust for better living through chemistry.

SHED TEARS- as I tell the heart wrenching tale of being abandoned at birth and adopted...actually you wont I had a pretty okay childhood. All that stuff along with a bunch of other interesting moments that took my breath away and maybe they'll do the same to you.

BREATHE A SIGH OF RELIEF- that you aren't me.



This isn't your normal coming of age, look at my fucked up life and see how I turned it around autobiography. Hell no. This is a declaration of my independence! A unsettling manifesto of how be a professional fuck up. There will be no apologies. I did it. It was me.

WHO AM I?

Jef Hickey ex-freelance writer for ADULT VIDEO NEWS, LARRY FLYNT PUBLICATION'S HUSTLER'S EROTIC VIDEO GUIDE and INTERNATIONAL TATTOO ART.  Jef Hickey: ex-this, ex-that, anti-this. anti-anti.

Jef Hickey roadie, smut peddler and truth seeker. Sorry the people at Indiegogo said boasting would increase donations...sounds good though.

 

Fact is, I don't have the traditional book deal with advances and a team of editors ready and willing. It is what it is, no matter what the behind the scenes details need to be addressed and that costs money. To offest the costs and make things more efficient I appeal to you the readers of the world. My publisher (A Barnacle Book through Rare Bird Lit.) and I have come up with some original concepts I can't reveal just yet but I assure you will make supporting the cause completely worth your while.

Truth is, this project is way overdue...I've missed a bunch of very important deadlines simply because of circumstances that I've had no control over. Thankfully, I've survived these unfortunate hiccups and I now have the time to complete “I thought you were dead.!?!”

For the record I know $1,666 is just a goofy amount meant to provoke a response actually I'm lowballing to make the quota . It's more like 3 times that so keep that in mind.

In addition, my mother would like me to mention:

Now, just because I did all this "bad" stuff prior to writing I Thought You Were Dead!?! doesn't mean I'm going to come out for an encore. I'm not debating that I'm a solipsistic, left-handed metalhead; but I will argue that I never let anyone down when it comes to my work. If it makes the church feel better, I'm on a mission from god. Not really, but you get the point. 

Here's the damage so far: this book has already been written. It exists on hundreds of handwritten pieces of paper stuffed into a briefcase. Other parts are locked away in the bowels of my email and scattered among various publications that better let me republish my work or else. I need help to decipher my chicken scratch. I need to have a legal person review my work and keep me from getting sued or worse. Stuff like that isn't free. So my people If you like your music fast, loud and rude...and your reading even harder, louder, faster and ruder, you're gonna love "I thought you were dead!?!"

story:
Our vision of the Peace Bus is to create the reality where Palestinians and Israelis can live in Peace and Dignity. We are not offering political solutions or have a common political view. We do not have ready recipes. But what we surely know is: we can not continue hating, fighting, killing each other. In 66 years of war we could not achieve any permanent solution - we believe that it's time to try a different path. On the Peace Bus we promote principles of tolerance, understanding and non-violence. People of all religions, colors, nations, gender come together in the loving attitude to see what the media is trying to hide away from us – a true face of the so called "enemy". In the eyes of an Israeli and Palestinian child you will discover innocence and remember yourself once being a child, free from prejudices and hate. In this moment we mourn for all those who perished during this unnecessary and tragic conflict: not just in the current one, but for all the innocent who lost their lives in the war of hatred. We want to see the perspectives of both sides: suffering of Palestinians and Israelis alike. We are all human beings who happened to be raised as enemies. And this is a real tragedy. We can not live in Peace as long as other side is suffering. Therefore, the PEACE IS OUR COMMON GOAL! Here how you can help to stop the war and save lives: With a few thousand dollars you can help the Peace Movement in Israel to stop the violence. We respect your donation and use only what we really need from you money. Thank you and we really appreciate it!

On the 4th Journey of the Peace Bus, on August 8,  we continued collecting medicine, hygienic products and food from people in Israel for people in Gaza. On our journey we visited the Hand in Hand organization, which runs Jewish-Arabic joint schools in Yaffo, Tel Aviv and Haifa, spoke with the Circle of Israeli-Palestinian Bereaved Families and  members of Kol Aher (The Other Voice) families for peace, who live in the South of Israel, at the border of Gaza. This was one  of the most remarkable journeys of the Peace Bus. We collected 32 boxes on our way and received around 7000 NIS on our donation account, of      

which we have spent by now 5000 NIS already on supplies 

for Gaza in agreement with the Caritas international health relief organisation, our partner for peace.

We will keep doing our job and dedicated this week for buying donations for civilians in Gaza. Therefore, the next bus will take place in two weeks, on Friday, 22.08. This way we can save our energy and money and focus this week entirely on collections. We continue collecting donations for Gaza also in the future and thank you for all already done contributions.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help financially? That is OK. Spread the word. Let others know about our campaign.

In this moment we mourn for all those who perished during this unnecessary and tragic conflict: not just in the current one, but for
all the innocent who lost their lives in the war of hatred. We want to see the perspectives of both sides: suffering of Palestinians and Israelis alike. We are all human beings who happened to be raised as enemies. And this is a real tragedy. We can not live in Peace as long as other side is suffering. Therefore, the PEACE IS OUR COMMON GOAL!

Here how you can help to stop the war and save lives:

With a few thousand dollars you can help the Peace Movement in Israel to stop the violence. We respect your donation and use only what we really need from you money. Thank you and we really appreciate it!On the 4th Journey of the Peace Bus, on August 8,  we continued collecting medicine, hygienic products and food from people in Israel for people in Gaza. On our journey we visited the Hand in Hand organization, which runs Jewish-Arabic joint schools in Yaffo, Tel Aviv and Haifa, spoke with the Circle of Israeli-Palestinian Bereaved Families and  members of Kol Aher (The Other Voice) families for peace, who live in the South of Israel, at the border of Gaza. This was one  of the most remarkable journeys of the Peace Bus. We collected 32 boxes on our way and received around 7000 NIS on our donation account, of      
which we have spent by now 5000 NIS already on supplies 
for Gaza in agreement with the Caritas international health relief organisation, our partner for peace.
We will keep doing our job and dedicated this week for buying donations for civilians in Gaza. Therefore, the next bus will take place in two weeks, on Friday, 22.08. This way we can save our energy and money and focus this week entirely on collections. We continue collecting donations for Gaza also in the future and thank you for all already done contributions.



Other Ways You Can Help
Can't help financially? That is OK. Spread the word. Let others know about our campaign.

THE SHORT VERSION:

I'm a travel writer from Alaska, and I live in Istanbul. I want to make a creative travel guide to The Balkans, Turkey, and the Caucasus. 

The best travel experiences, the ones that stick in your mind, are rarely found where expected. They usually crop up where you really don't expect--while buying gelato, or while trying to find a bus at midnight, or having a street vendor sing Justin Timberlake to you. You never know! Conventional travel guides, though useful for a lot of reasons, don't prepare people for the best part of travel--living your own story. I want you to take home stories you'll remember and laugh about your whole life. 

This travel guide will make stories, jokes, and adventures the center of a good travel experience, rather than just seeing the sights or having a cultural experience or staying in five-star hotels. I'll bring you through this region, weaving narrative and travel tips together best I can. It'll be like having a personal travel guide with a sense of humor. I really love this region and I want to share my stories, and encourage you to have your own adventures too. The intent is to infect my readers with wanderlust, make them laugh until they choke, and bring them to a part of the world so unusual it can't even decide what continent it's on. 

This project is an outgrowth of a travel article I wrote for the Seattle Stranger last year. If you want to get a sense of what this book will be like, I'd start there, or with my travel blog. I have been traveling through and writing about this area for the past two years, and I really want to give it the attention it deserves. I'm hoping to open people up to great travel through writing, and you can make that possible. 

here is my travel blog betterinvinyl.wordpress.com

THE STORY:

Three years ago, my brother Jari and I started dreaming of a long journey which would take us through weird europe: eastern slavic states, the Balkans, Turkey, the Caucasus, and finally, Armenia, a land of strange churches and weird languages and booty slavs. I dunno, Rome and Berlin are nice, but we wanted to see the fringes. 

As part of my commitment to this trip, I volunteered as an english teacher in the Republic of Georgia for 4 months. It reconfigured my head, as any good travel experience should. And when Jari and his Canadian friends met me in Istanbul, that travel experience reconfigured their heads, too. Every day in that place was an encounter with the unexpected--my students caught live birds bare-handed, livestock roamed the streets, old men brought mountain vodka onto the bus to celebrate the arrival of foreign tourists. Every day I was forced to go with the flow. It sounds sort of contradictory when I say it like that, but it was very liberating (and perpetually interesting). 

And then because I am crazy I decided that I hadn't had enough of Weird Europe, and I moved to Istanbul, where I've been living for the past year. The adventures continue in the city here. The most importan

HERE IS THE TRAVEL PLAN 

There are three more places in Turkey I need to hit: The Bible Belt (Konya, Rumi's birthplace, whirling dervishes), The Mediterranean Coast (Bodrum and Rhodes, gypsies, beach people), and the parts of eastern turkey I missed the last time around (a weird cliffside monastery and desolate Lake Van). Those three trips will take place at the beginning of May. Next,  I'll be heading into the Balkans—Serbia, Albania, Bosnia, Kosovo, Montenegro, Bulgaria, Macedonia, maybe even bits of northern Greece. That trip will be from June-August. Altogether, including the places I've already researched, the trip will stretch along a corridor of Eastern Europe, through the Balkans, all throughout Turkey, and through the Caucasus region to Armenia. 

BUDGET

I need the money for exactly two things: research and publication. Working in Istanbul, I make enough money to live on, but not enough to travel. I have a few more places I need to go to round out the book--I've managed to see a lot of Turkey, and of course the Caucasus--but the Balkans remain conspicuously absent from my notes. I have traveled in this part of the world on-and-off for the past two years, and I know how to keep travel costs low. Three months of travel and research will cost about $2000. That's like...oh god, what's 2000 divided by 12 weeks...like slightly less than 200 bucks a week? You see why I went into writing instead. It's cheap, anyhow. 

I'm publishing on Lulu.com, which is a cool free publishing website. "But Ernie!" you may be saying right now. "You said you need the money for publication!" Absolutely. While it is totally free to upload and make an ebook, it will still cost a little money to do a little print run. Depending on how many books are ordered, it could cost anywhere from $500-$1000 bucks. Then I get to ship all the books to my generous backers with nice handwritten notes of thankiness. (If you would like an ebook version, please let me know and I will give you one really!)

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Three easy ways! 

1. Donate cash! Every dollar that you throw my way helps me bring adventure and inspiration to more people through the printed word. EVERY little bit helps. EVERYthing. A lot of my friends are impoverished young'uns like myself and I know you only have like five dollars and trust me, five dollars from a lot of people adds up fast. I'm on the FIXED funding option, which means the project won't happen unless I meet my fundraising goal. If you can't donate, it's okay to share it and make noise. Really, I consider myself a success if I get just one person to step out the doorway and experience their surroundings in a fresh way.

2. Spread the word! Share the campaign on facebook or tweeeeter (which is now banned in turkey, HA) and tell lots of people! Nuture your own sense of wanderlust!

3. Send me ideas! Look over my travel map and if you have heard about anything crazy, let me know so I can check it out! Of course, not knowing is half the fun... (my email is ernie.piper@gmail.com)

THANK YOU

This is a huge dream of mine—publishing a book—and it has been for a long time. I moved to turkey pretty much to continue having wacky adventures, and write about them in a way I find vital and important. Living abroad is just cool, and I really want to be able to share that experience with everyone who couldn't come with me.

story:
The Public Record is Hamilton's local news funded by Hamiltonians, written by Hamiltonians for all Hamiltonians. 

Founded and produced by Hamilton independent journalist Joey Coleman, 

The Public Record covers Hamilton's civic affairs in-depth thanks to its reader funding model. At a time when many communities are suffering from news deficits, Hamilton City Hall is covered by The Public Record including sub-committees, committees and Council. 

Reader Funding Makes Possible

  • Investigative journalism, including freedom of information fees, to uncover issues such as the HSR transit crisis, city spending, planning, and community concerns;
  • In-depth journalism on municipal affairs including our recent in-depth coverage of the Ontario Municipal Board hearing on Hamilton's ward boundaries;
  • Equipment purchases and maintenance to film, audio record, and photograph meetings, civic events, and produce The Public Record Radio Show;
  • Business planning expenses for expansion of The Public Record in 2018, including planning to hire freelance contributors to ensure every ward race is covered, and every public debate is recorded;

  • Overhead expenses including office, server hosting, equipment maintenance, cellular expenses, and all the associated expenses in creating high-quality original journalism;

  • Continuing coverage of Hamilton's civic affairs; and more.

Contributing to The Public Record's crowdfunding campaign is the best value in local journalism, anywhere.

A New Model of Local Journalism for Everyone

To be effective in providing a public goal, public interest journalism must be accessible to all. To be sustainable, it must be funded by readers.

This crowdfunding campaign will enable The Public Record to implement its 90-9-1 model of reader financial support to make local journalism sustainable.

The monthly patron model is the only one that can sustain watchdog journalism.

It enables an outlet to assign journalists with a long-term commitment to fearless journalism, to launch investigations into problems needing solutions, and to be free from undue influence.

Investing in this crowdfunding campaign will enable me to get to sustainability and grow. My next goal is simple, I want to be able to hire Hamiltonians to cover Hamilton as we grow The Public Record.

The Benefits to All

Your support enables everyone to:

  • Benefit from a more informed community conversation;
  • Accurate, Responsible real-time reporting; and
  • Access to public information.

Every City Council meeting, every City Council committee, every City Council sub-committee, School Board meetings, Public meetings, Local Events, Art Crawls, Town Halls, and more - that's the journalism your contribution supports.

The Public Record's Policies and Affiliations

As a professional news agency, The Public Record strives to reach and uphold the highest standards of journalism. 

The Public Record is a member of the National Newsmedia Council, Canada's self-regulatory body for professional news outlets. Joey Coleman is a member of the Canadian Association of Journalists.

The Public Record's policies can be read on our website:

  • Our Mission
  • Our Code of Ethics and Journalistic Practice
  • Privacy Policy
  • Our Content Licensing

Your donation helps us to find and publish new stories about undiscovered artists.

My name is Ryan. I’m an explorer. But I’m not looking for places. I’m searching for undiscovered people. I travel the world, recording stories about people: singers, painters, poets, cooks - all kinds of people who keep their local culture alive and strong. 

But I don’t work alone. I’m part of OXLAEY: a network of volunteers working together for free to document and promote the world’s cultural heritage with videos, photographs, recordings and articles.

We’ve already published stories on musicians in India, a painter in Iran, rituals in Thailand, and even a man in the Netherlands who still grinds flour with a windmill.

Your donation helps us to find new stories. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Not only do we document and promote culture, we do it all for free and without advertising. You can read, share, print, and copy everything we publish - all for free with a Creative Commons license… Because culture belongs to all of us. 

And if you donate now, we’ll send you the brand new OXLAEY Magazine. We select the best stories and put them into a 20-page, smartly designed magazine. We print the OXLAEY Magazine two times a year (May / November) and mail it to your house (or send you an electronic version through email).

The OXLAEY magazine is a “thank you” for your donation... but even if you can’t make a donation, you can still watch all the videos on our website for free.

The Impact

But why is it so important to record these people’s stories? 

Because there are so many better foods to eat than a McDonald’s hamburger. There are so many more fantastical stories to read than about Disney’s princesses. But without a team dedicated to finding them.... you'll never find them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out www.oxlaey.com. If you like what we do, give a donation. You can also sign up to the newsletter. Or share OXLAEY stories on Facebook!

story:
Hello everyone !

The project is called “Freediving Physiology Book”.

I am asking you to support the translation of this book, dedicated entirely to freediving, and called: "Apnea, from theory to practice", from French into English.

The French version was published in 2007 and updated in 2015. The first edition that I coordinated was very successful. The book has become a must-read with those who want to deepen their knowledge. The French version was supported by an association (APRAAS), to create a special grant for students working on the physiology of breath-holding. Unfortunately, at the moment, there is no thorough book on breath-holding physiology available in the world.

This 458-page book (in French) deals with the historical, physiological, pathological, psychological and practical aspects of freediving. "Apnea, from theory to practice" is therefore intended for all those who are interested in this field: confirmed or beginner freedivers looking for documentation, future freediving or spearfishing instructors, coaches and doctors in charge of sport groups.

Who am I?

My name is Frédéric Lemaître, I am an Assistant Professor of Physiology, specialized in freediving physiology, and have already published over 50 international scientific papers. I have worked with several famous freedivers such as Stéphane Mifsud, Pierre Frolla, Guillaume Néry and Morgan Bourc’his in France, and am still working with other well-known deep freedivers! I was a member of AIDA France and am currently a member of the AIDA International medical board.

I am also a passionate freediver, have been an Instructor (French Federation FFESSM and AIDA) for over 20 years, and was captain for the French team between 2009 and 2012 for several World Championships.

 

Who supports this project?

The University of Normandy (IRIHS), Rouen and Le Havre University Press (PURH), and the Faculty of Sport Sciences and its Research Laboratory CETAPS have already brought financial backing to this project, which enabled the translation of the first 165 pages (1950 euros)!

Rouen and Le Havre University Press have already committed to publishing the English version in 2018, once it is ready to be released on the market.

http://purh.univ-rouen.fr/

 

Freedivers supporting this project

Carlos Costes

“All the best for this fundamental book, and its translation into English! An important step in freediving development & education”

www.deepseabonaire.com

 

Andrea Zuccari

http://andreazuccari.com/

 

Antonio del Duca

“Greetings to all my facebook friends, here I'm sharing this link of a French teacher and old friend that I met in an AIDA world championship in Denmark in 2009, he was part of the French team and now as well as I did, he wrote a book which I want to recommend you since I believe that Frédéric Lemaitre is a true professional with many years of experience in this field. Check it out at:”

http://fgcero.com/personnel/atonio-del-duca/

 

Cyril Paulet (French Coach for the AIDA French team)

"Congratulations Frédéric for this beautiful book on our activity. You have managed to explain with simple words some complex mechanisms, making our sport accessible to a wider audience... Very friendly, Cyril Paulet. "

 

Morgan Bourc’his

http://www.morganbourchis.com/

 

AIDA France

 

Rémy Dubern

www.blue-addiction.com

 

We now need your support to help us find the budget for the translation of the remaining 293 pages! (4050 euros).

 

Please donate and/or spread the word by sharing our page on Facebook and to all your contacts!

Thanks!

Frédéric Lemaître.

 

http://www.lcdpu.fr/livre/?GCOI=27000100831940&...

http://purh.univ-rouen.fr/node/832

story:
Who I am and What I do

My name is Nicholas Haney, and ever since I was young I had a passion for writing. Someday I hope to be able to write full time for a living, but maybe that is what makes me a dreamer.

I finished my first novel in 2012, fresh out of college and ready to take on the world. I haven't stopped since, and to date I have five novels, countless blogs, and even a few paying writing gigs. But you might be wondering why this Indiegogo? Well, all my novels are self published, and that means I have to pay for artists, designers, and other help out of my own pocket.

With my newest novel, Liminal Worlds, I really want to get more artwork done that just cover art, and so I am asking for a little help. I will break down the details in a moment, but I really want to bring this world alive.

It is a world of renewable energy, sustainable cities, space flight, and big corporations. It is one part cyberpunk, one part shamanism, and one part solarpunk.

Your contribution to this project will help me not only with cover art, but with character sketches, landscape art, and other work as well. This project could be really expansive, and I need your help building this world.

Your Contribution

Alright, so what exactly am I asking for help with? Here is just a short list of where your dollars will go. I am only asking for a modest amount of $650. As this is a self published project, all costs ultimately come out of my pocket. That is where your assistance comes in.

Cover Art: $300 - $400: First and foremost I have to pay my cover artist, and then I have to pay the graphic designer to format and create the cover. This is the bulk of the funding. If we don't meet the goal of $650, all funds will go to this cover these costs.

Character Sketches: $100 - $200 each: Additional funding that does not go to cover art will go towards charcter sketches. I currently want to do at least 2 to 3 different characters, with more becoming an option with additional funding. The better this campaign does, the more options I have. Additional sketches may become part of stretch goals if we really do well.

Landscape Art: $200 – 300 each: As I am only asking for $650, this is kind of an optional goal. I would really like to be able to have artwork commissioned to show future cityscapes, and other "settings" in my book. Specifically, I would love to see what Toronto and Copenhagen look like in the latter part of the 21st century. This may be considered a "stretch" goal.

Additional Costs: Anything left over will go towards printing and distribution costs. I may even have to buy myself a beer (maybe two?) to celebrate this project.

I am currently aiming for a June-July publication date. 

Why Does This Matter?

You might be wondering why this project is so important? Well, obviously on a personal level this is one of my creative darlings. Its the offspring of my creative output for about the past year, and naturally I'm really excited about it!

Beyond that, as I touched on earlier, solarpunk is kind of a new genre for science fiction, and I desire to be on that frontier, and not just for my own sake. The world is full of disheartening and gloomy stories right now, no matter where you stand. We are facing challenges that are changing the climate, and challenging the way we live our lives.

There is no shortage of dystopian futures, from Mad Max to Fallout. Don't get me wrong, these are great stories. But people need hope too, and one of the things that I really want to convey with this novel is that there are reasons for hope.

Yeah, there may be ecological crises, and evil corporations breathing down our neck, but there are some good things too. We could build an amazing, sustainable future, and we can start that work today.

The first part of that work is imagining what a hopeful future might look like. This novel is my first attempt at that, and I'm hoping you will help me unleash a little bit of hope back into the world.

The World I Have Created

If you have gotten this far, you are probably wondering what this book is actually about? 

This story is set in the late 21st century, and the world has changed. Dwindling oil reserves across the world lead to a big push for renewable energy, Most cities are now self-sufficient, producing most of the energy and food their citizens need. 

Yet, the world is also one of growing corporate power. As the US waned in importance on the world stage, other nations and private interests were quick to take advantage and fill the void left. China is a rising power, as is the post-Brexit European Union. Much of the world's economy revolves around huge Transnationals, which have grown in power and influence in a way that rivals many national powers. 

Earth has grown more fragmented, but also more integrated. The UN Global Council was created in the American absence, and created a union of free cities, regional governments, and former national governments in a democratic and open borders global system. More than this, the 'Net is more expansive than ever, allowing people across the globe to exchange ideas and information in a huge virtual reality environment that connects people, places, and cultures across time and space. 

For further details, might I recommend checking out some of the perks which include this book!

Spread the word!

I understand that we are not all made of money, I probably wouldn't be asking for help if I was. But even if you are not rolling in the Benjamins (or Washingtons, or assorted coins), there are other ways to help.

As an author, we kind of thrive on word of mouth. So feel free to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or whatever other platform strikes your fancy. Bringing attention to this campaign helps me a great deal, because without views, there are no contributions.

Indiegogo has plenty of tools available for sharing!

 

Thank you in advance for anything you can contribute!

Of Shadow and Steel, Book 1 of the Elder Blood Saga

Of Ice and Darkness, Book 2 of the Elder Blood Saga

Of Fury and Machines, Book 3 of the Elder Blood Saga

Of Mountains and Madness, Book 4 of the Elder Blood Saga

Of Origins and Endings, Book 5 of the Elder Blood Saga

story:
About the Authors

Jeremy Empie has lived with severe Cerebral Palsy since he was born, but he doesn't let that stop him. Jeremy’s first book, "It's All in the Head," is about how he has turned his disability into an encouragement to others. After running his own web design company for five years, Jeremy went into full-time ministry and founded "Jesus Saves International Ministries" with his wife, Katie.  

 

The One Year Devotional

In December 2011 / January of 2012 God started laying it in Jeremy’s heart to write a one year devotional. Out of the blue, one of Katie’s family members called her and suggested that Jeremy e-mail a devotional each day. We started on February 13, 2012. This book consists of all of our daily devotionals.

 

We Need Your Help! 

Jeremy and Katie need your help with getting One Year Devotional published. Through Jesus Saves International Ministries, Jeremy's writings have already made a global impact, providing hope to this lost & hurting generation. Encouraged by Jeremy's story, people have been encouraged not to give up.

 

Testimonies of lives changed by Jeremy Empie's writings 

"Pastor Jeremy...Just wanted you to know how INCREDIBLY ON-TARGET your  devotionals have been the last few days. Wow...and to think the Holy Spirit led you to write them months ago. HE is always right on time!"

Robbie
Cantonment, Florida

"Pastor Jeremy and his wife Katie give life and breath to the Gospel in their daily message of peace, hope and salvation.  I am ever grateful that the Holy Spirit has chosen them for this vital mission to a hurting world.  Their daily devotional arms me against the negative influences of our culture, and keeps hope alive that there are better things to come."

Jeffery
Wasilla, Alaska

 

How will this book change somebody's life? 

Our prayer is that these devotionals will bring you closer to God by studying His word each day.  This will only take you 5 minutes or so.

 

Bonuses for Supporting this Book Project

We ask you to contribute a tax-deductible donation toward helping us make this book available in printed and ebook form. As a thank you for your donation, we have several different gifts for you, depending on the level at which you’d like to donate: 

  • $10 or more – PDF version of Jeremy’s first book, “It’s All in the Head”
  • $20 or more – A signed advance copy and a PDF version of “It’s All in the Head”
  • $40 or more – THREE signed advance copies of "One Year Devotional" and PDF version of “It’s All in the Head.”
  • $75 or more – SIX signed advance copies of "One Year Devotional" PDF version of “It’s All in the Head,” and a credit in the book’s Acknowledgements section
  • $100 or more - TEN signed advance copies, PDF version of “It’s All in the Head,” and a credit in the book’s Acknowledgements section
  • $200 or more - 24 signed advance copies, PDF version of “It’s All in the Head,” and a credit in the book’s Acknowledgements section
  • $500 or more – 80 signed advance copies, PDF version of “It’s All in the Head,” and a credit in the book’s Acknowledgements section

 

Thanks for supporting us as we continue to minister God’s salvation to people around the world.

story:
A Little Bit About Us

We, Liana Hall and Alicia Wanklyn, are the team behind The Little Cottage illustrated book. 

Liana, the author, is an actress, writer and occasional attorney. She studied at Sevenoaks School and University College London in the UK before heading back across the pond. For the last seven years she has split her time between Bermuda and the United States working both in government and in the arts. Visit www.lianahall.com for more information.

Alicia, the illustrator, is an artist, fashion designer, photographer and photo editor. She has studied in Canada at University of Guelph and Nova Scotia College of Art and Design. Bermuda has always been integral to Alicia's artistic vision and she is proud to call it home. 

Alicia and Liana have known each other since they attended Bermuda High School as youngsters. Liana remembers Alicia's love for tuna fish sandwiches and Alicia remembers Liana's excitement at attending her birthday party. They have collaborated many times together, including being featured in Caribbean magazine Island Life. The time for the next step in their journey together has arrived. 

A Little Bit About The Little Cottage

"On the islands of Bermuda in the parish of Sandys there is a very Little Cottage right next to the very littlest drawbridge in the world. The Little Cottage has a white roof, just like all Bermuda houses, and a turquoise body that perfectly matches the colour of the ocean that flows past its very little dock. On that very little dock is a very little petrol station servicing the boats and cars that pull into refuel, admiring the view as they come." - The Little Cottage

The Little Cottage is a picture book primarily aimed at children, but with art that will enthrall adults. It is intended to be a lasting piece of cultural art for Bermuda in the vein of The Giving Tree, The Little Prince and Roald Dahl and Quentin Blake's partnership. A book that will remain treasured by children as they grow into adulthood. 

This book will initially be published locally in a limited run and then pitched to international agents and publishers. It is hoped that the success of this book will assist in bringing attention to our little island home. 

You can help us bring these dreams to life. 

Cultural & Charitable Impact

The Little Cottage contains historical and cultural facts about the island. It is hoped this will educate local and international children alike. 

For this initial run, proceeds of the book's profits will go to local charities. Those charities, chosen by the author and illustrator, are Friends of Hospice, The Bermuda National Trust and The Chewstick Foundation. 

There will also be 20 limited edition, handbound books created on heavy-stock, imprinted paper that will be made by Wythern Publishing in London. Ten of these books will go to the highest donors and the other 10 will be auctioned off for these charities at the launch party. Donors and bidders alike will be comfortable in the knowledge that this will be a limited run of first edition, enduring art. 

Giving & Gifts

Although $15,000 seems like a hefty amount, it's actually less than we need, but as indiegogo charges more if you don't reach your goal, we're trying to be realistic. We're aiming for a very high-quality product and your funds will go towards the following:

  • Art Materials
  • Photoshop and other Adobe software
  • HD Scanner
  • Use of Bermuda professional printing services
  • Manuscript printing for review
  • Spec books to send to agents and publishers
  • Set up fee and construction of 20 handbound leather books by Wythern Binding
  • Initial run of as many illustrated books as we can afford (200+)
  • Incentive gifts
  • Secured international submission mailing to agents and publishers
  • External Hard Drives
  • Art Space
  • Customs on the finished product
  • And everything else publishing entails!

As for what YOU get for contributing to the project, there are lots of fun gifts that we're providing. You can see the full details to the right, but they include Little Cottage greeting cards, launch party tickets, signed prints, silk scarves and throw pillows, colouring books and much more. Choose whatever package works the best for you. No amount is too little. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can help financially, but if you still want to support the campaign we'd love it if you shared our page and helped spread the word! There are sharing tools right on Indiegogo, so Facebook update, tweet, instagram and whatever else you crazy kids do. 

Thanks to everyone who can help in any possible way!
