story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, I am Adeyinka Oshin a Christian author based in London, UK. I am passionate about using creativity and innovation to connect with various communities to inspire and change lives. I have over 7 years experience of working within the health and safety, transport, management and environment sectors. I am an active member of Redeemed Christian Church of God, The Anchor For All Souls, London; and married with three children. I recently published four books Judge Theo, The Final Judgment, God Has Got Talent – ME, Health and Safety Bible, A Global Plan for A Global Problem & Caught in the Crisis:Three Steps to a Fresh Start; in addition to my previous publication, Faith,Strategies for Effective Living. All these five books are available from www.rhodabooks.com
  • Our campaign is to raise funds to produce my latest book – Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story. I have completed writing the manuscript. I have commissioned my publishing consultant to commence work on design, layout and printing of the book.
  • If you have ever read “This is the genealogy of Jesus the Messiah the son of David, the son of Abraham: Abraham was the father of Isaac, Isaac the father of Jacob, Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers, Judah the father of Perez and Zerah, whose mother was Tamar, Perez the father of Hezron…… and Jacob the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, and Mary was the mother of Jesus who is called the Messiah” Matthew 1:1 – 16, and found it repetitive, boring without meaning, then you need to read, Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story; the book that explains in details the reasons behind the genealogy of Jesus Christ.  This book will make interesting reading this Christmas and a perfect gift for families, friends and colleagues to share the spirit of Christmas.
  • Every funding received towards this project will assist us to make a dream come true and provide an opportunity for this book to explain the story behind an important holiday event – Christmas. The book will provide a clearer understanding of the significance of the genealogy of Jesus Christ. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our target is $3750.00; about 80% of the funding will be used to print and package the book to market and about 20% of the funding will be used to sustain a social media marketing campaign. 
  • Some of the perks for funders that support us include: your personal copy of Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story, Special Acknowledgement in Appreciation Page in Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story, Audio Edition of Wanted, A Child to Adopt –The Christmas Story, EBook edition of Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story, Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story branded Mugs and copies of my other bestselling books Judge Theo, The Final Judgment, God Has Got Talent – ME, Health and Safety Bible, A Global Plan for A Global Problem, Caught in the Crisis: Three Steps to a Fresh Start and Faith, Strategies for Effective Living.
  • If in the event we don't reach our funding goal, we intend to use the raised funds to produce limited quantities of Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story.

The Impact

  • Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story will increase your understanding and appreciation of the Story behind Christmas.
  • This book will provide a forum to share the spirit of Christmas with families, friends and colleagues.
  • Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story will make this Christmas Special and Memorable
  • This book will broaden the awareness of Adoption as a process to share love and bring hope to others; increase the significance of Adoption in our society
  • Your support for this project will make a big difference in making Wanted, A Child to Adopt – The Christmas Story a reality. Thank you for believing in us and the project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this project with your families, friends, colleagues, social media contacts; every little support counts to the success of this campaign. 
  • You can use Indiegogo share tools to spread the news!
  • Thank you for your support!

story:
Who We Are and Why We Do It 

We are creatives and always have been. Some are late bloomer but need'nt have been.  There are the youth who have expressed their talents early on but had no idea where the path could lead them. Imagine if a child or young person could meet someone of like mind who has manifested their dream? Is it then possible for them to achieve theirs too?  

 This is the foundation from which our organization was born. 

 

We understand the sheer joy of creating a piece of work and sharing it with others. This is what we foster in young people at the Royal Writers Organization.  We  foster their drive, encourage their creativity and give them the tools to see it further.

Our mentors at the Royal Writers Organization have a passion for their craft, and a desire to share what they've learned.  From a computer, laptop, or Artist Visit, our mentors bring their experiences and knowledge to those who share their dream.

 

      

Our programs are kept at affordable prices with scholarships available. Our goal is to reach any child who shares the passion for writing and can benefit from our mentorship. 

With your help, we will bring our list of mentors to students around the globe for onsite visits and online workshops.  We are raising funds for scholarships to cover the costs of workshops and artist studios where additional in depth courses are available. We seek to build a bridge of new and shared experiences not readily available to children in underserved areas.   Through our programs, workshops and Artist Studios we can help the seemingly impossible to be possible.  Students in our workshops will work toward their goals of writing, publishing and marketing their finished work.  Students hold all rights to their work and 95% of all royalties. 5% of their royalties are donated back into the Royal Writers Organization for future scholarships in the spirit of paying it forward to new members.

  

What We Need & What You Get

With $5,500.00 we can bring  scholarships to those in need.  The amount requested will cover the cost of a semesters worth of workshops for no less than forty scholarship recipients as well as on site visits. 

 Our mentors are not only artists but parents and community activists.  Please help us to bring our finest voices to hundreds of students who live in depressed areas where we will no longer allow for their dreams to be put on hold.  

 

We would love to spread the word of all of our supporters and will do that as a mention on our Facebook and Twitter pages for all who donate any amount under $100.00.  We appreciate you and will let you know this through our media social pages! 

 

For those who will donate  $100.00 we will mention you on our social media pages and on our website.  

For those who will donate $200.00 we will mention you on our social media pages, website and include a Royal Writer T Shirt.

For those who will donate $500.00 we will mention you on our social media pages, website, include a Royal Writer T Shirt and a set of signed postcards from comic book artist Pete Flood.  

 

  

For those who will donate $1000.00 or more we will mention you on our social media pages, website, include a Royal Writer T Shirt a set of signed postcards from comic book artist and mentor Pete Flood and a signed CD of Billboard Country recording artist and mentor, Rissi Palmer's "Best Day Ever." 

 

 

All funds received will go towards scholarships for students to participate in our workshops.

All donations are eligible to receive a receipt for tax purposes.

Help Us To Make An Impact

The Royal Writers Organization is bringing our program to young people all over the world. Through our on-line workshops, videos and on site visits we are giving back from all that we have received. We invite you to accompany us on our journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who are unable to assist us financially please help us by spreading the word about our organization and our mission.

 

Many Thanks! Stay Creative!

 

Jonita G. SaintLeger

Founder/Director

Royal Writers Organization

story:
Guardian of the Stones, THE DIVINE HEART

 

The Divine Heart is the first book in the Guardian of the Stones series. It follows a young teen, Seth Roderick, as he confronts his own mysterious origins. Led by strange dreams that have plagued him since his thirteenth birthday, he is forced to face the startling possibility that his dreams may actually be real.

 

http://youtu.be/UaYGeGYr3Gc

^           ^          ^         ^

!!!!!Watch the teaser HERE!!!!

 

 

Hello,

 

My name is Justin Stewart. I'm a writer/musician from North Carolina. If I'm not on stage or in the studio you'd better believe I'm probably writing.

 

In fact, writing was one of my first loves before music. I've written everything from poetry, to short stories, even some small times articles online. But it was always a dream of mine to finally put this series I've been concocting for years into print.

 

This campaign means so much to me. As a first-time, self-publisher I lack the funds and resources to really give this novel that I've poured my heart and soul into a fighting chance. I'm a 26 year old bass player who married a beautiful woman with three wonderful kids and they want this book to be a success as much as I, if not more so (it's not easy being married to a dreamer (me)).

 

If you donate to this campaign you will be doing more than making an already happy man's biggest wish come true but you'll be helping lots of children in the process as well.

 

How?

 

When I was younger, I did in fact have a very trying childhood and was brought up in some of the roughest parts of town. There wasn't a huge emphasis on reading and writing in that type of environment. But, I still found a library. There was always one nearby. That's why a portion of all the books I print will go to local libraries and schools so that kids have a little more to choose from and a lot more magic to believe in.

 

WHERES THE MONEY GOING?

 

My goal is 20,000 dollars. Truth be told, that is no small amount. But rest assured, it is all necessary. Here is a breakdown of where the dollars go.

 

  1. -Printing physical copies
  2. -Paying an editor to make the book print worthy
  3. -Graphic Artist
  4. -And advertising

 

WHAT ARE THE PERKS?

 

Every dollar you donate is another brick in the 'Guardian of the Stones' foundation. You are helping me bring a new world to readers all around the world. A world I invite you to be a part of.

 

The amount you donate to this campaign will determine your power and status among the population of my novel. Will you possess superhuman strength, run faster than the speed of sound, or will you conjure the elements with ease? The choice is up to you. Please read each perk carefully. The world of Vita Nova can be quite hazardous if one isn't careful.

 

Thank you so much for your time!

 

If for any reason you can not donate (remember every dollar counts), PLEASE share this with any and everyone you can. It would mean so much to me. I'm super excited about this book and can't wait for you all to read it.

 

ARE YOU READY TO BELIEVE IN MAGIC?

 

 

 

 

 

 

A note:

All readers will receive a special thanks in each copy, both digital and print, of 'The Divine Heart'. However, if the campaign does not reach at least the 12,000 dollar mark, there will be NO posters, bookmarks, or printed copies of the book. There will, however, still be concept art (signed), Ebooks, and customized characters based on the amount you donate.

 

SO REMEMBER:

 

SHARE. SHARE. SHARE.

story:
Dear Reader,

Welcome to my world, Crystal Shade. My name is Istvan Szabo, Ifj, and I live in Budapest, Hungary. I’m an author and graphic artist, an award-winning screenwriter and director, and the one-man team behind this project. As such, I am responsible for the writing and development, concept art, illustrations, trailers and animation and everything else in a bid to make this book series known and successful.

The Crystal Shade series is my passion and life’s work thus far. I have written this series with the aim of telling a unique story in a new, strange fantasy world. The first volume, Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1, which was released on November 11, 2011, has already made her first step towards becoming a story to remember; a world and a tale you can’t compare to anything else. Volume 1 tells the tale of Grace, a young daydreamer who wants to be a guardian angel with all of its nobility, but, in typical child-like fashion she does not consider the downside. The story follows the dream of this little girl to become a guardian who lives so that others might live, so she can learn the truth behind the legendary mythological event of the Crystal Shade, which everyone respects and fears. As Grace's desire gradually comes true, she is faced with the reality that sometimes the sweetest dream is actually a nightmare waiting to unfold. In the story there are myths and secrets, mysteries and revelations, peace and menace, big dreams to fulfill and things to learn from failure, life, death and glorious returns – it’s all there in the first book, lovingly written by me and loved by many. While Volume 1 reveals how a fairy tale can come true, the sequel will show how dark it can become.

Here’s where you come in! I'm seeking your help to unfold the rest of the story, so we may continue the journey together and release the sequels of Crystal Shade, of which there are two. Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2 deals with the madness between light and dark, covering everything I ever wanted to do with the original storyline, and maybe more. The third book is the prelude story, Crystal Shade: Afterlight, which intends to connect the two volumes in a strange, poetic and twisted way, telling of the nightmares an angel may experience.

Why am I fundraising?

If a legend falls silent, who will tell the children our dreams? With your help the legend of Crystal Shade will continue in 2014. In order to achieve a proper release, I need to raise $15,000* for the following:

  • to hire a professional editor for Crystal Shade: Afterlight and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2 (~$3000)
  • to publish, distribute and market them worldwide. (~$4000)
  • and to hire a professional publicist to help me reach the right audience. (~$4000)

*The target goal includes the 4% IndieGogo and the 3-5% PayPal service fees, and the Hungarian taxes.

To learn more about Crystal Shade, please read Crystal Shade: Introduction, a free 64-page long, exclusive release of five short, spoiler-free introductory chapters, presenting the world and development of the series. You can also read a full chapter of the first volume. Other extras, including art, images and real-life certificates, are included. Click HERE to open the Introductory PDF. Or read the Excerpt, the first full chapter of the first volume HERE.


Why is Crystal Shade different? What Auralight Fantasy is?

Crystal Shade is for everyone who lives to dream and dreams to live. It is neither a religious nor mainstream angel series, but a timeless story for all ages which explores our souls and the deepest secrets of our dreams. Crystal Shade is an Auralight Fantasy (a.k.a. AuraFantasy or Auralight) which is a new variation on and mix of many genres. While it contains many elements of Epic Fantasy and Young Adult books, along with others from Science Fiction and Steampunk, such as aura-powered flying and other machines and weapons, or a strange world with a blue sun, it also includes various biological-fantastical elements, such as aura beings with superpowers living in the different spirit realms of an otherworldly ancient society. The atmosphere is not just felt, but seen to emanate from the people, places and other living and non-living things. The term Auralight Fantasy was coined to reflect the more overtly fantastical tones of Crystal Shade. While angels and demons play key roles, the series tries to present these mythical and mysterious creatures in a fresh way and to make their characterization less rigid. Because angels, demons, spirits and other religious creatures can sometimes alienate readers, I present them in such a way that everyone can read and enjoy them, regardless of their age, gender, origin or beliefs.


How long the sequels will be?

Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2, will have nine long chapters, written in the story-within-a-story format and style that I used in the first volume. Prior to the very last rewrite, Volume 2 was approximately 180,000 words long (Volume 1 was roughly 148,000). Crystal Shade: Afterlight involves a different type of storytelling and will number about 5,000 words.

When will the sequels be published?

My goal is to have the prequel short story, Crystal Shade: Afterlight professionally edited and published by July 7, 2014, the digital edition of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2 by November 11, 2014 (the franchise's third birthday), and the paperback by January 15, 2015. In order to accomplish all that, with high-quality releases, worldwide marketing and distribution, I am looking for a few angelic sponsors.

Some reviews that made me happy;

(a.k.a. Reviews of the first book, Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1)

"The few and faint shortcomings were greatly overshadowed by the writer's skill and the originality of the story. One of the few books I've read where you won't feel you have anything to compare it to."

Barnes and Noble Review

“I just can't get over how beautiful the language is in this book, it sets the tone of this otherworldly society so well. It's familiar and yet foreign. That right there takes a great deal of talent. The imagery that's described is just breathtaking. I was a bit worried it would put a lot of religious aspects out there. I was very wrong, and should have jumped on this as soon as I got it.”

Kana, Goodreads Review

"This book is a change from everything I've read recently. The story itself unfolds more gently, the action moving at a slower pace most of the time. The writing is beautiful. Elegant, even."

Rebecca McKinnon, The Crooked Word

"Beautiful writing. A story line that is well thought out."

David Allan, Tumbling Books

"Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 is beautifully written with detailed descriptions of both the people and the world they inhabit. An intriguing and complex fantasy novel which will leave you breathlessly anticipating the next Volume."

Star, Bibliophilic Book Blog 

"A detailed, descriptive and imaginative fantasy story."

Krista Burnbright, Cubicle Blindness

"The concept is not like anything I have read before which is very refreshing these days! Crystal Shade is beautifully written with an almost historical feel to the book. The writing style is, in my opinion, more complex than other YA writers I have read."

Amy, Following the Reader

“Reading Crystal Shade was both an adventure into a complex world of angels and a thoughtful beautifully written work of art. Seldom do I find a young adult novel with both a good story which will capture the hearts of its readers presented with language that will challenge and entrance the reader. This author has done both. In fact I was so captivated by the story I read it three times.”

Karen Doering, Parent’s Little Black Book

“This was such an interesting story concept for me, I remember when I received the book for review, and I remember thinking to myself how is a story being told by a seven year old going to work. I mean even in the YA genre seven is a little young, I wondered if I was going to be able to identify with the character, and for me as a reader I need to be able to identify with the characters in the book. But the book is really so much more than I thought it was going to be."

Kathryn S. Steves, UFR Reviews

The gift of gratitude you will receive from me in return for your chosen donation:

  • $1 (Daydreamer) - I will write a personal gratitude email to you.

  • $4 (Guardian Pillow) – Gratitude letter and an e-card of thanks, created from one of the original Crystal Shade illustrations.

  • $11 (Brave Little Guardian) – Gratitude letter, e-card, PLUS Signed DRM Free ebook of Crystal Shade: Introduction and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1.

  • $22 (Young Guardian) – Gratitude letter, e-card, Signed DRM Free ebook of Crystal Shade: Introduction, Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1, Crystal Shade: Afterlight and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2.

  • $44 (Artist of Seradelphia) – Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks mentioned above, PLUS Digital Art Package.

  • $88 (Aserian Guardian) – Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks and the Digital Art Package, PLUS a listing in the Special Thanks section of Crystal Shade: Afterlight and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2.

  • $111 (Abenago’s Apprentice) – Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks, the Digital Art Package and a Special Thanks listing, PLUS a Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copy of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1.

  • $222 (Nervaschanzo’s Apprentice) – Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks, the Digital Art Package and a Special Thanks listing, PLUS Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copies of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 and Volume 2.

  • $444 (Sun Goddess Sachylia) – Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks, the Digital Art Package, a Special Thanks listing, Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copies of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 and Volume 2, PLUS one 3.75 Carat Square Lab Sapphire (8x8x5mm – IF Clarity) with a Sapphire Velvet Pouch.

  • $444 (Gracius Angenius) – Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks, the Digital Art Package, a Special Thanks listing, Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copies of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 and Volume 2, PLUS one 2.23 Carat Asscher Lab Sapphire (6.9x6.9x4.8mm – VVS Clarity) with a Sapphire Velvet Pouch.

  • $888 (Sapphire Guardian) – Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks, the Digital Art Package, a Special Thanks listing, Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copies of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 and Volume 2, PLUS one 8.58 Carat Cushion Lab Sapphire (12.4x10.2x6.9mm – VVS Clarity) with a Sapphire Velvet Pouch.
  • $1111 (Crystal Mother) - Gratitude letter, e-card, all of the ebooks, the Digital Art Package, a Special Thanks listing, Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copies of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 and Volume 2, PLUS one 10.29 Carat Oval Lab Sapphire (14.4x11.3x7.2mm – VVS Clarity) with a Sapphire Velvet Pouch.


The Stretch Goals:

  • If we make $20,000*, the extra money will help to fund the development of Crystal Shade: Afternight and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 3, which are scheduled for 2015/16 releases, respectively. All supporters will receive ebook versions of these two titles.
  • If we make $30,000*, the extra money will help to fund the worldwide distribution, publicity and marketing of Crystal Shade: Afternight and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 3.


  • If we make $35,000*, the extra money will help to fund Crystal Shade: Legends, a folktale collection scheduled for release in 2015/16. Every supporter will receive an ebook version of this title.

  • If we make $40,000+*, the extra money will help to fund a new, modern website and all of the CGI commercials that I intend to make for Crystal Shade. You can check out some of the current licensed trailer music tracks below. Some prototype commercials, animations, illustrations and images can be viewed in the Gallery.

*The stretch goal includes the 4% IndieGogo and the 3-5% PayPal service fees, and the Hungarian taxes.


  • 0:00 - Beyond Daydreams Trailer Music
  • 0:40 - Brave Little Guardian Trailer Music
  • 1:27 - Executrix Angeni Trailer Music
  • 1:55 - Peregrine Clouds Trailer Music

All Tracks Licensed to Crystal Shade. Music Composed by Walperion Music.

What are the formats of the ebooks and Digital Arts Packages?

All of the ebooks will be released in Mobi, EPUB, PDF and Microsoft LIT formats, DRM-free, and zipped for easy delivery and download. The contents of the Digital Arts Packages will be in jpg format, and zipped for easy delivery and download.

Do you ship internationally?

Yes! If your gift requires shipment, I would appreciate it if you could add $15 to help me cover the cost.

When will I get my rewards?

  • Gratitude letter and Crystal Shade e-card (Est. Delivery: max. 7 days).

  • Signed DRM Free ebook of Crystal Shade: Introduction and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 (Est. Delivery: max. 7 days).

  • Signed DRM Free ebook of Crystal Shade: Afterlight and Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2 (Est. Delivery: 2014 Q3-Q4).

  • Digital Art Package (Est. Delivery: max. 7 days).

  • Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copy of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 (Est. Delivery: 2014 February / March).

  • Signed, Dedicated Paperback Copy of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2 (Est. Delivery: 2015 Q1).

  • Sapphires (Est. Delivery: 2014 February / March).


The Sapphires (Perks $444, $888 & $1111):

  • Sapphire of Sun Goddess Sachylia - 3.75 Carat Square Lab Sapphire (8x8x5mm - IF Clarity).


  • Sapphire of Gracius Angenius - 2.23 Carat Asscher Lab Sapphire (6.9x6.9x4.8mm - VVS Clarity).

  • Sapphire of the Sapphire Guardian - 8.58 Carat Cushion Lab Sapphire (12.4x10.2x6.9mm - VVS Clarity).

  • Sapphire of the Crystal Mother - 10.29 Carat Oval Lab Sapphire (14.4x11.3x7.2mm - VVS Clarity).

Other ways you can help:

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family.
  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc…

I thank you from the bottom of my heart for showing interest and helping me to continue the story of Crystal Shade. May the light always shine brightly upon your path.

Istvan Szabo, Ifj.

Creator, Author and Illustrator of Crystal Shade

Click HERE to open the Introductory PDF. Or read the Excerpt, the first full chapter of the first volume HERE.Why is Crystal Shade different? What Auralight Fantasy is?Crystal Shade is for everyone who lives to dream and dreams to live. It is neither a religious nor mainstream angel series, but a timeless story for all ages which explores our souls and the deepest secrets of our dreams. Crystal Shade is an Auralight Fantasy (a.k.a. AuraFantasy or Auralight) which is a new variation on and mix of many genres. While it contains many elements of Epic Fantasy and Young Adult books, along with others from Science Fiction and Steampunk, such as aura-powered flying and other machines and weapons, or a strange world with a blue sun, it also includes various biological-fantastical elements, such as aura beings with superpowers living in the different spirit realms of an otherworldly ancient society. The atmosphere is not just felt, but seen to emanate from the people, places and other living and non-living things. The term Auralight Fantasy was coined to reflect the more overtly fantastical tones of Crystal Shade. While angels and demons play key roles, the series tries to present these mythical and mysterious creatures in a fresh way and to make their characterization less rigid. Because angels, demons, spirits and other religious creatures can sometimes alienate readers, I present them in such a way that everyone can read and enjoy them, regardless of their age, gender, origin or beliefs.
How
long the sequels will be?
Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2, will have nine long chapters, written in the story-within-a-story format and style that I used in the first volume. Prior to the very last rewrite, Volume 2 was approximately 180,000 words long (Volume 1 was roughly 148,000). Crystal Shade: Afterlight involves a different type of storytelling and will number about 5,000 words.
When will the sequels be published? 
My goal is to have the prequel short story, Crystal Shade: Afterlight professionally edited and published by July 7, 2014, the digital edition of Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 2 by November 11, 2014 (the franchise's third birthday), and the paperback by January 15, 2015. In order to accomplish all that, with high-quality releases, worldwide marketing and distribution, I am looking for a few angelic sponsors.Some reviews that made me happy; 
(a.k.a. Reviews of the first book, Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1)"The few and faint shortcomings were greatly overshadowed by the
writer's skill and the originality of the story. One of the few books I've read
where you won't feel you have anything to compare it to."Barnes and Noble Review“I just can't get over how beautiful the language is in this book, it
sets the tone of this otherworldly society so well. It's familiar and yet
foreign. That right there takes a great deal of talent. The imagery that's
described is just breathtaking. I was a bit worried it would put a lot of
religious aspects out there. I was very wrong, and should have jumped on this
as soon as I got it.”Kana, Goodreads Review"This book is a change from everything I've read recently. The story
itself unfolds more gently, the action moving at a slower pace most of the
time. The writing is beautiful. Elegant, even."Rebecca
McKinnon, The Crooked Word"Beautiful writing. A story line that is well thought out."David Allan, Tumbling Books "Crystal Shade: Angeni, Volume 1 is beautifully written with detailed
descriptions of both the people and the world they inhabit. An intriguing and
complex fantasy novel which will leave you breathlessly anticipating the next
Volume." Star, Bibliophilic Book Blog  "A detailed, descriptive and imaginative fantasy story."Krista Burnbright, Cubicle Blindness"The concept is not like anything I have read before which is very
refreshing these days! Crystal Shade is beautifully written with an almost
historical feel to the book. The writing style is, in my opinion, more complex
than other YA writers I have read." Amy, Following the Reader
“Reading Crystal Shade was both an adventure into a complex world of
angels and a thoughtful beautifully written work of art. Seldom do I find a
young adult novel with both a good story which will capture the hearts of its
readers presented with language that will challenge and entrance the reader.
This author has done both. In fact I was so captivated by the story I read it
three times.” Karen Doering, Parent’s Little Black Book
“This was such an interesting story concept for me, I remember when I
received the book for review, and I remember thinking to myself how is a story
being told by a seven year old going to work. I mean even in the YA genre seven
is a little young, I wondered if I was going to be able to identify with the
character, and for me as a reader I need to be able to identify with the
characters in the book. But the book is really so much more than I thought it
was going to be."Kathryn S. Steves, UFR ReviewsThe gift of gratitude you will receive from me in return for your chosen donation:

story:
***********EVENT CANCELLED!!**************

PLEASE DO NOT MAKE ANY MORE DONATIONS!

Fellow grassroots campaigners,
We’re sure you were as surprised as we were when it was announced that the third March and Rally for Independence would not go ahead. There was already much speculation about where it would be, who would be appearing etc.
A small group of Indy campaigners from Facebook was formed, and the previous organisers were contacted, Two out of three were happy to be involved and set out draft plans and costings of what would be needed to proceed with an event. Not a march, just one last get-together for the grassroots campaign, either in mid - September or the original date of 30th August.
Because the Yes Campaign were not involved, the objective seemed straightforward enough; do a crowd funding event to raise the necessary cash from "yessers" everywhere. We were assured that the funding gap was the only problem.
The location of Glasgow Green was chosen after a unanimous vote by the group. We all shared the opinion that we needed to have a positive show of strength in the Undecideds’ heartland.
We also had a Glasgow Councillor who offered to help with the various applications etc. and we were also told that a big name band supporting Independence was already keen to play.
The plan was to run the funding event over two campaigns with the first to achieve £10,000 for intial costs such as public liability insurance, then to use the remaining months to fundraise to cover the costs of staging, lighting etc.

We launched the first funding campaign and were delighted with the response – over a quarter of the money rasised in the first 24 hours!
But then one of our organisers left due to personal problems at that time. Shortly after that, we lost our second organiser.
Today, we seem to have come in for a lot of flak for trying to fund an event that would have been by the Indy people for the Indy people and any undecided friends they could bring along. We have been widely criticised for even attempting to do what we sincerely thought was best. We were saddened that some of the criticism seemed to have come from one someone we had respected in the past, because what we did WITH THE BEST OF INTENTIONS. Grassroots for yes were clear about one thing - we would never have proceeded without two of the original organisers.
Many people have stood up for what we believed in, and we thank you for that. Sadly, because of the division this has created, we have decided that it is best to call a halt to this before it creates any more bad feeling.
At the end of a day we will ALL do WHATEVER it takes so secure a YES vote to secure Scotland’s future.

All monies will be refunded – We have to wait for the 14days to elapse , once the fundraiser is complete ,we will return all donations to their rightful owners.

Saor Alba, best wishes from the Grassroots Team

(EDITED) PLEASE NOTE- We have been contacted by many people who have donated saying that they do not want their money refunded, therefore we have come to the decision  that if people contact us to say they DON'T WISH a refund, THEIR PERSONAL DONATION AMOUNT will be donated to local foodbanks. EVERY OTHER PERSON WILL RECEIVE A REFUND IN FULL. A receipt will be obtained for the foobank donation and will be placed online alongside the names and amounts of each individual donor. This receipt will be visible on the Grassroots Faceook Page as soon as is physically possible.

story:
On September 18th 2014, the people of Scotland, will be asked the question “Should Scotland be an Independent Country”. We believe that YES is the only sensible answer.

We are trying to raise funds for campaign materials for our stalls around Shawlands, to create a public meeting at Langside Halls and other events to ensure everyone has the facts that will help them make an informed decision.

Any help or ideas are gratefully received, please join our group on facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/755197104502081/

story:
I love writing. This is what I've been born to do, this is what I've always dreamed of doing. It's that one thing I feel I'm kind of good at, and that one thing that allows me to be at my best as a human being.

You know, when you're able to give something to others, to offer something to this world. To change the world, to build a new one.

But, unfortunately, book sales have been incredibly low this past months. I've been trying to offer discounts, e-book bundles, but still... it wasn't enough.

I took a part-time job as a waiter, but the job was part time only in terms of pay. I didn't have time to write, and this is, simply put, the worst kind of life for a writer.

So I quit.

I wanted to be able to write, I wanted to be able to blog as often as I used to, to be able to read other people's comments.

There are no perks to go with your donations. All you get is a big perk in case I reach my goal: a compilation of essays on art and writing that will be made available for free.

This is going to be my way of thanking you for your help, and my way to give people something back.

story:
My Name Is André Gallant And I'm Writing A Book.

Why?

The way fishermen along the Georgia coast harvest oysters is about to evolve. Traditions that are 100 or more years old will soon disappear, and that's not a bad thing. It'll mean jobs and a preserved coastal marsh. I'll be reporting from the coast to tell this distinctly Georgia story about fishing communities, oysters, economics and the environment. I need your help to fund my reporting and writing of a book length project that will be published in fall 2016. Both the oystermen and I will be happy you helped tell the story. I'm tentatively titling it "The High Low Tide."

You can also help by sharing this campaign on social media. You can use the following short link and hashtag: http://bit.ly/oysterbook and #HighLowTide.

My grandfather was a lobster fisherman, and I grew up near Malpeque Bay, home to Prince Edward Island's famous oysters. I've always wanted to write a story about people like my grandfather, men and women who made a life for their families by laboring on the sea.

Living and reporting in Athens, in the foothills of northeast Georgia, this was not likely to happen. 
I've reported stories on refugees, immigration, farmers and cooks, all subjects close to my heart, but I've longed as a storyteller to head to the coast and find a few heroes to immortalize in book form. 
Two years ago I met some of Georgia's oystermen. Since then I've travelled down to the coast a few times, making stops between Savannah and St. Mary's. I've fallen in love with the marsh, the watermen and the shellfish they harvest.
I now have the opportunity to write a book about oysters and the Georgia coast. Here's what it's about:
The next few years are precarious for the coast. Oysters are wild harvested there just as they were 100 years ago. But threats loom for this natural bounty: development, climate change and other rural economic challenges. Luckily, scientists and environmentalists are racing to save the coast, and the oystermen.


Oysters are on everyone’s lips these days; they’re a wet and briny food trend that’s been garnering attention over the last decade. This boom results from two major factors: The rise of farmed oysters (oyster aquaculture) and increased ecological protection of the nation’s oyster-producing estuaries. Once a dominant location in the oyster industry, the southeastern coast of the U.S. has not reared a modern oyster crop that grabs restaurateur and eater attention like a Wellfleet or a Malpeque. But that may soon change. Oyster farming along the North Carolina and Alabama coasts is increasing, just as oil spill-addled estuaries in Louisiana, and overharvested ones in Florida, are starting to wane. But Georgia, once home to a buoyant oyster industry, has been a laggard. That, too, is starting to change. It will take the hard-headed efforts of university marine scientists and the hard-working sweat of the blue-collar fishing industry to build a sustainable oyster crop that benefits both economy and ecology. This book will document that partnership.

Oyster aquaculture has been an oft-covered topic in the last four years. But the reporting has only marveled at the industry’s appearance; it arrived without notice. I’m interested in writing a book that documents how a marine-based industry is created from the beginning, done so in a creative nonfiction format for a general audience. My book will be distinguished by its detailed attention to an often faceless part of society: watermen, those salty fishermen who bring oysters, clams and fish to market, and the marine scientists, government officials and eco-advocates that seek to help them. 
After beginning reporting this book, talking to the watermen who'll be featured in it, I've realized the attention this book could bring to the coast and the oyster industry. Watermen, as folks who make their living on the coast are called, don't feel the state of Georgia is ready to support and promote the local seafood industry, especially oysters. They need help, and this book could attract the right kind of aid. They believe the book will help, and so do I.

Why I Need Your Help

My book proposal is currently under serious review with an important publisher of books about Georgia, the South, foodways and the like. It's pretty much the perfect home for this book, and I'll be updating this campaign with news as that progresses. 

While there will be an advance for the book, as a first time author I don't command anywhere near the amount it will take to report this story to the extent that I feel it deserves. So I'm coming to you, my community close and far, for help.

I've set the minimum for this campaign at $2000. Really, though, I need much more. The money goes to travel expenses mostly, and the more I am able to receive, the more locations I can visit and the more time I can spend there interviewing and photographing. In order to deliver this book in a timely manner, I'll need to be able to focus on it at least part time. Your funding will help me devote time to drafting, editing and research. Raising close to $10,000 would help me write the book I envision in a very timely fashion.

As my first coastal trips have shown, I need a bit of insurance tucked in there soon. My photography equipment is always at risk when I'm on a boat. My equipment is also aging, and recent trips are beginning to wreak havoc on it. I need to be ready to replace parts of my camera set-up. 

For helping me out I've set up some perks. You'll be able to go behind the scenes on my reporting process, get a cool t-shirt, get your own print of an oyster-related photograph, be thanked personally via handshake, on the Internet and even in my book. There's a chance to hang out with me, some cool chefs and some local oysters at a private party. 


    The Impact

    There's a lot of oyster journalism out there.   There's nothing really whiz-bang new in my book in terms of bivalves and their farming. What I'm trying to do is employ my skills as a narrative journalist to tell the story about the PEOPLE who bring oysters to our roasts and restaurants. In some ways I see this book as a people's history only told right now before it's too late. 

    By contributing to this project you stand to spur two things: a successful oyster industry in Georgia and helping me reach the next stage in my writing career. 

    In my reporting career I've tried to shine a light on people too often left on the margins of society. I'm asking you to help me shine the light.

      Risks & Challenges

      Perhaps the biggest challenge to completing my goal is time. I have a young family, I'm very active in my daughter's life, and I work to be as supportive of my wife's career as she is of mine. It is my dream to write books. The biggest challenge this year is making sure I can afford time to devote to writing, parenting and working all equally. Anyone who knows me, though, knows I hustle and never, ever, never ask for help. I'm sure I can accomplish all this without any help, but I might drive myself and my family crazy. Please help us not make that a reality.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        I'm okay with social media, but I'm not great. If you can't contribute, perhaps consider talking to everyone that you know about this project. Have a website or a blog that is either writing, food or farming related (heck, anything really)? Let's set up some kind of story to help promote the project. Again, I need your help and I'll take whatever you can offer. Here's the short link and hashtag again: 

        http://bit.ly/oysterbook and #HighLowTide

        Thank you for reading and considering these oysters,

        André Joseph Gallant

I’m interested in writing a book that documents how a marine-based industry is created from the beginning, done so in a creative nonfiction format for a general audience. My book will be distinguished by its detailed attention to an often faceless part of society: watermen, those salty fishermen who bring oysters, clams and fish to market, and the marine scientists, government officials and eco-advocates that seek to help them. 
After beginning reporting this book, talking to the watermen who'll be featured in it, I've realized the attention this book could bring to the coast and the oyster industry. Watermen, as folks who make their living on the coast are called, don't feel the state of Georgia is ready to support and promote the local seafood industry, especially oysters. They need help, and this book could attract the right kind of aid. They believe the book will help, and so do I.   Why I Need Your Help
My book proposal is currently under serious review with an important publisher of books about Georgia, the South, foodways and the like. It's pretty much the perfect home for this book, and I'll be updating this campaign with news as that progresses. 
While there will be an advance for the book, as a first time author I don't command anywhere near the amount it will take to report this story to the extent that I feel it deserves. So I'm coming to you, my community close and far, for help.
I've set the minimum for this campaign at $2000. Really, though, I need much more. The money goes to travel expenses mostly, and the more I am able to receive, the more locations I can visit and the more time I can spend there interviewing and photographing. In order to deliver this book in a timely manner, I'll need to be able to focus on it at least part time. Your funding will help me devote time to drafting, editing and research. Raising close to $10,000 would help me write the book I envision in a very timely fashion.
As my first coastal trips have shown, I need a bit of insurance tucked in there soon. My photography equipment is always at risk when I'm on a boat. My equipment is also aging, and recent trips are beginning to wreak havoc on it. I need to be ready to replace parts of my camera set-up. 
For helping me out I've set up some perks. You'll be able to go behind the scenes on my reporting process, get a cool t-shirt, get your own print of an oyster-related photograph, be thanked personally via handshake, on the Internet and even in my book. There's a chance to hang out with me, some cool chefs and some local oysters at a private party. 

  

The Impact There's a lot of oyster journalism out there.   There's nothing really whiz-bang new in my book in terms of bivalves and their farming. What I'm trying to do is employ my skills as a narrative journalist to tell the story about the PEOPLE who bring oysters to our roasts and restaurants. In some ways I see this book as a people's history only told right now before it's too late. 
By contributing to this project you stand to spur two things: a successful oyster industry in Georgia and helping me reach the next stage in my writing career. 
In my reporting career I've tried to shine a light on people too often left on the margins of society. I'm asking you to help me shine the light.

  Risks & Challenges Perhaps the biggest challenge to completing my goal is time. I have a young family, I'm very active in my daughter's life, and I work to be as supportive of my wife's career as she is of mine. It is my dream to write books. The biggest challenge this year is making sure I can afford time to devote to writing, parenting and working all equally. Anyone who knows me, though, knows I hustle and never, ever, never ask for help. I'm sure I can accomplish all this without any help, but I might drive myself and my family crazy. Please help us not make that a reality.

  Other Ways You Can Help I'm okay with social media, but I'm not great. If you can't contribute, perhaps consider talking to everyone that you know about this project. Have a website or a blog that is either writing, food or farming related (heck, anything really)? Let's set up some kind of story to help promote the project. Again, I need your help and I'll take whatever you can offer. Here's the short link and hashtag again: 
http://bit.ly/oysterbook and #HighLowTide
Thank you for reading and considering these oysters,
André Joseph Gallant

story:
¿Qué?

Hikikomori, el amor en los tiempos del wifi es el reflejo de una sociedad cansada de sí misma y embebida por el hastío inherente a la existencia; es, en definitiva, un guiño lleno de sarcasmo para con lo que es o no es políticamente correcto.

Hikikomori trata sobre el amor en los tiempos del wifi. El protagonista es un individuo peculiar, en ocasiones repelente. Nadie diría que es exitoso en ninguna faceta de su vida, y se diría bien, pero su orgullo y personalidad se mantienen más o menos incólumes. Su amor propio depende mucho del amor en mayúsculas, pero es una faceta cuya resolución también le es esquiva a pesar de los ocasionales esfuerzos (rara vez sobrio).

Los capítulos de esta novela, hasta cierto punto, pueden leerse como relatos cortos conectados. Desgranan las vicisitudes de este personaje en los ambientes que frecuenta: casa, bares y biblioteca (en orden de prioridad). El telón de fondo son sus titubeantes escarceos con el bello sexo que, en su caso, suele ser el femenino. Y que tienen lugar en el chat, primordialmente, donde también aturde a débiles pero no inmaculadas mentes preadolescentes.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Iker Pedrosa.

Iker Pedrosa Ucero, nació en Donostia–San Sebastián y creció en Miranda de Ebro, provincia de Burgos. Tiene 33 años. Es licenciado en Filosofía y en Psicología. Ha publicado en diferentes revistas de divulgación cultural y literaria, como en Pidgin, Soliloquio y Revolución Neolítica, y otras. Ha sido seleccionado en diversas antologías de poesía y relato corto, y ha obtenido menos premios literarios de los que hubiera querido.

Escribe una columna de opinión en el periódico Vive Miranda.

Ha publicado un libro de relatos titulado A un verso de Jim Morrison, Ed. Alhulia, 2009, el poemario Muerte del rey soldado de Rohan (Premio del XXVII Certamen Poético “Ángel Martínez Baigorri” 2010), Ed. Fecit, 2012 y otro poemario, Sith Vicious, Ed. Libros del aire, 2014.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Hikikomori, el amor en los tiempos del wifi que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Iker Pedrosa vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
A Little Bit About Us:

The idea of HYRSTERIA started a bit over two years ago when we began talking about issues we as, Latina women and artists, were experiencing.  While our artistic partnertship grew so did the idea of creating a publication that focused on the stories of diverse groups of artists and writers. Even though these issues are global, and experienced by many, we decided to focus our efforts on highlighting the voices of creators in our own community of Baltimore, Maryland.
 

Where you come in:

We are so excited about this second issue, that we started planning it as soon as we launched the first one.  We have gathered writers and artists and now we need your help! Your contribution will go towards the production of 300 high-quality copies and a small run of special editions with a handmade touch. Part of the money will also go towards paying all of our awesome artists, writers, and contributors. Not to mention we will use some of the collaboration to make totes, posters, pins, and patches.

 

What We've Done So Far:

In the spring of 2015 we were able to launch and publish HYRSTERIA'S first issue with the support of The Contemporary’s Grit Fund and the Andy Warhol foundation. Thanks to that we were able to make high-quality copies of our zine, pay a modest fee to our writers, artists, and collaborators. 

Now, HYRSTERIA can be found in some independent bookstores in Maryland and New York. We have also participated in various zine and book festivals around the East Coast.

 

 

For support  to HYRSTERIA you could receive some of our cool perks:

HYRSTERIA Sticker

HYRSTERIA  Buttons

HYRSTERIA  Patches

Screen printed posters with artwork from out contributors

Screen printed tote bags with artwork from out contributors

*the artwork displayed in the pictures is from artists of the 1st issue of HYRSTERIA. The one  that will be used in the merchandise will be from artists of the 2nd issue.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help to spread the wor. So please, ask people you know, family, friends, to get the word out and make some noise about HYRSTERIA.

Lo Scarabeo is a leading Italian publisher specialized in Tarot decks.

Tarot Compendium is our fundamental guide to the Tarot World, Volume 3. A comprehensive work about Tarot symbolism, rituals, history, art.

 



The book will be printed in October, and you can pre-order your copy here.

Tarot Compendium is the third and final volume of our Tarot Encyclopedia project.

Tarot Compendium is the final book in the series, and will build on the base established by Tarot Fundamentals and Tarot Experience, in order to guide its reader towards more advanced content.

Compendium is the book in which all the esoteric and other information is compiled. Need the astrological association of the Page of Wands? Curious about how Kabalah relates to the Tarot deck? Itching to take a peek at the Esoteric Functions of the cards? How are the Four Medieval Humors associated with Tarot? All of this will be in Tarot Compendium. You’ll never have to Google that information again.

We are also offering you the opportunity to pre-order one copy of the limited edition Etteilla Tarot deck that we will print at the same time of the book. We only have a few copies left, so this pre-ordering opportunity is limited.


 

To celebrate Tarot Compendium and the 30st anniversary of our Publishing House, we will print a limited edition of the historical reproduction of an ancient Tarot Etteilla deck.

story:
Dear Reader:

My name is Peter Whyte, and I write holiday stories for mature children and immature adults. 

My first book, The Toymaker, is about to be released this December. It's the story of a greedy Toymaker who kidnaps an elf on Christmas Eve in an attempt to take over the North Pole (click here for a preview). If you love holiday adventures, I'm here to ask for your support. 

   

 

What I Need & What You Get

Publishing is more expensive than you might think. I've built my own "workshop" from the ground up and hired the most talented people I know to bring this tale to life. 

I'm asking for $4500 to cover the following three costs: 

  1. Finishing the technical mumbo jumbo associated with digital conversions
  2. Paying back the exceptional artists who were involved
  3. Marketing (the more money I raise, the more contests, games, and promos I can concoct)

"But what about the supporters?" you're crying. "What about our perks?!"

Well, since my undying gratitude isn't worth much according to your accountant, you'll receive an array of exciting perks to pack under your tree on Christmas morning. 

*Note: You can get the postcard by donating a minimum of $5 OR by endorsing this campaign on Facebook and/or Twitter. If you choose to share some social media love, email proof (account name or a screenshot) to whytebooks@gmail.com and I'll mail you your card in return.

 

Release Date Details

The Toymaker will be available in paperback on or before December 1st, 2012, and shipping will be dealt with daily to ensure you receive the book as soon as possible. The eBook and audiobook will be available by direct download shortly after the paperback is released.

I promise that the elves are working as fast as they can to get the book to you post-haste. Rest assured, if you order before December 15th, you'll have the paperback in time for Xmas. If you order after December 15th, I can't make any guarantees. Note: If you're outside North America, please contact me for shipping details.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign (remember, you’ll get the postcard if you share this page on Facebook or Twitter). Hint: the share buttons are up at the top.
  • Follow me on Facebook, Twitter, and Pinterest
  • Visit www.whytetales.com and share the short tales (they're free!)
  • Subscribe to the Peter Whyte email list for project updates, special offers, and general mischief (see bottom of page)

Bottom Line

"The Toymaker" is for readers with vivid imaginations – for sparky parents and holiday addicts and anyone who still checks the night sky for a fat man in a flying sleigh. If you believe in holiday magic, please help this story find its way into hearts, minds, and iPads this Christmas season. 

 

Sincerely,

story:
Short Summary…

The Foundation for Human Movement Studies has partnered with Indiegogo to develop a fundraising campaign to support Jeanne Bergen as she completes her book, The Skier’s Universe. The book, which is three-quarters written, explores the sport of skiing from many directions and introduces the principles of Spacial Dynamics® as taught by Jaimen McMillan and the Spacial Dynamics Institute. Funds raised will support Jeanne as she completes her research and refines her spatial observations on the ski slopes (especially as they apply to ski technique), drawing on her background as a student of Spacial Dynamics. Funding will help support her work and create a book that is accessible to the public, to skiers, and to people interested in both Spacial Dynamics and movement in general.

 

A little about Jeanne…

Jeanne was one of the founders of what became the Hawthorne Valley Association (including the Hawthorne Valley Farm and Hawthorne Valley Waldorf School) in Harlemville, N.Y.  She wore various hats, doing administrative and development work, acting as the community’s first vegetable gardener, working with children in what is now the Visiting Students Program, and teaching high-school biology. Jeanne also designed and led a cross-country ski program and later an ice-skating program.  In 1978, searching for a movement discipline to complement skiing and ski teaching, to train balance, fluidity, and spatial awareness, she traveled to Stuttgart, Germany, to take the Bothmer gymnastic training, where she met Jaimen McMillan. She helped organize the first Waldorf physical-education curriculum conference with Jaimen in 1986, which was followed by annual summer conferences. Jeanne administered the formation of the first Spacial Dynamics Institute (SDI) In-Service Training Program in 1989 (though SDI was initially called Spatial Studies Institute, or SSI). She served as SDI’s administrator until 2002, helping to form and build the SDI organization and contribute to the spreading of the ideas and principles behind Spacial Dynamics  Jeanne has been a serious skier, interested in the technical, historical, and spiritual aspects of skiing, for several decades. She is an expert skier and enjoys skiing serious western terrain, including powder. 

 

What you can help us achieve…

Developing the funding to complete this book is an important step towards getting it published and out into the world.  We hope that the book will increase public exposure to Spacial Dynamics, resonating with skiers’ own experiences, and interest them in the principles of Spacial Dynamics. In Jeanne's words “I started making notes for this book over 30 years ago. I could not have written it without a background in Spacial Dynamics.”  We want to help Jeanne bring deeper insights and new levels of awareness to the sport of skiing. We hope you will find this a worthy goal, because with your support we can fund Jeanne to see this book completed!

 

What is needed…

Here is a breakdown of the funding needed for Jeanne to complete the research, observations, and writing to finish The Skier's Universe: 

$2,880 - Stipend for living Expenses (12 weeks, 12 hours per week, $20 per hour)

$570 - Eastern ski area lift tickets

$570 - Western ski area passes and lift tickets

$310 - Indigogo and Credit Card surcharges

$402 - FHMS Overhead 

$4,732 - Total Request* 

* Additional funding beyond $4,732 could enhance research for The Skier's Universe and enable Jeanne to branch out a bit, for example renting and testing the latest super-fat and reverse-sidecut equipment and pursuing some additional therapies to be evaluated in the chapter called “Spatial Strategies for Injuries”.

 

Looking ahead to publication:

●Up to $2,400 could allow for plentiful illustrations and diagrams throughout the book;

●Up to $4,800 could allow for a professional videographer to develop online video footage to supplement descriptions, illustrations, and diagrams in the text;

●Up to $15,000 could allow for immediate self-publishing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help…

Even if you can’t make a financial contribution at the moment, it doesn’t mean you can't help. We will need to connect with the right publisher, for example. If you have a publishing contact, and think they might be interested in The Skier's Universe, please let us know. Although we have several leads, publication has yet to be resolved.  Additionally, Jeanne is looking for a professional illustrator to handle some of the diagrams and illustrations needed for the book. If you have such skills, or know of someone who does, please get in touch with us. Lastly, if you have friends, family, or colleagues who may be motivated to see this project a success, please forward this address to them so they can help support us: www.indiegogo.com/fhms-skiing

Short Summary…
The Foundation for Human Movement Studies has partnered with Indiegogo to develop a fundraising campaign to support Jeanne Bergen as she completes her book, The Skier’s Universe. The book, which is three-quarters written, explores the sport of skiing from many directions and introduces the principles of Spacial Dynamics® as taught by Jaimen McMillan and the Spacial Dynamics Institute. Funds raised will support Jeanne as she completes her research and refines her spatial observations on the ski slopes (especially as they apply to ski technique), drawing on her background as a student of Spacial Dynamics. Funding will help support her work and create a book that is accessible to the public, to skiers, and to people interested in both Spacial Dynamics and movement in general.
 
A little about Jeanne…
Jeanne was one of the founders of what became the Hawthorne Valley Association (including the Hawthorne Valley Farm and Hawthorne Valley Waldorf School) in Harlemville, N.Y.  She wore various hats, doing administrative and development work, acting as the community’s first vegetable gardener, working with children in what is now the Visiting Students Program, and teaching high-school biology. Jeanne also designed and led a cross-country ski program and later an ice-skating program.  In 1978, searching for a movement discipline to complement skiing and ski teaching, to train balance, fluidity, and spatial awareness, she traveled to Stuttgart, Germany, to take the Bothmer gymnastic training, where she met Jaimen McMillan. She helped organize the first Waldorf physical-education curriculum conference with Jaimen in 1986, which was followed by annual summer conferences. Jeanne administered the formation of the first Spacial Dynamics Institute (SDI) In-Service Training Program in 1989 (though SDI was initially called Spatial Studies Institute, or SSI). She served as SDI’s administrator until 2002, helping to form and build the SDI organization and contribute to the spreading of the ideas and principles behind Spacial Dynamics  Jeanne has been a serious skier, interested in the technical, historical, and spiritual aspects of skiing, for several decades. She is an expert skier and enjoys skiing serious western terrain, including powder. 
 
What you can help us achieve…
Developing the funding to complete this book is an important step towards getting it published and out into the world.  We hope that the book will increase public exposure to Spacial Dynamics, resonating with skiers’ own experiences, and interest them in the principles of Spacial Dynamics. In Jeanne's words “I started making notes for this book over 30 years ago. I could not have written it without a background in Spacial Dynamics.”  We want to help Jeanne bring deeper insights and new levels of awareness to the sport of skiing. We hope you will find this a worthy goal, because with your support we can fund Jeanne to see this book completed!
 
What is needed…
Here is a breakdown of the funding needed for Jeanne to complete the research, observations, and writing to finish The Skier's Universe: 
$2,880 - Stipend for living Expenses (12 weeks, 12 hours per week, $20 per hour)
$570 - Eastern ski area lift tickets
$570 - Western ski area passes and lift tickets
$310 - Indigogo and Credit Card surcharges
$402 - FHMS Overhead 
$4,732 - Total Request* 
* Additional funding beyond $4,732 could enhance research for The Skier's Universe and enable Jeanne to branch out a bit, for example renting and testing the latest super-fat and reverse-sidecut equipment and pursuing some additional therapies to be evaluated in the chapter called “Spatial Strategies for Injuries”.

●Up to $2,400 could allow for plentiful illustrations and diagrams throughout the book;
●Up to $4,800 could allow for a professional videographer to develop online video footage to supplement descriptions, illustrations, and diagrams in the text;
